loans.name: Laxmi

texts.en:
Laxmi N. lives in a single family with her husband and two children in Dhalko, Kathmandu. Dhalko is one of the busy cities of the Kathmandu district. Most of the people in this region are engaged in small businesses.

Mrs N. opened her tailoring shop four years ago. She took six months of training for tailoring work. She prefers to make ladies dress like blouses, Kurta-Sulwar, and so on. She also makes school uniforms for boys and girls.

Due to a lack of funds she cannot expand her business so she is requesting a loan of Rs 10000.00 to buy raw material for her work.

Mrs N.’s husband's name is Chudan N. and he works in a hardware store on salary basis. Her son is studying in BBS and daughter is studying in grade 10. Her great wish is to live as the middle class family.

loans.use: To buy raw material for her tailoring business.

loans.name: Shirjana

texts.en:
Mrs Shirjana L. lives in Dhalko, Kathmandu. She lives in a single family with her husband Mr Manoj L. and one daughter. Her husband is a security officer and her daughter is in primary school.

Mrs L. opened a grocery shop two years ago to uplift the living standard of her family. Their condition is not good, so they can't provide a better education for her daughter. In Nepal the cost of education is very high comparative to the income. To overcome this problem she opens grocery shop.

Due to lack of funds she can’t buy goods in her shop. So she is asking for her first loan of Rs 10000.00 to buy goods like rice, dal, noodles, and other items. She intends to spend the income to provide better education for her daughter and to help her husband upgrade the quality of life of their family.

loans.use: To buy grocery items for her shop

loans.name: Estrida

texts.en: Estrida N. is from Kyela Mbeya, Tanzania.  She is 35 years old, married, and has four children between the ages of five and 19.  In 2008, Estrida established her red palm extraction business with the help of SELFINA, an organization that works towards the economic empowerment of women in Tanzania through sale and leaseback agreements for small farmers. Estrida now requires a new loan of $175 in order to buy more red palm in bulk.

loans.use: To buy more stock of red palm in bulk.

loans.name: Kamala

texts.en:
Mrs Kamala S. lives in a single family with her husband and three children in Sanepa, Lalitpur. Her daughter is studying in grade 4 and her sons are in primary school. Most of the people in this region are engaged in small businesses.

Mrs S. and her husband Mr Udap S. opened their small hotel two years ago. They sell different varieties of Nepali and Newari foods in their hotels. They prefer to make Newari food because Newari food is very popular in their area.

Due to a lack of funds they cannot expand their business, so Mrs S. is requesting her first loan of Rs 10000.00 to buy food materials for her business.

loans.use: To buy foodstuffs for her  business.

loans.name: Ssekabira Ismah, Kavule Effort Group

texts.en: David K. and Ismah Sekabira joined Kavule Effort together and this is their first year with the group. David sells green bananas from Mukono Central market and he would like to buy more to sell in his stall with the loan. Ismah is a motorcyclist locally known as "boda boda" at Nabuti stage in Mukono and he is the group's chairman. He plans to repair his motorcycle and also to partly complete payment on his children’s school fees.

loans.use: Ismah would repair his motorcycle and pay his children’s school fees. David would buy more green bananas for his stall.

loans.name: Kamala

texts.en:
Mrs Kamala P., 18 years old, is a tailor in the town of Sanepa in Kathmandu. She lives with her husband Mr Amrit P. who works in a private office.

Mrs P. opened her tailoring shop a year ago. Her specialty is making custom-fitted ladies dresses and school uniforms for both boys and girls. She prefers to make popular dresses like Kurta Sulwar, blouse, ladies long dress, Makhshi, and others. Before starting her own business, Mrs P. took a six-month training course in tailoring.

Mrs. Paiyar is requesting a loan of Rs 10000. She plans to use the loan to buy raw materials for her tailoring work.

loans.use: To buy raw material for her tailoring business.

loans.name: Bupe

texts.en: Bupe M. is from Kyela Mbeya, Tanzania.  She is 32 years old, married, and has two children aged ten and 13.  Bupe also cares for three dependents, who live with her because otherwise they would be street children. In 1998, Bupe established a crops business with the help of SELFINA, an organization that works towards the economic empowerment of women in Tanzania through sale and leaseback agreements for small farmers.  She now requires a new loan of $250 in order to buy more stock of crops in bulk.

loans.use: To buy more stock of crops in bulk.

loans.name: Chari

texts.en:
Mrs Chari L., 20 years old, is a tailor in the town of Dhalko. She opened her tailoring shop a year ago. Her specialty is making custom-fitted ladies dresses like the Kurta Sulwar, which are very popular among Nepali women.

Before starting her own business, Mrs Nalarmi took a 6-month training course in tailoring from a tailor shop nearby .

Now she seeks a loan of Rs 10000.00 to buy raw materials for her tailoring work. She wants to use the shop's income for the improvement of her family. Her husband's name is Santosh L. and he is a taxi driver who drives his taxi in the Kathmandu valley.

loans.use: To buy raw material for her tailoring business.

loans.name: Laxmi

texts.en:
Mrs Laxmi B., 40 years old, lives in a single family with her husband Mr Achut B. and three children. Her husband is a security guard in a private office. Her older daughter works in a motorcycle workshop, her son is studying in grade 10 and her younger daughter is studying in grade7.

Mrs Laxmi already owns a cow and she has been selling milk for some time. In Nepal pure, fresh cow’s milk is highly valued for its nutrition. Mrs Laxmi lives in a growing neighborhood and in that area the demand for milk is increasing.

She carries her milk containers and sells door to door daily in the morning and evening. Because of the rising demand, she wants to buy another cow to increase her production so she seeks a loan of Rs 30000.00. Mrs Laxmi plans to purchase a Jersey cow which produces more milk than the normal cows.

loans.use: To buy another young milk-giving cow.

loans.name: Razia

texts.en:
Razia I. lives in a big city of Pakistan, Lahore. She was married eleven years ago and has three kids: two girls and one boy. Her elder daughter is seven years old and attends a local school and her son attends kindergarten, whereas her younger daughter is not of school going-age yet .

Razia is borrowing for the first time from a microfinance institution: Asasah, Pakistan. Her husband has had a construction supplies business for the last twelve years. They will use the loan to improve their business further and will buy construction supplies to increase their inventory.

loans.use: Buy construction supplies in bulk for re-sale

loans.name: Tusekilege

texts.en:
Mambo from kyela mbeya, Tanzania! This is 46 year-old Tusekelege  K..  She is widow, and has 5 children aged Between 9 and 19. She has 1 dependents, who live with her because he is disabled.  In 2007, Tusekelege  established her crops business.  She is now requires a new loan in order to buy more stock of crops in bulk. She thanks you for your support.  

SELFINA is engaged in economic empowerment of women in Tanzania through leasing and leaseback facility as a practical way to achieve the economic and social emancipation of women.

SELFINA has taken a lead role as a pioneer of micro-credit in Tanzania through Micro-Leasing. Customs and traditions in Tanzania normally make it difficult for women to own land and assets, thus they are termed not-creditworthy by financial institutions as they lack tangible collateral assets. This leads to poor financial support hence poor access to basic needs and services for women with low incomes.

SELFINA buys and leases equipment to women. Where a client needs working capital SELFINA buys equipment from said client, extending a loan to her, then leasing back the same equipment – a process called a sale and leaseback arrangement.

loans.use: To buy more stock of crops in bulk.

loans.name: Radhika

texts.en:
Mrs Radhika T., 42 years old lady, lives in Bhaishipati, Lalitpur. Her husband's name is Manar T. and he is a farmer. Her younger son is a taxi driver and her daughter is studying in grade 11.

Mrs Radhika has been selling cows’ milk for the past three months. She already owns a cow. Now she is requesting a loan of Rs 30000.00 to buy another young cow to sell milk in local area, because she lives in a growing neighborhood and in that area the demand for milk is increasing. In Nepal people love to drink cow's milks so demand for milk is increasing constantly.

loans.use: To buy young milk-giving cow.

loans.name: Khursheed

texts.en: My name is Khursheed B. and I live in Lahore, the second largest city in Pakistan. I am married and a mother of five: three boys and two girls. My husband and sons run a breakfast stall business. They want to increase their business and want to start an additional stall, which will serve to double our income. To start an additional stall they need to buy peas and lentils, pickles, and other spices in bulk; they will also buy some crockery as well. I plan to save extra profits from their business for my kids’ marriages. (In the picture Khursheed is standing with her daughter.)

loans.use: Start an additional breakfast stall

loans.name: Rita

texts.en:
Mrs Rita T., 28 years old, lives in Bhaishipati, Lalitpur. She lives in a single family with four members including herself. Her husband's name is Krishna Kumar T. and he is a farmer. Her sons are studying in primary school.

Mrs T. opened her tailoring shop a year ago. Her specialty is making custom-fitted ladies dresses and school uniforms for both boys and girls. She prefers to make popular dresses like Kurta Sulwar, blouse, ladies' long dress, Makhshi, and others. Before starting her own business, Mrs T. took a six-month training course in tailoring.

Mrs T. is requesting a Rs 15000.00 loan. She plans to use the loan to buy raw materials for her tailoring work.

loans.use: To buy raw materials for her tailoring business.

loans.name: Neru

texts.en:
Mrs Neru K. lives in Sainbu-Bhaishapati, Lalitpur. She lives in a single family with her husband Mr Bhai Krishna K., and three children. Her daughters are studying in grades 12, 10 and 8 respectively.

Mrs K. opened a grocery shop two years ago to uplift the living standard of her family. Their condition is not good, so they can't provide better education for the children. In Nepal the cost of education is very high comparative to the income. To overcome this problem she opens grocery shop.

Due to lack of funds she can’t buy goods in her shop. So she is asking for Rs 30000.00 loan to buy goods like rice, dal, noodles, and other items.

She wishes to spend her income to provide better education for her children and to help her husband to upgrade the quality of life of their family.

loans.use: To buy grocery items for her shop

loans.name: Amina's Taifa Group

texts.en:
Amina is 24 years old and is a married woman with 2 children, ages 7 and 4 years old. She and her husband also take care of two other people, ages 20 and 19 years old. Amina owns a small cafe, a business she started in 2005. Every day, she works from 8am to 11:30pm at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $52 from her sales.

She now hopes for a loan to buy more food items for her cafe. She will share this loan with her subgroup members Aisha, Zaituni, Jenifer, and Stela, who have businesses dealing in charcoal sales, clothes sales, and grains wholesales.

loans.use: To buy more food items for her cafe

loans.name: Ilhom

texts.ru:
Ilhom H. lives in the Rudaki region. He is 36 years old, married, and has 3 children. He has specialized education. By training, he is an elementary school teacher. He works in school #19 in the Rudaki region and teaches machine shop class. In addition, he has his own shop where he repairs household electronics. At the moment, Ilhom wants to purchase a welder, which will help him to attract new customers. That is why he is asking for a $450 loan. He plans to pay off the loan within 12 months.

Translated from Russian by Vasilisa Budnikova, Kiva Volunteer.

Хамиджанов Илхом житель района Рудаки.Возраст 36 лет, женат , имеет 3 детей. Образование средне-профессиональное. По специальности учитель начальных классов.Работает в средней школе №19 района Рудаки, преподает уроки труда .Кроме того имеет свою мастерскую по ремонту бытовой техники . Сейчас Илхом хочет купить сварочный аппарат ,что поможет ему привлечь новых клиентов.Для этого ему необходимо получить кредит в размере 450 $. Погасить кредит планирует в течении 12 месяцев

loans.use: To purchase a welder

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for MLF HUMO - Oct 24, 2008)

loans.name: Lucy's Taifa Group

texts.en:
Lucy is a married woman with 3 children, with ages ranging from 14 to 20. Lucy is a clothes seller, and she started her business in 2006. Every day, she works from 8am to 6pm at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $60 from her sales.

She now hopes for a loan to buy more clothes for her business. She will share this loan with her subgroup members Mwanaisha, Lambeta, Zaituni, and Swaumu, who have businesses in clothing sales.

loans.use: To buy more clothes for her business.

loans.name: Kishwer

texts.en:
I am Kishwer A., wife of A. Ali. We reside in Lahore, the second largest city in Pakistan. I have no kids and my husband has a construction supplies business.

I was married when I was in grade eleven and had to quit my studies. Now with my husband’s permission I have resumed my studies and hope to obtain a bachelor's degree in future. If I am successful in my studies, I plan to opt for teaching as my profession. My husband is the only breadwinner of the family and needs to expand his business by purchasing more construction supplies. We need a loan of US$ 475 for this purpose.

loans.use: Expand construction supplies business

loans.name: Dilorom

texts.ru:
Dilorom F. lives in the Rudaki region. She is 35 years old, married, and has 6 children. She has secondary education. Dilorom takes care of the household and livestock. She purchases young cattle at a local market, feeds it for 40 to 45 days, and resells it at a market. Her husband is temporarily unemployed so he helps Dilorom. For that reason, livestock farming is the main source of income for their large family. At the moment, Dilorom wants to buy 2 young bulls as they currently sell at lower prices. She plans to pay off her loan within 12 months.

Translated from Russian by Vasilisa Budnikova, Kiva Volunteer.

Фахритдинова Дилором жительница района Рудаки. Возраст 35 лет, замужем , имеет 6 детей. Образование среднее. Дилором домохозяйка ,она занимается животноводством. Она покупает на местном рынке молодых бычков , откармливает их 40-45 дней и продает их на рынке.Муж клиентки временно не работает,он помогает Дилором. Животноводство является основным источником дохода их большой семьи.В данный момент клиентка хочет кунить 2 бычков для откормки,так как сейчас бычки на рынке стоят дешевле. Планирует погасить кредит в течении 12 месяцев.

loans.use: To purchase additional livestock

loans.name: Hina

texts.en:
Hina S. was married fifteen years ago and lives with her family in Lahore, the second largest city in Pakistan. She has six kids: five boys and one girl. Four of her kids attend a local school, whereas the younger two are not of school-going age yet. Both she and her husband wish their kids to finish school and find good jobs for themselves.

Hina's husband is a builder and he paints buildings in a special way known as "grapy auto," whereas she is a teacher at a local school. Her husband has been in this business for the last fifteen years and has eight workers to help him in the business. Hina is requesting you to grant her a loan of $475 to expand their business further.

loans.use: expand their construction business

loans.name: Zubeda's Jiliwaze Group

texts.en:
Zubeda is a married woman with one child, age 8 years old. She and her husband also take care of one other child, age 12. Zubeda owns a small radio shop. She started her business in 2005. Every day, she works from 8am to 5pm at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $75 from her sales.

She now hopes for a loan to buy more radios for her business. She will share this loan with her subgroup members Mwanaisha, Fatuma, Mwajuma, Halima, and Asha, who have businesses in food vending and clothes sales.

loans.use: To buy more radios for her business.

loans.name: Parween

texts.en:
Parween H. is married and a mother of six: three boys and three girls. All her daughters are married; her husband manufactures and sells furniture.

Her husband operates his business in a shop in one of the nearby towns. He is very good at his work and carves very beautiful designs out of wood. He buys wood for this purpose from a nearby wood market. Parween herself embroiders scarves on order from various traders. She has been embroidering for the past ten years. Currently, she needs a loan in the amount of US$ 475 to buy wood in bulk for their business.

loans.use: Buy wood in bulk for furniture-making

loans.name: Gulnora

texts.ru:
Gulnora I. lives in the Gissar region. She is 30 years old, married, and has 2 children. Gulnora takes care of the house and animals. She has 4 years worth of experience in this field. Gulnora would like to buy a milk cow. She has small children who are in need of dairy products. Dairy products cost more on the markets, with higher prices making it hard for Gulnora to afford buying those products. Whenever she has extras, she plans to sell them to her neighbors. She plans to pay off the credit in 12 months.

Translated from Russian by Vasilisa Budnikova, Kiva Volunteer.

Идрисова Гулнора Мухидиновна проживает в районе Гиссар. Возраст 30 лет ,замужем , имеет 2 детей. Гулнора домохозяйка, она занимается животноводством. Имеет опыт в этой дейтельности более 4 лет. Гулнора хочет купить дойную корову. У нее маленькие дети которым необходимы кисло-молочные продукты.На рынках молочная продукция стоит дороже.Лишнее она будет продавать своим соседям . Планирует погасить кредит в течении 12 месяцев.

loans.use: To purchase a cow

loans.name: Saodat

texts.ru:
Saodat R. lives in the Gissar region. She is 27 years old, married, and has 2 children. She has secondary education. Saodat is in the business of sewing custom dresses. In addition, she creates women's clothing and sells it on a market. Saodat's main customers are her neighbors.

Her husband is a construction worker, which is only a seasonal job. For this reason, her occupation is the main source of income for their family. Currently, Saodat is looking to purchase summer fabrics from wholesalers. Since she doesn't have enough funds to cover the purchase, she decided to take out a loan. She plans to pay off the credit within 12 months.

Translated from Russian by Vasilisa Budnikova, Kiva Volunteer.

Расулова Саодат проживает в районе Гиссар .Возраст 27 лет, замужем , имеет 2 детей. Образование среднее. Саодат портниха , она шьет на заказ национальную одежду. Так же она шьет женскую одежду и реализует ее на рынке.Основными покупателями Саодат являются ее соседи. Муж клиентки строитель ,работа сезонная. Поэтому ее бизнес является основным источником дохода ее семьи. В данный момент Саодат хочет закупить летнюю ткань у оптовых поставщиков. Своих денег у ней не хватает и она решила взять кредит. Планирует погасить кредит в течении 12 месяцев.

loans.use: To purchase fabric

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for MLF HUMO - Oct 24, 2008)

loans.name: Hatuju's Nguvukazi Group

texts.en:
Hatuju is a married woman with 3 children, ages 19,17, and 9 years old. Hatuju is a clothes seller. She started her business in 1997. Every day, she works from 8am to 5pm at her business, and can earn a monthly profit of about $62 from her sales.

She now hopes for a loan to buy more clothes for her business. She will share this loan with her subgroup members Mwajuma, Happy, Semeni, and Mary, who have businesses in onions sales, shop ownership, and selling clothes.

loans.use: To buy more clothes for her business.

loans.name: Dženita

texts.en:
Dženita was born in 1980 and she lives together with her husband near the town of Visoko. They buy secondary raw materials such as lead and copper and resell them to recycling factories. In that way they can earn about 800 KM (US$ 640) monthly. They have 3 children.

Dženita intends to use this loan in the amount of US$ 1000 to buy more secondary raw materials for re-sale. She wants to ensure better living standards for her big family.

loans.use: to buy more secondary raw materials

loans.name: Kintu Rebecca, Kavule Effort Group

texts.en:
Beatrice N. and Rebecca K. are members of the Kavule Effort in Mukono. Beatrice has a dairy on Nabuti road and she would like a loan to help buy more milk for her customers.

Rebecca makes delicious half cakes, donuts, and other confectioneries that she supplies to shops, supermarkets, and school children on their way to school. Rebecca is married with four children and cares for thirteen grandchildren. Although the burden of paying school fees is sorted by her son, who stays in the United States.

loans.use: Rebecca would buy more flour and cooking oil for her business. Beatrice would buy milk for her dairy and complete payment for her children's school fees.

loans.name: Kibua's Jiliwaze Group

texts.en:
Kibua is single woman with 3 children, ages 9, 7, and 2 years old. Kibua owns a small beauty salon, which she started in 2007. Everyday, she works from 8am to 7pm at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $40 from her sales.

She now hopes for a loan to buy more salon items for her business. She will share this loan with her subgroup members Asha and Antoneta, who have businesses in food vending.

loans.use: To buy more salon items for her business.

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for BRAC Tanzania - Oct 24, 2008)

loans.name: Tusekilege

texts.en: Mambo from kyela mbeya, Tanzania! This is 46 year-old Tusekelege  K..  She is widow, and has 5 children aged Between 9 and 19. She has 1 dependents, who live with her because he is disabled.  In 2007, Tusekelege  established her crops business. She is assisted by her . Tusekelege  has already received and successfully repaid 0 loans from SELFINA, and now requires a new loan in order to buy more stock of crop in bulk. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: Tusekelege  has already received and successfully repaid 0 loans from SELFINA, and now requires a new loan in order to buy more stock of crop in bulk. She thanks you for your support.

loans.name: Elvisa

texts.en:
Elvisa is 22 years old and she lives with her husband in a small village near the town of Visoko. They buy secondary raw materials such as lead and copper and resell them to recycling factories. In that way they can earn about 800 KM (about US$ 640) monthly. They have 3 children.

Elvisa will invest this loan in the amount of US$ 1000 in reselling secondary raw materials in order to expand the business and help her family with the additional money.

loans.use: To buy more secondary raw materials

loans.name: Parween

texts.en: Parween N. was married 27 years ago. She has nine children: three boys and six girls. All of her sons and her husband are butchers who operate separate meat shops. Parween sews sequins onto shawls and scarves. Three of her daughters and one son are married. Currently, the family needs a loan to invest in their meat business. In the picture Parween is with her family.

loans.use: Expand a butcher shop business

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for Asasah, a partner of Save the Children - Oct 22, 2008)

loans.name: Monica's Jiliwaze Group

texts.en:
Monica is a married woman with 6 children, ages 14-28 years old. Monica owns a small food store and she sells clothes as well, a business she started in 2000. Everyday, she works from 8am to 5pm at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $62 from her sales.

She now hopes for a loan to buy more food items and clothes for her business. She will share this loan with her subgroup members Manywele, Fatuma, and Monica, who have businesses running a salon, and in food vending and clothes sales.

loans.use: To buy more food items and clothes for her business.

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for BRAC Tanzania - Oct 25, 2008)

loans.name: Dorice

texts.en: Dorice  K. is from Kyela Mbeya, Tanzania.  She is 31 years old, married, and has three children aged one, five, and eight.  Dorice also cares for three dependents, who live with her because they are disabled .  In 2002, Dorice  established a library business.  She  has already received and successfully repaid a loan from SELFINA, and now requires a new loan of $825 in order to buy more resources for her library.

loans.use: To buy more resources for the library.

loans.name: Sikudhan's Maendeleo Group

texts.en:
Sikudhan is a married woman with 3 children, ages 12, 6, and 3 years old. She and her husband also take care of one other person, age 50 years old. Sikudhan sells clothes. She started her business in 2000. Every day, she works from 7am to 6pm at her business, and can earn a monthly profit of about $40 from her sales.

She now hopes for a loan to buy more clothes for her business. She will share this loan with her subgroup member Ruth, who has a business dealing in clothes sales.

loans.use: To buy more clothes for her business.

loans.name: Antonia

texts.en:
Antonia is a married woman with 3 children, ages 15, 7, and 2 years old. Antonia is a charcoal seller. She started her business in 2007. Every day, she works from 6am to 16pm at her business, and can earn a monthly profit of about $35 from her sales.

She now hopes for a loan to buy more charcoal for her business.

loans.use: To buy more charcoal for her business.

loans.name: Edina

texts.en: Edina  M. is from Kyela Mbeya, Tanzania.  She is 30 years old, married, and has three children aged two, seven, and nine.  In 2006, Edina  established a café with the help of SELFINA which serves traditional foods made with local ingredients.  She now requires a new loan of $425 in order to buy more kitchen utensils for the café.

loans.use: To buy more kitchen utensils.

loans.name: Abida

texts.en: I have lived all my life in Lahore, the second largest city in Pakistan. I am married and a mother of six: one girl and five boys. Three of my children attend school and two work with their father. My husband is a butcher and operates a meat shop. We need to buy a few more animals for which we require a loan of $475. Our business generates decent profits and by expanding our business further we will be able to improve our profits.

loans.use: Expand a butcher shop

loans.name: Mukhtar

texts.en:
Mukhtar H. was married 35 years ago and lives in Lahore, a Pakistani city famous for its gardens. Mukhtar has eight children: five girls and three boys. Her husband runs a grocery store that he started five years ago. Before this shop he worked at a local company for a meager income.

Mukhtar and her husband are borrowing to buy inventory for their store. She is very hopeful that their business will flourish in leaps and bounds and they will be able to marry their daughters with dignity.

loans.use: Buy inventory for a grocery store

loans.name: Hanifa Bigirwenkya`s Group

texts.en:
The leader of a group of four women, Hanifa is 39 years of age and married with three children of school-going age. The community she lives in is semi-urban. The challenges Hanifa faces include delays in receiving payments from clients, storing sewn-up garments that are not collected for a long time, and the unstable prices of the cloth material and accessories that she uses. The market for her services is seasonal and is at its peak in festive seasons such as Christmas and Easter. Despite these obstacles, she is able to pay her children’s school fees and contribute to the general welfare of the family.

Hanifa has repaid more than 7 loans, and her plan for this next loan is to upgrade to a larger and multi-purpose sewing machine in order to operate her business more efficiently.

loans.use: Her plan is to upgrade to a bigger and multi-purpose sewing machine so as to operate her business more efficiently.

loans.name: Parween

texts.en:
I was married 25 years ago and reside with my family in Lahore, a big city in Pakistan. I migrated to this city from a small city, Arifwala, with my husband ten years ago. I have nine children: four daughters and five sons. My eldest son is a public transport driver and the younger to him has a construction supplies business while another son attends school.

My husband paints pedestrian crossings on roads on order. Currently we need a loan to buy a small van to transport our supplies. We will also add to our savings with your loan.

loans.use: Buy a small van

loans.name: Wanu

texts.en:
Wanu is 39 years old and is married with 6 children, ages 7-18 years old. Wanu is a charcoal and firewood seller. She started her business in 2005. Every day, she works from 6am to 8pm at her business, and can earn a monthly profit of about $40 from her sales.

In the past, Wanu has taken out one successful loan from BRAC Tanzania to expand her business. She now hopes for a loan to buy more charcoal and firewood for her business.

loans.use: To buy more charcoal and firewood for her business.

loans.name: Saleem

texts.en: Saleem A., wife of Mr. Hanif, was married 30 years ago. She has eight children: three daughters and five sons. One of her sons runs a small sanitary store in a nearby market and she embroiders clothes from her house. Her son’s sanitary business does well and now they want a loan to improve it further.   Saleem is a very responsible and dedicated woman and she will repay her loan without any delays.

loans.use: eXPAND SANITARY STORE

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for Asasah, a partner of Save the Children - Oct 23, 2008)

loans.name: Atubonekisye

texts.en: Atubonikisye M. is from Kyela Mbeya, Tanzania.  She is 32 years old, married, and has two children aged four and nine.  She also cares for nine dependents, who live with her because they are orphans.  In 1990, Atubonikisye established a farming business with the help of Selfina, an organization that works towards the economic empowerment of women in Tanzania through sale and leaseback agreements for small farmers.  Atubonikisye now requires a new loan of $425 in order  to buy additional stock in bulk for her farm.

loans.use: To buy additional stock in bulk.

loans.name: Naseem

texts.en:
Naseem B. is married and a mother of ten: five boys and five girls. She lives with her family in Lahore, a big city of Pakistan. Four of Naseem's children are married. Naseem's husband is a rickshaw driver and she is a hardworking and dedicated woman with regular clients to whom she sells clothes and electric goods such as irons, juicer machines, etc.

Naseem has been in this business for the last two years. Now she needs a loan to enable her to buy inventory in large quantity because buying in bulk saves on cost per item and thereby increases profits.

loans.use: Purchase wholesale inventory

loans.name: Sharifa

texts.ru:
Sharifa R. lives in the Gissar region. She is 45 years old, is widow, and has 2 children. She has secondary education. Sharifa is in the business of raising livestock. Until recently, she had been breeding neat cattle. But as the fodder became more expensive, maintaining neat livestock became very hard. Sharifa would like to take out the credit to purchase several sheep. She will send this small herd to the pasture until late fall.

Livestock farming is the main source of income for her family. She plans to pay off the loan within 12 months.

Translated from Russian by Vasilisa Budnikova, Kiva Volunteer.

Рахмонова Шарифа Джалоловна жительница района Гиссар. Возраст 45 лет, вдова ,имеет 2 детей. Образование среднее . Шарифа занимается животноводством. До сих пор она разводила крупно-рогатый скот.Но так как комбикорм очень подорожал содержать бычков стало труднее. Клиентка хочет взять кредит и купить барашков.Это небольшое стадо она отправит на пастбище до поздней осени.Животноводство я вляется единственным источником дохода ее семьи.Планирует погасить кредит в течении 12 месяцев.

loans.use: To purchase sheep

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for MLF HUMO - Oct 26, 2008)

loans.name: Dilafruz

texts.ru:
Dilafruz P. lives in the Gissar region. She is 29 years old and single. She has secondary education. Dilafruz stays at home, takes care of the household and animals. She has a small farm where she maintains livestock. She wants to buy a milk cow. Once she has a cow, she will be able to produce and sell dairy products. With help of that additional income she will be paying monthly payments on the loan. After she pays off the loan, she will still have the cow. Dilafruz plans to pay off the loan within 12 months.

Translated from Russian by Vasilisa Budnikova, Kiva Volunteer.

Парпиева Дилафруз Абдуманоновна жительница района Гиссар. Возраст 29 лет, не замужем. Образование среднее. Дилафруз домохозяйка, она занимается животноводством.У нее есть небольшая ферма, где она содержит бычков . Клиентка хочет купить дойную корову. Купив корову она будет производить и продавать кисло-молочную продукцию.Этим она сможет погасить кредит. После того как оплатит кредит корову останется у ней в хозяйстве. Планирует погасить кредит в течение 12 месяцев

loans.use: To purchase a cow

loans.name: Veronica

texts.en: Veronica  N. is from Kyela Mbeya, Tanzania.  She is 25 years old, married, and has three children aged one, four, and seven.   Veronica also has three dependents, who live with her because they would otherwise be street children.  In 2001, Veronica  established a café with the help of SELFINA which serves traditional foods made with local ingredients. She now requires a new loan of $350 in order to buy additional kitchen utensils.

loans.use: To buy additional kitchen utensils.

loans.name: Rukia

texts.en:
Rukia is 23 years old and is married with one child, age 3. She and her husband also take care of one other person, age 18 years old. Rukia sells fish and soup. She started her business in 2007. Every day, she works from 7am to 6pm at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $40 from her sales.

She now hopes for a loan to buy more fish for her business.

loans.use: To buy more fish for her business.

loans.name: Saltanathon

texts.ru:
Saltanathon A. lives in the Gissar region of Tajikistan. She is 52 years old, married and has three children. She has a college degree in elementary school education. Saltanathon works as a teacher in the local school. Since a teacher's salary is tiny, she supplements her income by raising cattle. Saltanathon has more then six years of experience in animal husbandry. Her cattle business is the main source of income for the family since her husband is currently unemployed. Saltanathon purchases young calves at the market, fattens them and sells them for a higher price for meat. Currently she would like to purchase two more calves. Her own savings are not enough and she has decided to take out a loan to finance the purchase. Saltanathon is planning to pay back the loan int he next 12 months.

Translated from Russian by Anya Lyuksyutova, Kiva volunteer

Абдухамитова Салтанатхон жительница района Гиссар. Ей 52 года, замужем, имеет 3 детей. Образование высшее, по специальности учительница начальных классов.Салтанатхон работает учительницей в средней школе.Так как Заработная плата очень маленькая , клиентка занимается животноводством. Имеет опыт в этой деятельности более 6 лет. Животноводство является основным источником дохода ее семьи,так как муж клиентки временно не работает. Салтанатхон покупает на рынке молодых бычков , откармливает и перепродает их по более высокой цене. В данное время клиентка хочет купить 2 бычков . Своих денежных средств ей хватает и она решила взять кредит.Планирует погасить кредит в течении 12 лет.

loans.use: Purchase of cattle

loans.name: Khadija's Umoja Group

texts.en:
Khadija is 35-years-old and is married with two children, ages 15 and 8. Khadija is a chapati (snack) seller, a business she started in 1992. She works from 6AM to 10.30PM each day and earns a monthly profit of $50.

She is requesting a loan to purchase more wheat flour and cooking oil for her business. She will share this loan with her group members who have businesses dealing in charcoal, juice, chips, coconut, clothes and perfumes sales.

loans.use: To purchase wheat flour and cooking oil

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for BRAC Tanzania - Oct 23, 2008)

loans.name: Mariam

texts.en: Mariam S. is from Kyela Mbeya, Tanzania.  She is 37 years old, married, and has two children aged 12 and 14.  She also has four dependents, who live with her because they are relatives.  In 2001, Mariam established a grocery store. She now requires a  loan of $425 in order to buy soft drinks in bulk to sell in her store, because they are very popular in the hot regions of Tanzania.

loans.use: To buy soft drinks in bulk.

loans.name: Alejandro

texts.en:
Alejandro C. is 45 years old and is married to Asunción Rodríguez; together, they have two school-age daughters.

He is the owner of two dental centers: ten years ago Alejandro opened a dental center in the city of San Lorenzo, and five years ago he opened another dental center in the city of Luque.

Earlier in his career, Alejandro worked as an employee in a dental laboratory, which was an invaluable experience in that it provided him with a great deal of technical and practical knowledge of the industry. In addition, he saved a significant sum of money from his work with the laboratory. Later on, Alejandro invested such savings by purchasing equipment to establish his dental center.

Alejandro is seeking a loan to purchase certain materials that are required in order to give his clients dental prostheses.

loans.use: To purchase certain materials to provide clients with dental prostheses.

loans.name: Anderson

texts.en:
Anderson C. is a young, 21-year-old man. At the age of 19, he began working as a salesperson, traveling from house to house. At that particular time, he did not own the business but was merely helping his mother. Later on, he realized that he could actually buy his own products and then sell them because he did not like the idea of having to depend on his mother’s business. And, since he already knew many customers and had learned how to deal with them, Alejandro took advantage of the opportunity.

Simply put, Alejandro sells various products such as irons, blenders, sheets, towels, and trays. Because May 15th is Mother’s Day in Paraguay, Alejandro affirms that there is a huge demand for his products during this period of time. Therefore, Alejandro is seeking a loan to buy more products in order to satisfy the demand.

loans.use: To meet the increase in demand for his products by purchasing additional items (e.g., irons, blenders, sheets, towels, and trays).

loans.name: Leah

texts.en: Leah M. is from Kyela Mbeya, Tanzania.  She is 31 years old, married, and has one infant child.  Leah also cares for five dependents, who live with her because they are relatives.  In 2005, Leah established her stationary business. She now requires a  loan of $975 in order to buy additional stocks of stationary equipment.

loans.use: To buy additional stock of stationary equipment.

loans.name: Mariam

texts.en: Mariam K. is from Kyela Mbeya, Tanzania.  She is 30 years old, married, and has five children between the ages of six and 15.  In 1998, Mariam established a cereal crops selling business with the help of SELFINA, an organization that works towards the economic empowerment of women in Tanzania through sale and leaseback agreements for small farmers. Mariam has already received and successfully repaid one loan from SELFINA, and now requires a new loan of $425 in order to buy more rice stocks in bulk.

loans.use: To buy more stocks of rice in bulk.

loans.name: Joecy

texts.en: Joecy M. is from Kyela Mbeya, Tanzania.  She is 27 years old, and has one infant child but is not married.  In 2006, Joecy established her used clothing business, which imports second-hand clothes from North America and Europe, washes and irons them, then sells them in the street markets. She is assisted by her colleague. She now requires a loan of $425 in order to purchase additional clothes in bulk.

loans.use: To purchase additional clothes in bulk.

loans.name: Neema

texts.en: Neema  M. is from Kyela Mbeya, Tanzania.  She is 30 years old, married, and has five children between the ages of three and 15.  In 1997, Neema established a farming business with the help of Selfina, an organization that works towards the economic empowerment of women in Tanzania through sale and leaseback agreements for small farmers.  She now requires a loan of $425 in order to buy additional stock of cereal crops in bulk.

loans.use: To buy additional stock of cereal crops in bulk.

loans.name: Cerafila

texts.en:
Despite being 65 years old, Cerfila E. has the energy of a young girl and she works extremely hard every day. Cerfila is a widow and has many sons, each of whom is married and lives with his own family.

Eight years ago Cerfila opened a despensa (grocery store) in a neighborhood of San Lorenzo. Before that, she used to sell products in the market (“Mercado Municipal de San Lorenzo”). Because of her age and due to safety concerns, her sons pleaded with her to move from that place, and she reluctantly agreed to do so.

Cerfila says that she feels the necessity to work and to be useful, which is why she still works very hard despite her age. Indeed, she is one of the oldest costumers of Fundacion Paraguaya.

. She is seeking a loan to enable her to purchase products for her despensa, including bread, drinks, sugar, pasta, oil, milk, and cheese.

loans.use: To purchase additional products for her grocery store, including bread, drinks, sugar, pasta, oil, milk, and cheese.

loans.name: Francisco

texts.en:
Francisco Agüero is 27 years old, and he is married to Maura Cuellar. In addition, he is the father of a 3-year-old boy.

Since 2001, he has owned an embroidery shop where he and his wife work. He learned to embroider several years ago because his father used to teach him how to do so. The main types of outfits that Francisco embroiders are t-shirts and kepis.

The earnings from the embroidery shop are the main source of income for Francisco’s family. As a result of the earnings from their shop, Francisco was able to save some money and he invested such savings in building his own house.

Francisco is seeking a loan to purchase fabrics to increase the shop's production. Francisco’s main goal is to generate more income in order to expand his shop.

loans.use: To expand his embroidery shop's operations by purchasing additional fabrics.

loans.name: Humberto

texts.es:
Mr. Humberto L. is a young man who hopes to work and get ahead. He opened his own business with money that he’d saved. Humberto sells cell phones, cell phone accessories, and SIM chips from a number of providers.

Thanks to good sales Humberto opened two more kiosks, employing two people to work at them. He mans the principal kiosk himself, which is located in front of a busy supermarket in his city and has high sales figures thanks to the foot traffic in the area.

Humberto lives with his sister. Their parents emigrated two years ago when the family's economic situation demanded that they search for better work opportunities. Humberto would like more than anything to have his parents return to the country, because he finds it very difficult to have the family separated. He hopes that his businesses can generate sufficient income to support the family so that his parents can return home.

Humberto is asking for a loan to purchase large quantities of merchandise, in order to obtain a discount. This should increase his earnings by enabling him to offer better prices than the competition.

Translated from Spanish by Sarah Bishop, Kiva Volunteer.

El señor Humberto L. es una persona joven con ganas de progresar y trabajar, el abrió su propio negocio con unos ahorros que tenía guardados, en el mismo se dedica a la venta de teléfonos celulares, chips con líneas de teléfonos de las distintas empresas distribuidoras de nuestro país al igual que accesorios varios para celulares.

Gracias a las buenas ventas y ganancias generadas él pudo abrir dos puestos mas de ventas dando empleo a dos personas que se encargan de la atención de dichos puestos. Su puesto principal, y en el que él atiende personalmente, se encuentra frente a un supermercado muy concurrido de la ciudad, lo que le genera buenas ventas gracias a la alta concurrencia de personas en el lugar.

Humberto vive con su hermana, sus padres emigraron hace un par de años a otro país en busca de mejores oportunidades laborales, ya que la situación económica lo demandaba. El deseo mas grande de su corazón es que sus padres puedan volver al país ya que la separación familiar es una situación muy difícil, él espera que sus negocios generen suficientes ingresos para lograr fortalecerse económicamente lo suficiente para que sus padres puedan volver.

El solicita hoy día un crédito con el que podrá adquirir una buena cantidad de mercaderías ya que al comprar en grandes cantidades sus proveedores lo ofrecen mejores descuentos, lo que ayuda a que sus ganancias sean buenas y sus precios de ventas puedan ser mejores que el de la competencia.

loans.use: Purchase of cellular phone accessories.

loans.name: Self Help Group

texts.en:
The Self Help group is a savings group and members also assist each other on their farms. They are happy that Kiva can help them to increase their farm activities to earn more money and have more food to eat.

The individual members grow peanuts, vegetables and rice. The loan requested is mainly for the growing of rice for consumption and for market. The loan will be used to buy seeds and fertilizer, and to hire labourers. Kulako S. is the group leader and is 52 years old. The group members guarantee the loans for each other.

The members of Self Help are excited to use the loan to buy supplies for planting rice. They look forward to a great harvest ahead all thanks to Kiva!

loans.use: To buy seeds and fertilizer, and to hire labourers for their farms.

loans.name: Tanyara Ii Group

texts.en:
Musa and Musukunda need additional capital to buy supplies for their farms. The two members of Heremakono group grow okra, cassava, and rice.

They have large farmlands, but were unable to use all of the land due to lack of capital for labour and fertilizer. The group is therefore requesting a loan of Le.1,000,000 ($350 USD) Le.500, 000 ($175 USD) each. Musa Mansary is the group leader and is 45 years old. The support from Kiva will help them have a bountiful harvest this season.

loans.use: To buy seed and fertilizer, and to hire laborers

loans.name: Binta

texts.fr:
Binta S., age 43, is married and the mother of five children and takes care of three others. She has been a member of the village bank Femmes Catholiques de Vélingara for four years. She wants to do commerce selling peanut butter, palm oil, and lemons retail. Her income enables her to meet family needs. She wishes to strengthen her business. Binta is applying for a loan that will be repaid all at once at the end of six months.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

Binta S., 43 ans, mariée, 05 enfants et 03 autres en charge est membre du banc villageois des Femmes Catholiques de Vélingara depuis quatre ans. Elle veut acheter et revendre au détail de la pâte d'arachide, de l'huile de palme et du citron.Ses revenus lui permettent de satisfaire les besoins familiaux.. Elle souhaite renforcer ses activités Binta sollicite un prêt qui sera remboursé au bout de six mois en une seule échéance.

loans.use: To buy peanut butter, palm oil, and lemons

loans.name: Karankay Group

texts.en:
The members of Karankay group grow vegetables, such as tomatoes, lettuce, carrots and cabbage to sell. Nema and Fatmata are also engaged in small-scale retail sales. They said they would use the loan to grow vegetables to sell and use the income from their retail sales to pay the loan instalments.

The group would like to increase their farm activites and each member guarantees each other for loan repayment. Nema is 40 years and is married with 3 children. She serves as the group leader.

The Karankay group works together to produce vegetables, and to sell their produce at the market. They need a small loan to increase their yields and incomes.

loans.use: To grow vegetables to sell in the market.

loans.name: Munafa Iii Group

texts.en:
Mballia is the leader of the Munafa lll group. The members grow cassava, okra and peanuts. They would like to increase their peanut production for sale and are requesting a loan of Le.1, 500,000 ($525 USD) to buy seeds and fertilizer, and to hire labour. Mballia is 38 years and is married with 3 children. The member's families depend on farming for their livelihoods.

The Munafa III group needs additional supplies for their peanut production activities. They hope that they will be able to borrow from Kiva for this purpose.

loans.use: To buy seeds and fertilzer, and to hire labourers

loans.name: Irene

texts.en:
Irene A. is a 33-year-old, single mother of three children, all of whom live with her. Because she is the only one responsible for her three sons, she knows that she needs to work very hard in order to raise them and to provide them a good education.

A few years ago, Irene started working with her aunt as a seamstress. In doing so, she gained invaluable experience, and she learned how to properly use the sewing machines. In addition, she saved a considerable amount of money from her work with her aunt; consequently, she invested her savings by purchasing sewing machines and raw materials and was thus able to open her own sewing shop.

Irene is most interested in fashion design, and her biggest dream is to design different types of clothes and to sell them in stores.

She makes beautiful cardigans, sheets, pillows, and other such items. In order to meet her customers' demands, she is seeking a loan to buy raw materials such as fabrics, bottoms, and threads to produce her goods.

loans.use: To meet her customers' demands by purchasing additional raw materials (e.g., fabrics, bottoms, and threads) so that she may continue to supply her products.

loans.name: Yankafissa Ii Group

texts.en:
The Yankafisa ll Group is comprised of 4 members with Alie K. as their leader. Each member of the group has 5 hectares of land and preparing the land to grow vegetables, cassava and sweet potatoes.

The group is requesting a loan of Le.2,500,000 ($875 USD) to enable them to purchase fertilizer and hire labourers to cultivate all of the land. They hope for a good income if all the land is cultivated.

Yankafisa is hoping to use a loan from Kiva to supply their farms with the necessary inputs to produce a sufficient crop of vegetables, casava, and potatoes.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and hire labourers

loans.name: Hope Group

texts.en:
The Committee of Entrepreneuring women is a program carried out by Fundación Paraguaya which targets groups of enterprising women who create a village bank through which they receive assistance by way of loans. The main goal is to give the women the opportunity to carry out economic activities which enable them to live with dignity and to contribute to a better quality of life for their them and their families. In practice, lending to poor women creates a cascading effect that brings social and economic benefits to a whole family, and thus to the entire community. What is more, the sense of belonging to a group gives these poor women the energy and motivation to succeed in their work and in life.

In the city of Ypane, Lidia G. de González contacted her friends and neighbors and told them about the committee. She shared with these women her desire to change their world for the better by working very hard. Lidia’s hopeful words stimulated optimism among these women and they decided to form the Committee “La Esperanza” (Hope). All the members of “La Esperanza” dream of opening their own store to offer various products and services. In addition, what motivates them and makes them work extremely hard is their collective desire to give their children an opportunity to go to college or to school.

Among the many businesses they operate are: hair saloons, despensas (grocery stores), copetines (mini bar-restaurants), sewing shops, and shops where clothing, cosmetics, vegetables and fruits are sold. The money provided by the requested credit will be used to buy cosmetics, hair accessories, fabrics, bottoms, threads, fruits, vegetables, brushes and other such products.

loans.use: To expand the group members' businesses by purchasing various products, including cosmetics, hair accessories, fabrics, bottoms, threads, fruits, vegetables, and brushes.

loans.name: Todia

texts.fr:
Todia M., age 31, is married and has three children to care for. She has been a member of the village bank of Kounkané Viviane Wade in the Kolda region for five and a half years. She wants to buy peanuts to make peanut butter, to get supplies to make beignets (a kind of doughnut), and to sell sugar, cookies, batteries, cigarettes, etc., at the retail level. Her income enables her to contribute to her family's well-being. Todia wishes to strengthen her business. She is applying for a loan that will be repaid all at once at the end of six months.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

Todia M., 31 ans, mariée, 03 enfants en charge est membre du banc villageois de Kounkané Viviane Wade dans la région de Kolda depuis 5 ans et demi. Elle veut acheter de l' arachide pour faire de la pâte d’arachide et s’approvisionner pour faire des beignets et vendre au détail du sucre, des biscuits, des batteries, des cigarettes etc .Ses revenus lui permettent de contribuer au bien être familial. Todia souhaite renforcer son activité. Elle sollicite un prêt qui sera remboursé au bout de six mois en une seule échéance.

loans.use: To buy sacks of peanuts and various goods, such as sugar, cookies, batteries, and cigarettes

loans.name: Manuela

texts.en:
Manuela C. is 47 years old, and she had opened a despensa (grocery store) a few years ago. Although the business did not do particularly well in that her sales and income were quite poor, it is worth mentioning that Manuela did not give up for several years and that she did her very best to allow the business to succeed. As a result, she began to look for other profitable business opportunities.

Five years ago, Manuela opened another store where she sells chicken and different types of drinks (e.g., cokes and beers). She is very excited because this is a very profitable market, and she is happy to report that "sales and income are increasing steadily."

Manuela’s family is comprised of her husband, Roberto, and her three sons. To increase the family’s income, Roberto works in a restaurant on the weekends as a waiter.

Manuela is seeking a loan to buy chicken and drinks.

loans.use: To continue to expand her business by purchasing additional chickens and drinks.

loans.name: Mario

texts.en:
Mario S. is 46 years old, and he is married to Lucia Zuares. The couple has five sons, all of whom are adults.

Ever since he was a child, Mario has worked as a carpenter with his uncle. And, because of such previous experience, Mario gained extensive technical knowledge in the field.

Mario’s wife, Lucia Zuares, is a teacher. Over the years, the couple saved a considerable amount of money to further their entrepreneurial investments. Nowadays, Mario is the owner of his own carpentry operation. Mario’s dream is to buy a car in order to transport the furniture he makes, but at the present time Mario is merely seeking a loan to purchase raw materials for his business such as wood, nails, paint and other such inputs.

loans.use: To expand his business by purchasing additional raw materials such as nails, wood and paint

loans.name: Esthela

texts.es:
Señora C. has a travel services business for trips to different parts of Mexico, like tourist destinations. This is the source of income for her family since her husband and siblings work there as well. They are requesting a loan of $1,200 to remodel their location.

Translated from Spanish by Tanya Harper, Kiva volunteer

La Sra. C. tiene un negocio de servicios de viajes a diferentes partes de la Republica Mexicana, así como a lugares turísticos. Este es la fuente de ingreso de su familia ya que en trabajan su esposo y sus hermanos. Estamos solicitando un préstamo de $1,200.00 dlls para acondicionar un local ya que tiene en su casa el negocio y están algo reducido.

loans.use: To remodel her location

loans.name: Idalina's Group

texts.es:
The Committee of Enterprising Women was developed by Fundación Paraguaya as a communal bank that offers credit to enterprising women. This program was formed with consideration for the economic, social, and personal needs of the poorest women in the country.

Thanks to the excellent achievements of past groups, these satisfied women invite other friends or relatives to form a new group. That was how this current group of 17 women was born. They hold many types of commercial activities to generate income for their families.

These women work ceaselessly in order to create a better future for their children, provide them with health and education opportunities that they never had. In this way, their children can have a better quality of life through better jobs. Wives, mothers, and micro entrepreneurs, these women are employed in activities such as: selling food, clothing, lottery tickets and newspapers, fashion, fruit, crafts, chicken; recycling; and managing restaurants.

The loan is an important tool for these women to strengthen their small businesses. The loans will be reinvested in their businesses and the earnings will generate important savings. Today they are asking for a new loan that will be invested in various supplies, such as: fruits, vegetables, chicken, corn, fabrics, threads, plastics and cartons to recycle. They’ll also buy ingredients to make fast food, like: meat, ham, cheese, eggs, flour, etc.

Translated from Spanish by Sarah Bishop, Kiva Volunteer.

El Comité de Mujeres Emprendedoras es un programa desarrollado por Fundación Paraguaya orientado a grupos de mujeres emprendedoras, las cuales crean una banca comunal y a través de la misma reciben que asistencia crediticia. Este programa presta atención a las necesidades económicas, sociales y personales de mujeres de menores recursos en el país.

Gracias a los excelentes logros de los grupos formados, estas señoras satisfechas con su trabajo invitan a otras señoras amigas o parientes a formar sus grupo, es así como nace este comité que hoy día está compuesto por 17 señoras que desempeñan distintos tipos de actividades comerciales para generar ingresos a sus familias.

Estas mujeres trabajan incansablemente con el fin de brindar a sus hijos un porvenir mejor, oportunidades de estudio y salud que ellas no pudieron acceder, de este modo ellos podrán mejorar su calidad de vida obteniendo mejores trabajos. Esposas, madres y microempresarias, estas mujeres desarrollan distintas actividades como: venta de comestibles, venta de ropa, venta de loterías y diarios, modistas, venta de frutas, venta de artesanías, reciclaje, cantinas, venta de pollos, entre otras cosas.

El crédito es una herramienta muy importante para estas mujeres ya que esto ayuda a fortalecer sus micro empresas; los creditos solicitados son reinvertidos en sus negocios y con las ganancias obtenidas ellas generan ahorros importantes. Hoy ellas solicitan un crédito nuevo que será invertido para la compra de mercaderías e insumos varios como: frutas, verduras, pollos, maíz, telas, hilos, plásticos y cartones para recliclar, ingredientes para preparar comidas rápidas como carne, jamón, queso, huevos, harina, etc.

loans.use: Various supplies, such as: fruits, vegetables, chicken, corn, fabrics, threads, plastics and cartons to recycle. Also ingredients to make fast food, like: meat, ham, cheese, eggs, flour, etc.

loans.name: José Luís

texts.es:
I have had my optical business for 9 years selling lenses and giving vision tests. This business, in which my wife and I work, is the source of income for my family. I currently need a more modern chair for vision tests. For this reason I am requesting a loan of $1,000 to purchase a more current special vision test chair so that I can give a much better service to my customers.

Translated from Spanish by a Kiva volunteer.

Tengo ya más de 9 años con el negocio de la óptica vendo lentes y realizo examen de la vista. Este negocio es la fuente de ingreso de mi familia en trabajamos mi esposa y yo. Me esta haciendo falta un sillón mas moderno para ser la evaluación de la vista. Es por eso que solicito un préstamo de $ 1,000.00 dlls para la comprar de un sillón especial para las evaluaciones de la vista y más actualizado y así darles un servicio mucho mejor a mis clientes.

loans.use: Purchase a special optical chair

loans.name: Chérif

texts.fr:
Chérif G., age 37, is married and a mother with six children to care for.  She has been a loyal member of the village bank of Kounkané Viviane Wade for two years.  She want to buy an embroidering machine, poplin cloth, and some packets of sewing thread.  She has a sewing shop where she sells poplin and clothing, which she makes.  Chérif is a loyal member and is exemplary in her group.  With her income, she is helping to improve her family's living conditions.   The loan for which she is applying will be repaid all at once at the end of six months.

 Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

Chérif G., 37 ans, mariée, mère de 06 enfants en charge est une fidèle membre du banc villageois de Kounkané Viviane Wade depuis 2 ans. Elle veut  acheter une machine à coudre broderie, des tissus popeline et des paquets de fil à coudre. Elle a un atelier de couture ou elle vend de la popeline et des tenues qu'elle confectionne. Chérif est une fidèle membre et un modèle dans son groupe Avec ses revenus elle participe à l’amélioration des conditions de vie de sa famille. Le prêt qu’elle sollicite sera remboursé au bout de six mois en une seule échéance.

loans.use: To buy an embroidering machine, poplin, and thread

loans.name: Elena

texts.en:
Elena is a widow who supports herself with a small business selling fresh fish at a market in Melitopol, Ukraine. Her husband died tragically, leaving Elena and their son, who is now about seventeen. Elena has been selling fish for two years and works with her mother in the business. Her mother has extensive experience as an entrepreneur, which has been a help to Elena.

Elena has requested a loan of 1500 Ukrainian Griven ($325 USD) to add to her business working capital. Her goal is to expand the business in the future. We are happy to be able to offer this financial assistance to Elena and look forward to her continued success.

loans.use: Add to working capital

loans.name: Elena

texts.en:
Elena has a small business selling household products and plastic goods at a market near the train station in Melitopol, Ukraine. She is an experienced entrepreneur, having been self-employed for seven years. This has been a good sales area for Elena, because she has few competitors with the same type of business. In the future, Elena hopes to expand her business by selling vinyl flooring material, which is popularly used in remodeling homes and apartments in Ukraine. Elena is married and has a teenage son.

Elena has requested a loan to help purchase new inventory for her business. She has been a good client with Nadiya Ukraine in the past, repaying all previous loans on time. We are happy to have another opportunity to assist her in operating a successful business.

loans.use: Purchase new inventory

loans.name: Tatyana

texts.en:
Tatyana is a clothing vendor from the city of Ordshonikidze in south central Ukraine. She sells a nice selection of clothing from a kiosk at the busy Ordshonikidze central market. Tatyana has been in business for about six years. A large assortment of available clothing and a discount system have helped Tatyana build a successful business with many repeat customers. Tatyana is married and has one child. Her business is a good source of income for her family.

Tatyana has requested a loan of 2500 Ukrainian Griven ($525 USD) to add to her business capital and to help her purchase new clothing inventory for the summer season. Many customers want to update their wardrobes after the cold winter. This loan will help Tatyana be prepared for the new season with a new supply of inventory to sell.

loans.use: Purchase clothing inventory for the summer season

loans.name: Rodrigo

texts.es:
For 3 years Mr. R. has had his tailor shop. He says: This business is the source of income for my family. The business is doing well but I need some raw materials such as fabric to be able to meet orders for clothing that I have pending. For this reason I am asking for a loan of $750 to purchase raw materials and thus complete the clothing orders on time.
Translated from Spanish by a Kiva volunteer.
El Sr. R. tiene ya más de 3 años con su negocio de sastrería. Este negocio es la fuente de ingresos de mi familia. El negocio esta marchando muy bien pero me esta haciendo falta algo de materia prima como telas para poder entregar los pedidos de traje que tengo pendientes para entregar. Es por eso que estoy solicitando un préstamo de $750.00 dlls para la comprar de materia prima y así entregar los trajes a tiempo.

loans.use: Purchase of materials for his tailor shop

loans.name: Hoang Thi

texts.vi:
Mrs. Hoàng Thị Tuyến, 39 years old, lives with her husband and their two school aged children. She has been with the TYM Fund for 6 years. She uses her loans to invest in her husband’s bicycle repair shop. Because he is a good and trustworthy mechanic who is also a very hard worker, they build a good business. In average, they make 6-7USD a day. The family’s economy is stable and the kids have good education. This time she would like to apply for a loan of 950USD to buy some tools and stock more bicycle parts.

Translated from Vietnamese by ngungo, Kiva volunteer.


Chị Hoàng Thị Tuyến sống cùng chồng và 2 con đang trong độ tuổi đi học. Năm nay 39 tuổi, chị tham gia Quỹ TYM đã được 6 năm. Sau khi được vay vốn, chị Tuyến bàn với chồng mở cửa hàng sửa chữa và thay thế phụ tùng xe đạp. Nhờ có tay nghề và biết giữ uy tín nên cửa hàng nhà chị Tuyến luôn đông khách. Trung bình mỗi ngày thu nhập khoảng 6-7USD. Nhờ công việc hoạt động tốt, kinh tế phát triển nên 2 con của chị Tuyến được tạo điều kiện ăn học đầy đủ. Các cháu hiện đều đang học những năm cuối cấp. Bước sang vòng vốn này, chị Tuyến xin vay 950USD để mua thêm phụ tùng và dụng cụ sửa xe.

loans.use: Buy bike parts and repairing tools

loans.name: Nguyen Thi

texts.vi:
Mrs. Nguyễn Thị Bình, 52 years old, is a widow. Her husband was past away after some terminal illness. She lives with her only grown up son who dutifully helps his mother to run her nursery. She has been with the TYM Fund for 6 years. She uses her loans to invest in her business. Together, the mother and son team build a good business. The average monthly income is 200USD. She would like to apply for a loan of 1200USD to stock more plants and fertilizer for her nursery. .

Translated from Vietnamese by ngungo, Kiva volunteer.


Chị Nguyễn Thị Bình, 52 tuổi, là thành viên năm thứ 6 của Quỹ Tình thương. Chồng bị bệnh qua đời đã lâu, gia đình chỉ có 2 mẹ con. Con trai chị là một thanh niên hiền lành chịu khó luôn phụ giúp mẹ trong công việc gia đình. Công việc chính hiện nay của chị Bình là trồng cây cảnh. Chị làm công việc này đã được 5 năm. Đây là một công việc đòi hỏi sự cần cù, tỉ mỉ. Nhờ nỗ lực lao động và tích lũy kinh nghiệm nên vườn cây của chị luôn xanh tốt và có nhiều thế đẹp. Thu nhập bình quân một tháng của gia đình khoảng 200USD. Vòng vốn này chị Bình xin vay thêm 1200USD để mua thêm cây cảnh cùng phân bón.

loans.use: Buy pot plant, fertilizer

loans.name: Enoe Mercedes

texts.es:
Enoe is 24 years old and lives in the Anexo B neighborhood. She is married and has two children; her husband works as a vendor. She has been working in beauty salons for five years, and for the past two years has had her own salon, albeit with infrastructure problems. She started her business with money from her severance payment, which she then used to buy mirrors and other equipment that she needed for opening her business.

Enoe is going to use the loan to buy additional equipment so that she can set her business up outside the home. In the future she plans to continue making improvements to her business’s infrastructure. By consolidating her business Enoe will be able to contribute to her family’s economic development.

Translated by Chris Knutson, Kiva Volunteer

Enoe tiene 24 años de edad, vive en el barrio anexo B. Sur es casada y tiene dos niños su esposo es comerciante, ella trabajaba en salones de belleza tiene cinco años de experiencia y dos años de tener su propio salón aunque con dificultades de infraestructura. Comenzó con dinero de la liquidación y compro espejos y materiales para la apertura sus planes.

Con el préstamo va complementar materiales para establecer el negocio independientemente del resto de la casa y a futuro seguir mejorando la infraestructura y así aportar al desarrollo económico y familiar a través de la consolidación del negocio.

loans.use: Improvements to her business

loans.name: Nguyen Thi

texts.vi:
Mrs. Nguyễn Thị Tuyết, 47 years old, lives with her husband and two children in Hùng An, Kim Động. She has her farm for 10 years now. Funds from the loans with the TYM Fund were invested in pigs, fish ponds and fruit plants. With support from her husband and children her VAC plan is well developed. The average monthly income is 200USD. She would like to apply for a loan of 625USD to expand her plan.

Translated from Vietnamese by ngungo, Kiva volunteer.


Chị Nguyễn Thị Tuyết, 47 tuổi, sống cùng chồng và 2 con tại xã Hùng An, Kim Động. Chị làm trang trại đã được 10 năm nay. Đồng vốn vay từ Quỹ được chị đầu tư vào nuôi lợn, thả cá và trồng cây ăn quả. Nhờ tính chăm chỉ, chịu khó lại được sự hỗ trợ, giúp đỡ của chồng con nên mô hình VAC của chị Tuyết phát triển rất tốt. Bình quân thu nhập một tháng khoảng 200USD. Chị Tuyết luôn mong muốn được vay thêm nhiều vốn để mở rộng dự án của mình. Mức đề nghị của chị vòng này là 625USD.

loans.use: Buy pigs, fishes and feed

loans.name: Kothokanu Ii Group

texts.en: Esther Koma J. is the group leader and she is 52 years old.  Married with 4 children, the family depends entirely on farming.  The group members grow corn and vegetables such as lettuce, cabbage and cassava.  They are also engaging in petty trading.  The group would like to expand their farm land to grow rice and chilli peppers.  The group will increase their income and family food if they are assisted with a loan of Le.1, 500,000, Le.500, 000 each.

loans.use: The Kothokanu II group needs additional funds to expand their farms in the hopes of improving their crop yields.  They need assistance from Kiva to do so.

loans.name: Maria Nela

texts.es:
Nela lives in Batahola Norte, is married, and has two beautiful children, aged 1 and 2. She is 27 years old and has managed to own a small general store for two years now; she began her business with the severance payment from her husband’s previous job. Nela’s husband is currently unemployed, and so the family depends directly on the earnings from her business.

Nela is going to use the money loaned to her to invest more in her store so that she can increase both her sales and her clientele. Nela hopes that her business will improve every day and that she can thus contribute to her children’s future schooling and their financial stability.

Translated by Chris Knutson, Kiva Volunteer

Doña Nela, vive en Batahola Norte es casada y tiene dos hermosos hijos una de 1 año y 2 años de edad, a sus 27 años de edad ya ha logrado tener una mini pulpería que tiene dos años ,comenzó el negocio con la liquidación del trabajo anterior de su esposo. Actualmente Bajo su capital al quedarse desempleado su esposo y depender directamente del negocio.

Con el dinero que le presten va a invertir más en la pulpería para incrementar las ventas y la clientela a futuro espera que cada día sea más grande el negocio y así contribuir con el futuro escolar y estabilidad de sus hijos.

loans.use: Purchasing products for her business

loans.name: Nguyen Thi

texts.vi:
Mrs. Nguyễn Thị Yến, 55 years old, lives with her husband and two children in Lương Bằng, Kim Động. She tends a general sweet stand at the open market in the area. The business fits the weekly repayment plan. Her husband support her business. The average income is 7USD a day. Her grown up children are always help her when she is in need. She’s been with the TYM Fund for 6 years. This time she would like to apply for a loan of 950USD to stock more good for her stand.

Translated from Vietnamese by ngungo, Kiva volunteer.


Chị Nguyễn Thị Yến, 55 tuổi, sống cùng chồng và 2 con tại thị trấn Lương Bằng, Kim Động. Chị có một quầy bán hoa quả và bánh kẹo ở chợ. Công việc này rất thuận tiện cho việc trả tiền tuần và cũng phù hợp với độ tuổi của chị. Bên cạnh đó chị cũng nhận được sự hỗ trợ tích cực của chồng trong việc kinh doanh. Tiền lãi hàng ngày từ việc bán hàng khoảng 7USD. Con trai, con gái của chị đều đã trưởng thành và luôn hỗ trợ mỗi khi chị gặp khó khăn. Tham gia Quỹ TYM đến nay được 6 năm, chị hoàn toàn hài lòng với những kết quả có được. Vòng vốn tới chị tiếp tục xin vay 950USD để mua thêm hàng bán.

loans.use: Buy fruits, confectionery

loans.name: Kothokanu Group

texts.en:
Sama, the group leader, is both a farmer and a trader, and Yamakoro is a farmer. Both friends grow vegetables, corn and rice. Their families depend on farming for food and income.

When they heard about Kiva supporting the active poor with loans to improve their economic status, they approached Salone Microfinance Trust (SMT) and requested a loan of Le.1, 000,000 ($350 USD) to expand their farm activity. The loan will be used mainly for hiring labourers and purchasing fertilizer.

These two friends are working hard to survive on what their farms are able to produce. They need a small loan from Kiva to help bolster their productivity and improve their lives.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and hire laborers

loans.name: Nguyen Thi

texts.vi:
Mrs Nguyễn Thị Uyên is 35 years old. She is in her 6th year with TYM fund. She is married and has 2 children who attend school. She owns a small shop selling sunglasses and locks. She has been in this business for 5 years. Her shop attracts a lot of customers because the prices are low and she is a good saleswoman. Her family income is 200 USD a month. Her husband also works with her, tending the shop and supportive of her. The business is stable and sales are good. This time she is seeking a loan of 950 USD to stock up her inventory.

Translated from Vietnamese by Khang Ho-Si, Kiva volunteer.

Chị Nguyễn Thị Uyên, 35 tuổi, là thành viên năm thứ 6 của Quỹ Tình thương. Gia đình chị gồm 2 vợ chồng và 2 người con đang trong độ tuổi đi học. Nghề nghiệp chính của chị hiện nay là bán kính mắt và ổ khóa. Chị làm công việc này được gần 5 năm. Nhờ có duyên bán hàng và hàng bán giá cả phải chăng nên luôn có đông khách đến mua. Thu nhập bình quân 1 tháng của gia đình là 200USD. Chồng chị cũng tham gia kinh doanh và luôn hỗ trợ mỗi khi chị tham gia sinh hoạt cụm. Công việc kinh doanh thuận lợi, vòng vốn này chị Uyên làm đơn xin vay 950USD để mua thêm hàng.

loans.use: Buy glasses, locks

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for TYM Fund - Oct 22, 2008)

loans.name: Nguyen Thi

texts.vi:
Mrs Nguyễn Thị Luân, 48, lives in Kim Động, Hưng Yên with her husband. They have a son who is attending university away from home. Mrs Luân opened a clothing store 5 years ago. Today, her business is striving. Her annual income is 3000-4000 USD after expenses. According to her, this type of business requires a lot of capital to keep a high level of inventory. For the last 7 years with TYM, she has totaled a few thousands of dollars in loans. Every sum that is invested in her business brings her good profit. This is why she is seeking a new loan of 1200 USD to buy new clothes for her shop

Translated from Vietnamese by Khang Ho-Si, Kiva volunteer.

Chị Nguyễn Thị Luân, 48 tuổi, sống cùng chồng tại huyện Kim Động, Hưng Yên. Anh chị có một cháu trai đang học cao đẳng trên tỉnh. Cách đây 5 năm chị Luân mở cửa hàng kinh doanh quần áo. Công việc hiện nay đang rất phát triển, sau khi trừ chi phí thu nhập mỗi năm của gia đình khoảng 3 đến 4 nghìn USD. Chị Luân tâm sự với nghề nghiệp này thì lúc nào chị cũng cần vốn. Trong 7 năm tham gia chị đã vay của Quỹ vài nghìn USD. Số vốn vay luôn mang lại hiệu quả kinh tế nên vòng vốn này chị Luân quyết định xin vay 1200USD để mua thêm hàng bán.

loans.use: Buy clothes

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for TYM Fund - Oct 24, 2008)

loans.name: Gloria Maria

texts.es:
Gloria is a vendor who lives in the neighborhood of Acahual Inca. She is 29 years old and married. Her business is selling pork and pork products. She started out selling on consignment, and began saving and investing her earnings. She already has 15 years of sales experience and a steady group of customers, and her goal is to set her business up in a permanent location and increase her sales. She is going to use the loan to buy more raw materials to sell and thus satisfy her customers with more variety.

Translated by Chris Knutson, Kiva Volunteer

La Sra. Gloria, es comerciante habita en el barrio acahual inca tiene 29 años de edad es casada. Su negocio es venta de carne de cerdo y derivados ella empezó con la venta de consignación, y comenzó ahorrar capital e invertir mas ala venta ya lleva 15 años de experiencia y tiene sus clientes fijos, su anhelo es poner un puesto fijo e incrementar las ventas. Con el préstamo va a comprar más materia prima para vender y satisfacer a sus clientes, con variedad.

loans.use: Purchasing products

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for AFODENIC - Oct 24, 2008)

loans.name: Nguyen Thi

texts.vi:
Mrs Nguyễn Thị Tháp is 58 years old. She lives in Hiệp Cường, Kim Động with her 2 children. Her husband passed away 10 years ago. Raising her children alone was hard. She holds a general store selling toothpaste, stationary ... among other things. Her revenue is 200 USD a month.
