For the last 7 years she has been a model entrepreneur who has obtained the most ROI among TYM members. Her children are now getting higher education so the expenses are considerable. Mrs Tháp wishes to increase her sales/income to be able to provide for her children. This time she is seeking 1200 USD to replenish her store and if possible, she would add snacks/candies/cookies to her store inventory.

Translated from Vietnamese by Khang Ho-Si, Kiva volunteer.

Chị Nguyễn Thị Tháp năm nay 58 tuổi, chị sống cùng 2 con tại xã Hiệp Cường, Kim Động. Chồng chị mất cách đây 10 năm, một mình chị lam lũ nuôi các con ăn học. Chị Tháp có một cửa hàng tạp hóa với các mặt hàng kinh doanh chính là kem đánh răng và đồ dùng học sinh. Mức thu nhập hàng tháng của cửa hàng là 200USD. Trong 7 năm tham gia chị luôn là thành viên sử dụng vốn vay hiệu quả của Quỹ TYM. Các con chị Tháp hiện đang theo học các trường trung cấp, cao đẳng nên chi phí đòi hỏi tương đối lớn. Chị Tháp rất muốn nâng mức thu nhập hàng tháng của mình lên cao hơn để có tiền cho con ăn học. Vòng vốn này chị xin vay thêm 1200USD để mua thêm hàng bán, nếu có thể thì chị sẽ kinh doanh thêm bánh kẹo, hoa quả.

loans.use: general goods for her store

loans.name: Bui Thi

texts.vi:
Thôn Xuân Bách, xã Quang Tiến is an industrial town. There are a lot of factories so there's a great concentration of workers in the region. Mrs Bùi Thị Tuyết,, 31 years old, has seized the opportunity in 2001 when she opened a beauty salon to serve the female workers. She used all her savings plus the loan from TYM to open her salon. Because she is a skillful and friendly person, her salon attracts a lot of customers. She has 2 employees working for her, each earning 50 USD a month. Her husband runs a refreshment stand. They also have 7 rooms for rent. Their business is striving under their skillful management. Their revenue is 300-350 USD a month. Mrs Tuyết wishes to obtain big loans from TYM to further expand their businesses. She is seeking 1200 USD to buy cosmetics and make up accessories for her salon.

Translated from Vietnamese by Khang Ho-Si, Kiva volunteer.

Thôn Xuân Bách, xã Quang Tiến là nơi khu công nghiệp Nội Bài hoạt động với nhiều nhà máy. Nơi đây tập trung đông công nhân lao động thuê nhà và sinh hoạt nên các dịch vụ phát triển mạnh. Là một phụ nữ năng động và có đầu óc kinh doanh, chị Bùi Thị Tuyết, 31 tuổi, nhanh chóng nắm bắt được nhu cầu làm đẹp của những chị em công nhân và mở cửa hàng thẩm mỹ năm 2001. Để có tiền đầu tư mở cửa hàng, ngoài nguồn vốn tự có chị xin tham gia vào Quỹ Tình thương để vay vốn làm ăn. Nhờ khéo tay và có duyên nói chuyện nên cửa hàng của chị thu hút rất đông khách. Công việc nhiều chị Tuyết thuê thêm 2 nhân công và trả lương 50USD/tháng. Bên cạnh đó gia đình chị còn có một cửa hàng kinh doanh giải khát do chồng chị trông coi và 7 gian nhà cho công nhân thuê. Công việc kinh doanh đang rất phát đạt với khả năng quản lý của hai vợ chồng chị Tuyết. Thu nhập hàng tháng của hai vợ chồng từ 300-350USD. Mong muốn của chị là luôn được vay các mức vốn lớn từ Quỹ để đầu tư mở rộng dự án. Mức vốn đề nghị của chị Tuyết vòng này là 1200USD để mua mỹ phẩm và dụng cụ làm đẹp.

loans.use: Buy cosmetic and make up accessories

loans.name: Dao Thi

texts.vi:
Mrs. Đào Thị Sáu, 45 years old, joins the TYM Fund since early day of the fund in August 1992. At the time her family was living in a very hardship state and it seemed there was no way around it. She used her first loan of 20USD to buy a pair of piglets. After 10 years of hard working she saves a considerable sum. The savings and more funds from the loans go to her husband’s woodshop which produces furniture to people in the area. At the present she still tends livestock. The average monthly income is hefty at 300USD. This time she would like to apply for a loan of 1200USD to invest in her livestock farm and her husband’s woodshop.

Translated from Vietnamese by ngungo, Kiva volunteer.


Chị Đào Thị Sáu, 45 tuổi, tham gia Quỹ từ những ngày đầu tiên khi Quỹ thành lập vào tháng 8 năm 1992. Lúc đó gia đình chị còn rất nghèo không có vốn để làm ăn để phát triển kinh tế. Khi được vay 20USD chị đã mua 1 đôi lợn giống về chăn nuôi. Nhờ chịu khó lao động và dành dụm, S. 10 năm chị Sáu đã có một món tiền tích lũy. Tận dụng tay nghề mộc của chồng, chị Sáu đã vay thêm vốn để mở xưởng mộc, chuyên đóng đồ dùng sinh hoạt phục vụ cho bà con trong xóm và các xã lân cận. Hiện nay chị Sáu vẫn tiếp tục chăn nuôi bò, lợn sinh sản cho thu nhập cao. Thu nhập bình quân của gia đình một tháng là 300USD. Vòng vốn này chị Sáu xin vay 1200USD để mua bò, thức ăn gia súc và đồ gỗ.

loans.use: Invest in livestock and wood shop.

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for TYM Fund - Oct 22, 2008)

loans.name: Dao Thi

texts.vi:
Mrs. Đào Thị Thái, 60 years old, joins the TYM Fund in 2002. Her husband was ill and passed away 7 years ago. All her children are grown up. She inherits the family’s herbal medicine. In fact, her first loan of 70USD was used to buy herbs. She is now running a clinic at the center of downtown Sóc Sơn. The average monthly income is 300USD. This time she would like to apply for a loan of 1200USD to invest in her clinic.

Translated from Vietnamese by ngungo, Kiva volunteer.


Chị Đào Thị Thái, 60 tuổi, tham gia Quỹ từ năm 2002. Chồng chị ốm bệnh mất đã 7 năm, các con đều đã trưởng thành. Vốn có nghề thuốc gia truyền, vòng vốn đầu tiên chị vay 70USD để mua thuốc nam, khám và chữa bệnh. Với uy tín và tay nghề giỏi chị đã chữa khỏi cho nhiều người bệnh quanh vùng. Hiện nay chị có một cơ sở khám chữa bệnh và bốc thuốc nam tại trung tâm chợ Sóc Sơn. Bình quân một tháng chị Thái thu nhập khoảng 300USD. Vòng vốn này chị tiếp tục xin vay 1200USD để mua nguyên liệu làm thuốc.

loans.use: Buy herbal medicine

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for TYM Fund - Oct 22, 2008)

loans.name: Ariel Erasmo

texts.es:
Mr. Erasmo lives in the neighborhood of Cristo el Rosario. He is 49 years old, married, and has three children, aged 13, 12, and 4. His business is a general store that he started up with his own money after selling land he owned in the city of Boaco; his wife works in the store as a shopkeeper.

Mr. Erasmo has already been in business for four years, and the loan he is requesting would go toward supplying the store with all of the products needed for the Mother’s Day holiday season; his work as a mechanic provides a supplementary source of income. In the future he would like to set up a business as a wholesaler, doing the most that he can to help his children and improve their future.

Translated by Chris Knutson, Kiva Volunteer

El Sr. Erasmo habita en barrio Cristo el Rosario, tiene 49 años de edad es casado y le tienen tres hijos de 13, 12, y 4 años de edad. Su esposa es comerciante y trabaja en el negocio .su negocio es una pulpería el cual comenzó con dinero propio cuando vendió un terreno que tenia en la ciudad de Boaco.

Su experiencia es ya de cuatro años y el préstamo que solicita es para surtir la pulpería con todos los productos de día festivo de la temporada de las madres, también tiene otros ingresos provenientes de mecánica. En un futuro desea establecerlo como una distribuidora, preparar al máximo a sus hijos, consolidar su futuro.

loans.use: Purchasing products for his business

loans.name: Hoang Thi

texts.vi:
Mrs. Hoàng Thị Bình, 45 years old, joins the TYM Fund in 2002. She lives with her husband and their two children, one of them is still in school age. She used the funds from her first loan to invest in raising pigs for meat. The business prospered and she continues to take more loans to invest in poultry. After five years, now her family has a 5 room fully furnished house. At the present she has 80 chickens and 26 pigs ready for butcher shops. This time she would like to apply for a loan of 1200USD to invest livestock business.

Translated from Vietnamese by ngungo, Kiva volunteer.


Chị Hoàng Thị Bình, 45 tuổi, tham gia Quỹ năm 2002. Chị đang sống cùng chồng và 2 con, trong đó một cháu còn đi học. Vòng vốn đầu tiên chị Bình vay về đầu tư chăn nuôi lợn thịt. Công việc phát triển tốt cho thu nhập cao, chị Bình tiếp tục vay vốn chăn nuôi thêm gà thịt. Sau 5 năm tham gia, chị Bình đã làm được căn nhà ngói 5 gian khang trang và mua sắm đầy đủ tiện nghi sinh hoạt. Hiện tại gia đình chị đang nuôi 80 con gà thịt và 26 con lợn chuẩn bị xuất chuồng. Vòng vốn này chị Bình xin vay 1200USD để mua con giống và thức ăn gia súc.

loans.use: Buy pigs, chickens

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for TYM Fund - Oct 22, 2008)

loans.name: Nguyen Thi

texts.vi:
Mrs Nguyễn Thị Bình is 46, she participated in TYM the very first year that it was established in the region. Her initial loan of 20 USD was used to raise pigs. Her family living condition has gradually improved with the income generated. In 2000 she opened a store selling animal feed and fertilizer for farmers. Her husband passed away the same year leaving her with 4 young children. Life suddenly became difficult for her and her family. With the help of the women in her group, she has surpassed all the obstacles and raised her children. Today they are all grown up: one is married and has his own family and other two are working. Her business is running very well. Her revenue is 270-300 USD a month. She is seeking a new loan of 1200 USD to stock up her inventory.

Translated from Vietnamese by Khang Ho-Si, Kiva volunteer.

Chị Nguyễn Thị Bình, 46 tuổi, tham gia từ năm Quỹ được thành lập. Số vốn vay 20USD vòng đầu được chị đầu tư chăn nuôi lợn. Kinh tế gia đình phát triển dần qua các năm tham gia. Năm 2000 chị Bình mở cửa hàng kinh doanh phân bón và thức ăn chăn nuôi. Trong năm đó chồng chị bị bệnh qua đời để lại cho chị 4 đứa con thơ dại, cuộc sống trở nên rất khó khăn. Nhờ có chị em trong cụm động viên giúp đỡ, chị Bình đã vượt qua tất cả và nuôi con ăn học trưởng thành. Đến nay đã có 1 cháu xây dựng gia đình và 2 cháu đi làm. Cửa hàng kinh doanh phân bón, thức ăn gia súc của chị ngày càng làm ăn phát đạt. Thu nhập bình quân hàng tháng của chị khoảng 270-300USD. Vòng vốn này chị xin vay 1200USD mua phân bón và thức ăn gia súc.

loans.use: Buy fertilizer and food for pigs, chickens

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for TYM Fund - Oct 23, 2008)

loans.name: Maria Esther

texts.es:
Maria C. lives in the Batahola North neighborhood, she is single, 52 years old and has a 15 year old daughter who studies high school. She sells snacks, coffee, ice cream, etc. Her goal is to help her daughter become a professional. She's had her small business for 9 years and started with a loan from AFODENIC selling clothes, but with the opening of a school it was better for her to sell in the cafeteria every day, the challenges she has faced are the changes in prices. With the loan she wants to invest more and use it in the school, she also wishes to buy a dresser. Maria is hardworking and has excellent references both personal and credit references.

Translated from Spanish by Sofia Burt, Kiva volunteer.

La Sra. María C.: vive en el barrio Batahola Norte es soltera con 52 años de edad Tiene una hija de 15 años cursa la secundaria su actividad económica es venta de golosinas, cafetería y helados, etc. Su objetivo es formar a su hija como toda una profesional. Ella tiene 9 años de tener este pequeño negocio comenzó prestando en AFODENIC, vendiendo ropa, pero con la apertura del colegio le beneficio vender cafetería que es diario, las dificultades que ha tenido son las variaciones de los precios .Con el préstamo que se le dará lo quiere para invertir mas y estabilizarlo en el colegio también desea comprar un ropero, la Sra. María es trabajadora y con referencias excelentes tanto personales como de crédito.

loans.use: To purchase a dresser and merchandise to sell at school cafeteria.

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for AFODENIC - Oct 23, 2008)

loans.name: Nguyen Thi

texts.vi:
Mrs. Nguyễn Thị L., 41 years old, joins the TYM Fund in 1994. Her first loan was a modest 50USD. She invested the funds to livestock. Things have been better since then. She’s saved a good sum. In 1999, she builds a woodshop for her husband with her savings. The shop produces furniture for both household and office’s uses. The shop has a good reputation. Currently the shop owns a 10,000USD delivery truck and also employs 4 workers with salary of 75USD a month each. This time she would like to apply for a loan of 1200USD to stock more wood for the shop.

Translated from Vietnamese by ngungo, Kiva volunteer.


Chị Nguyễn Thị L., 41 tuổi, tham gia Quỹ năm 1994. Vòng vốn đầu chị vay 50USD và đầu từ vào chăn nuôi lợn, gà. Qua các năm vay vốn từ Quỹ chủ yếu đầu tư chăn nuôi, kinh tế của gia đình phát triển tốt, chị L. đã dành dụm được một số vốn. Năm 1999 chị cùng chồng mở xưởng đóng đồ gỗ chuyên về nội thất và nhận làm khung cửa, tủ cho các đơn vị cơ quan. Cửa hàng của gia đình chị rất có uy tín và chất lượng. Hiện nay chị L. đã mua được ô tô chở hàng trị giá 10000USD, xưởng sản xuất của gia đình chị thuê 4 nhân công với mức lương hàng tháng 75USD/người. Công việc làm ăn phát đạt, chị L. muốn vay thêm 1200USD để mua thêm gỗ đóng đồ.

loans.use: Buy wood

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for TYM Fund - Oct 23, 2008)

loans.name: Nguyen Thi

texts.vi:
Mrs. Nguyễn Thị Tuyến, 50 years old, joins the TYM Fund in 1996. She is a widow and lives with her son. Both are hard workers. She invested her first loan to livestock. In 2003, she took a loan of 1,000USD to build 2 chicken batteries. Currently her farm has about 1000 chickens for both eggs and meat. The daily income is 10USD. This time she would like to apply for a loan of 1200USD to buy feed, young chickens.

Translated from Vietnamese by ngungo, Kiva volunteer.


Chị Nguyễn Thị Tuyến, 50 tuổi, tham gia Quỹ năm 1996. Vốn vay từ Quỹ được chị đầu tư chăn nuôi lợn gà. Mặc dù gia đình chỉ có 2 mẹ con nhưng là người phụ nữ dám nghĩ dám làm, năng động nên công việc kinh doanh ngày càng phát triển. Năm 2003, chị Tuyến vay 1000USD xây dựng 02 chuồng chăn nuôi gà. Hiện tại chị có 1000 con gà đẻ trứng và gà thịt, mỗi ngày cho thu nhập 10USD. Vòng vốn này chị xin vay 1200 USD để mua cám chăn nuôi gà và mua gà con để thay thế cho đàn gà sắp xuất chuồng.

loans.use: Buy chickens

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for TYM Fund - Oct 24, 2008)

loans.name: Phan Thi

texts.vi:
Mrs. Phan Thi T., 35 years old, joined the Fund since 2000. When she first borrowed money, she used it to breed chickens and pigs. Her income from breeding pigs and chickens was used for expanding the farm, increasing the number of animals. In 2006, Mrs. T. switched from breeding pigs and chickens to investing in building material such as bricks, cements, tiles, etc. Her store provides materials for many building projects and also satisfies local needs. Besides, she collects wasted material. In 2007, Mrs. T. was able to build a 3-storey house of 150 meter square area. This time, she wants to borrow 1200 USD to buy more bricks, sands and gravels. Her average income is 300 USD/month.

Translated from Vietnamese by Duy Hua, Kiva volunteer.

Chị Phan Thị Thủy, 35 tuổi, tham gia Quỹ năm 2000. Vốn vay vòng 1 được chị đầu tư vào chăn nuôi lợn, gà. Thu nhập từ chăn nuôi chị sử dụng để xây dựng công trình phụ, mở rộng chuồng trại phát triển số lượng gia súc, gia cầm. Năm 2006 chị Thủy chuyển sang kinh doanh vật liệu xây dựng như gạch, tấm lợp Phibro xi măng, gạch men … Cửa hàng của chị chuyên cung cấp vật liệu xây dựng cho các công trình và phục vụ nhu cầu nhỏ lẻ của người dân trong vùng. Ngoài ra chị mua bán, thu gom phế liệu. Năm 2007 chị Thủy đã xây dựng được ngôi nhà 3 tầng rộng 150m2. Vòng này chị Thủy xin vay thêm 1200USD để mua gạch, cát sỏi. Thu nhập bình quân của gia đình là 300USD/tháng.

loans.use: Buy building materials

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for TYM Fund - Oct 23, 2008)

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Buy food for bear

loans.name: Milena Del Rosario

texts.es:
Milena is 47 years old, single and has no children, she lives with her family (mother and siblings). At the young age of 17, when she was studying 12th grade, she started to teach without any formal training and with her own efforts she has been able to improve, due to the fact that she achieved her title of elementary school teacher and is currently working towards her Licentiate in Education. Because she was raised in a rural community, in addition to teaching, she also does production activities with the help of her brothers. With 8 previous loans, she has bought 3 calves and 1 stud, which she brands with her mother's branding iron. This 9th loan will be used to plant pasture to feed her animals and to plant corn for self consumption. This loan is urgent because winter is coming up and she needs to have the land ready for sowing.

Teacher T. is a loyal client because she started getting loans when the institution opened its doors to the waged-earning sector in 2001, when no banks or micro financing institutions would risk to work with vulnerable sectors. She feels fulfilled with the attention given to her, that's why she is still with us, she has an excellent sense of morality to pay back and most of the time she repays her loans one or two months in advance.

Translated from Spanish by Sofia Burt, Kiva volunteer.

Milena de 47 años, soltera, no tiene hijos, habita junto a su familia (mamá y hermanos), desde muy jovencita a la edad de 17 años inicio el apostolado del magisterio de manera empirica, cuando estudiaba el 3er año de bachillerato, con su propio esfuerzo ha logrado superarse, ya que obtuvo su titulo de maestra de educacion primaria, tecnico medio en contabilidad y actualmente esta estudiando la Licenciatura en Pedagogia. Como ha sido criada en el campo, ademas de la docencia realiza labores productivas con el apoyo de sus hermanos. Con los 8 creditos anteriores ha comprado 3 vaquillas y un semental, los que herra con el fierro de su mama, este noveno credito lo utilizara para la siembra de 3 Mzs de zacate mejorado para la alimentacion de sus animales y 3 Mzs de maiz para el autoconsumo, la urgencia de este credito es porque ya se aproxima el invierno y quiere tener el terreno preparado para la siembra.

La profesora T. ha sido una cliente fiel, pues inicio con sus creditos cuando la institucion abre las puertas al sector asalariado en el año 2001, cuando ningun bancio ni microfiananciera se arriesgab a a trabajar con los sectores vulnerables. Ella se siente satisfecha de la atencion que ha sido objeto y es por eso que continua con nosotros, tiene una excelnte moral de pago, casi siempre paga con uno o dos meses de anticipacion sus creditos.

loans.use: Planting animal feed and corn

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for AFODENIC - Oct 23, 2008)

loans.name: Tran Thi

texts.vi:
Mrs. Tran Thi M., 60 years old, joined the Fund since 1995. Her family economy at that time was very poor because of lack of money and her husband was not in good health conditions. With the borrowed money from the Fund, she started breeding pigs. At first, she had one pig, and the number of pigs increased gradually. Her profit from breeding pigs was used to help her son build a house, and furnish her own home. Currently, she is breeding 30 pigs, each of 45kg and they are all ready to be sold. This time, she wants to borrow 1200 USD to expand her farm and buy more pigs. Her average income is 300USD/ month.

Translated from Vietnamese by Duy Hua, Kiva volunteer.

Chị Trần Thị Mạc, 60 tuổi, tham gia Quỹ năm 1995. Kinh tế gia đình còn rất nhiều khó khăn do thiếu vốn làm ăn, chồng chị lại bị bệnh. Được vay vốn của Quỹ chị Mạc mua lợn giống về nuôi. Lúc đầu chỉ có 1 con, sau số lượng lợn nuôi tăng dần. Số tiền lãi từ chăn nuôi được chị Mạc mua đất làm nhà cho con trai, sắm tiện nghi sinh hoạt trong gia đình. Hiện nay chị đang nuôi 30 con lợn thịt, mỗi con khoảng 45 kg và chuẩn bị xuất chuồng. Dự định vòng vốn này chị Mạc xin vay 1200 USD để mở rộng chuồng trại và mua lợn giống. Thu nhập bình quân hàng tháng của chị Mạc là 300USD.

loans.use: Buy pigs and expand farm

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for TYM Fund - Oct 24, 2008)

loans.name: Gladys

texts.en:
Gladys Medina is a single, 45-year-old mother of one child, and she takes care of her mother and her son.

She is a teacher in a primary school located in San Lorenzo. However, teaching is not a well-paid profession in Paraguay, so her salary is very low and is not enough to cover all of the expenses of her household.

To generate additional money, she rents out a house to a transport company. But, because the house that she rents is quite old, the company only promises to continue renting the house as long as Gladys makes improvements to the property. Therefore, Gladys is seeking a loan to make such improvements to the house.

loans.use: To meet the demands of her tenant (a transport company) by making improvements to the house that the company rents from her.

loans.name: Silvano

texts.en:
Silvano C. is a single, 53-year-old man who has two sons living in Spain. Paraguayans tend to emigrate from Paraguay to countries such as Spain and Argentina in order to generate more income than they can in Paraguay. According to such people, there is no other solution than to migrate to other countries because they cannot find jobs in Paraguay. Consequently, remittances from those who have moved to other countries are a very important source of income to the people of Paraguay.

The need to help his parents generate more income led Silvano to start working as a child. Fifteen years ago he decided to open a despensa (grocery store) in his neighborhood, and his despensa has grown substantially over the years. In the future, Silvano plans to expand his despensa and convert it into a mini supermarket.

Silvano is now seeking a loan in order to purchase products for the despensa, including: milk, sugar, pasta, drinks and other such goods. With the additional income he expects to generate from sales as a result of the requested loan, Silvano believes that he could provide his sons with a good education and that he could build his own house.

loans.use: To purchase additional products for his ever-growing despensa (grocery store) such as milk, sugar, pasta, and drinks.

loans.name: Zaida Antonia

texts.es:
Zaida is a single mother and is 38 years old, she lives in the Villa Venezuela neighborhood. With her mother's help she has been able to establish herself as a retailer and help her children who are 16 and 4 years old. 3 years ago, she was able to start a business from her home selling items where she does well and is able to make an income. Her mother however, has a business of basic grains who Zaida needs to support because of her mother's bad health. She will be taken care of her mother's store to be able to keep it running for which she needs working capital to keep the sales permit and store location.

Translated from Spanish by Sofia Burt, Kiva volunteer.

Zaida es una madre soltera de 38 años de edad, habita en el barrio de Villa Venezuela con ayuda de su señora madre ha logrado establecerse como comerciante y sacar adelante a sus hijos de 16 y 4 años de edad. Hace 3 años logró poner un negocio en su casa de venta de ropa usada en donde le va bien y logra tener algunos ingresos. La madre de Zaida tiene un negocio de ventas varias, como granos básicos, perecederos y frutas, pero ella se encuentra mal de salud, por lo que Zaida de ahora en adelante se hará cargo del negocio y lo administrará, es por eso que solicita el crédito, para poder levantar el negocio y nodejar perder el mismo, ya que perdería tambien el permiso de venta y también el local.

loans.use: Working capital for store location

loans.name: Tecla's Group

texts.en:
There is an area in the city of San Lorenzo know as Marketalia where many homeless people settled a few years ago. Because they did not have any money or a place to go and because they did not receive any aid from the government, they decided to establish their villages there. Many of the Marketalia’s inhabitants feel as though they are victims of the current system. Therefore, they often complain about their situations: the fact that they are poor and the lack of opportunities that exist for them to prosper. Further, they believe that the government should be responsible for fixing their problems.

Fortunately, however, ever since Fundacion Paraguaya formed a committee of entrepreneurial women in Marketalia, this idea of waiting for the government to fix such problems began to vanish. In fact, the members of committee “La Esperanza” (hope) realized that they could do many things to bring prosperity to their lives. Indeed, the group members serve as great examples for the other individuals in the area because the group members' successful businesses make other villagers realize that each one of them is capable of changing his or her own world for the better without the need for governmental involvement.

More specifically, the group is comprised of 15 women whose businesses include: despensas (grocery stores), copetines (mini bar-restaurants), sewing shops, dress-making shops and shops where cloths, drinks, food and ice cream are sold. The money provided by the requested credit will be invested to purchase fabrics, cleaning products, vegetables, sugar, meat, drinks, ice cream, bottoms, threads and other such items.

loans.use: To purchase fabrics, cleaning products, vegetables, sugar, meat, drinks, ice cream, bottoms, threads and other products for the group members' thriving businesses.

loans.name: Areli

texts.es:
Miss C. works as a nurse in the Rama health center, she is 34 years old and has 9 years of service. She has 3 children (ages 13, 15 and 18) who are students, she is with Jemer Antonio Lopez who works at MINSA. Together they have been able to help their children and to slowly build a house.

Miss C. is known for being a great person, with good feelings, respectful, honest and very responsible. She wishes to study to be a professional. She asks for a loan to build a room to her older daughter and to improve the conditions of their home.

Translated from Spanish by Sofia Burt, Kiva volunteer.

La Sra C. es Trabajadora del centro de salud del Rama como enfermera con 34 años de edad y 9 de servic tiene 3 hijos( 13,15, 18) los tres estudian , acompañada del Sr Jemer antonio Lopez que tambien trabaja en el MINSA. han logrado juntos ir sacando adelante asus hijos y construyendo poco a poco su vivienda.

La sra C. es conocida en el sector salud como una persona de buenos sentimeintos, respetuosa y honrada y con una gran responsabilidad, desea continuar estudiando para profesionalizarse . solicia el credito para construir un cuarto a su hija mayor y mejorar las condiciones en el hogar

loans.use: Home Improvement

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for AFODENIC - Oct 26, 2008)

loans.name: Fanta

texts.en:
Fanta K. is 35 years old. She is married and has 6 children. Her husband is a welder and has a small workshop.

Fanta sells palm oil and diesel fuel wholesale and she would like to expand her business to earn more income. Four of Fanta’s children are in school and both parents need to work hard to earn enough to meet their educational expenses. Therefore, Fanta is requesting a loan of Le.3,500,000 ($1200 USD).

Fanta wants to increase the amount of palm oil and diesel fuel that she purchases at one time, so that she can sell more on a consistent basis without running out. She needs a loan from Kiva for that purpose.

loans.use: To buy palm oil and diesel fuel in bulk to resell

loans.name: Pabla Petrona

texts.es:
In addition to her business Pabla is a primary school teacher in her neighborhood. She has worked with our institution for about ten years and has received 8 loans that she has invested in working capital to stock her business. This client has improved her quality of life. She has done so also with the help of her life partner who is a farmer. She has two children who are in secondary school.

Translated from Spanish by a Kiva volunteer.

Esta cliente ademas del negocio es profesora de primaria en una escuela de la localidad, trabaja con nuestra institución desde hace unos diez años donde ha obtenido ocho créditos los que ha invertido en capital de trabajo donde ha surtido su negocio, se ve que la cliente ha mejorado sus condiciones de vida, esto tambien con la ayuda de su compañero de vida quien es agricultor, ella tiene dos hijos los que estan en la secundaria .

loans.use: The loan will be used as working capital to buy shoes, clothing and other products.

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for Fundación Leon 2000 - Oct 23, 2008)

loans.name: Flora

texts.es:
Flora is 36 years old, she works in retail and lives in the Georgino Andrade neighborhood with her husband, she works with him in their small business to offer a better life to their two young children. They work on a small business of mirrors and frames established 10 years ago. Their plans are to develop the business and set it up according to legal commercial requirements to guarantee more stability. They ask for a loan to improve an area in their home which will be used for product finishing.

Translated from Spanish by Sofia Burt, Kiva volunteer.

La Señora Flora de 36 años de edad es comerciante , habita en el barrio Georgino Andrade junto a su esposo quientrabaja en conjunto con su pequeño negocio para garantizarles las mejores condiciones a sus dos hijos menores. Su actividad es una pqueña industria de espejos y cuadros con clientela establecida de 10 años sus planes son desarrollar el negocio y legalizarlo conforme a requisitos comerciales para garantizar una mayor estabilidad. Solicita el prestamo para mejorar su vivienda que servira para acondionar el area de acabado de los productos.

loans.use: Home improvement for product finishing

loans.name: Arelis

texts.es:
Arelis is 42 years old and lives in the Hialeah neighborhood, she is single and has two children that are 18 and 24 years old. Her children work to help with the household expenses and this way they are able to help their mom. Arelis sells cosmetics and silver bracelets among other things. She started by selling cosmetics and now has four years of experience. The loan will be invested in the purchase of construction materials to build a small kitchen.

Her future plans are to diversify the products she sells and find new market segments to make a profit and live with dignity with her family.

Translated from Spanish by Sofia Burt, Kiva volunteer.

Doña Aralis tiene 42 años de edad y habita en el barrio Hialeah, es soltera con dos hijos uno de 18 y 24 años de edad. Los jóvenes ya trabajan para aportar a los gastos de la familia y así ayudar a su mama la señora Arelis tiene una venta de cosmético y pulseras de plata y sus derivados, pues comenzó vendiendo cosmético ya son cuatro años de experiencia. El préstamo lo va invertir en compra de materiales de construcción para hacer una pequeña cocina.

Sus planes a futuro es diversificar productos y encontrar nuevos segmento de mercados y obtener ganancia y vivir dignamente con mi familia.

loans.use: Home Improvement

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for AFODENIC - Oct 26, 2008)

loans.name: Jenny Del Carmen

texts.es:
Jenny lives in the neighborhood of Recreo. She is 33 years-old, married, and has two sons. Her husband works as an Urbina bus driver to support the household. Four years ago, Jenny began selling cosmetics and watches. She would like a loan to build a room. In the future, she would like to diversify her products and capture new segments of the market to support herself. Her main goal is to open a grocery store.

Translated from Spanish by Joanna Silverman, Kiva Volunteer.

La señora Jenny habita en el barrio el Recreo tiene 33 años de edad, casada y con dos hijos varones. Su esposo trabaja como conductor de una ruta de la cooperativa Urbina de esta manera el aporta a su familia con los gastos. Doña Jenny vende cosmético juguetes y relojes tiene cuatro años de experiencia y inicio sus ventas con cosméticos, el préstamo lo quiere para construir un cuarto. A futuro quiere diversificar su producto y acaparar nuevos segmento de mercado y así sastifacer sus deseos y necesidades pero su propósito es poner una pulpería.

loans.use: Home Improvement

loans.name: Emerita Del Socorro

texts.es:
Señora B. is 47 years-old, married, and lives in the Memorial Sandino neighborhood. She has three children who are 22, 24, and 26 years-old. Her husband is an auditor and helps with the family’s expenses. She has worked as a teacher for sixteen years.

She started her business with her savings from teaching and bought her taxi. She would like a loan to build a roof over two rooms. In the future, she wants to buy new units and to build a room for each of her children.

Translated from Spanish by Joanna Silverman, Kiva Volunteer

La Sra. B. es casada, habita en el barrio Memorial Sandino, tiene tres hijos de 22, 24, y 26 años de edad, tiene 47 años. Su esposo trabaja es auditor y ayuda en los gastos de su familia, ella trabaja como docente tiene diesciseis años de experiencia.

Su negocio lo comenzó con sus ahorros del magisterio y compro su taxi, el préstamo lo quiere para construir el techo de dos cuartos. A futuro es comprar nuevas unidades y construir un cuarto para cada uno de sus hijos.

loans.use: Home Improvement

loans.name: Carmenza

texts.es:
Carmenza B. is a very hard-working woman who runs a general store in her home in the district of Cinco Pinos in the city of Chinandega. Currently her business enables her to pay for her two daughters' education. Her daughters also help out in her store when they're at home. Since she started her business she has gotten through many difficult times and been able to get ahead. Ceprodel has been a pillar of help in her business because it has enabled her to receive loans that she invested in her business well.

She is now seeking Ceprodel's support to take out a loan to purchase more products to sell and thus to continue to pay for her daughters' studies. Ceprodel's support benefits both her and her daughters, who she loves very much.

Translated from Spanish by a Kiva volunteer.

La señora Carmenza B. es una persona muy esforzada que se dedica al negocio de pulpería en su localidad de habitación en el municipio de Cinco Pinos en la ciudad de Chinandega. Actualmente su negocio le permite el pago de los estudios de sus dos hijas que de igual manera le apoyan con el negocio cuando están en el hogar. Desde que inició el negocio ha logrado con muchísimas dificultades salir adelante y Ceprodel ha sido un pilar en el negocio ya que le ha proporcionado créditos que los ha sabido invertir correctamente en su labor.

Actualmente ella busca el apoyo en Ceprodel para obtener un crédito que le brinde la oportunidad de adquirir los productos para comercializarlos y de esta manera continuar con el mantenimiento de los estudios de sus hijas. Por medio de este apoyo brindado por Ceprodel es beneficiada tanto ella como sus hijas a las que tanto ama.

loans.use: Purchase of products to stock her general store

loans.name: Rafaela

texts.es:
Mrs. Rafaela O. lives in the neighborhood of "Memorial Sandino". She is 51 years old, and single. She sells cosmetics and clothes, a business in which she has 10 years of experience and that she started by selling clothes. With the loan she would like to build a 10 meter wall to enlarge her home. In the future she would like to establish a store in which she can offer different products and finish building her house so that she can have a decent home.

Translated from Spanish by Samantha, Kiva volunteer.

Doña Rafaela O. habita en el barrio Memorial Sandino, tiene 51 años de edad es soltera. Ella vende cosméticos y ropa y comenzó su negocio con la venta de ropa, ya son diez años de experiencia con el préstamo construirá 10 mts de pared para ampliar. En el futuro es instalar una tienda para ofrecer variedad de productos y terminar de construir su vivienda para una vida digna.

loans.use: To improve her house.

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for AFODENIC - Oct 24, 2008)

loans.name: Edelmira

texts.es:
With great enthusiasm and much spriti to get ahead she has a grocery store in the district of Cinco Pinos in Chinandega. She started her business five years ago with her own savings buying small quantities of merchandise. Over the years she has been stocking her store little by little. Now her biggest goal is to become a successful storekeeper and thus to provide for all of the needs of her small children who only have her support because she is a single mother and acts as father and mother to them.

She now urgently needs to stock her store with products and is thus seeking support through Ceprodel to take out a loan. The loan will enable her to purchase products from her suppliers. It is important to emphasize that she has been a loyal client of Ceprodel and has repaid all of her loans on time and has respected the established loan terms.

Translated from Spanish by a Kiva volunteer.

La dama Edelmira E. con mucho entusiasmo y gran espíritu de superación se dedica al negocio de pulpería en su municipio de habitación en Cinco Pinos de Chinandega. Inició el negocio desde hace cinco años con ahorros propios obteniendo pocas cantidades de mercadería pero al pasar los años ha venido surtiendo poco a poco el negocio. Hoy en día su mayor anhelo es convertirse en una gran comerciante y así suplir todas las necesidades de sus dos pequeños hijos los cuales solamente tienen su apoyo ya que por ser madre soltera hace el papel de padre y madre.

Hoy en día la necesidad que ella atraviesa es la urgencia de surtir el negocio con los productos y para ello busca apoyo en Ceprodel para obtener el crédito que le permita la compra de los productos a sus proveedores. Es necesario destacar que ella ha sido fiel cliente de Ceprodel habiendo cancelado todos los créditos en tiempo y forma de acuerdo a lo establecido.

loans.use: Purchase of articles to stock her business

loans.name: Meylin Eliette

texts.es:
Mrs. N. has been working with our institution for eight years where she's received eleven credits. These credits were used very well and were used for her steady job. She used to sell chicken, eggs from home. With the credit she was able to purchase a pick-up truck which she currently shares with her husband. They go out and sell on the streets and also sell some items from home. The client is married, has two kids which she supports. Their oldest son oversees the house while the parents go out to sell in the city.

Translated from Spanish by Maria Peterson, Kiva Volunteer.

La señora N. trabaja con nuestra institución desde hace ocho años donde ha manejado once creditos los que han sidi dirijidos a capital de trabajo y activo fijo, anteriormente su negocio era en su casa donde ella vendia pollo, huevos y otros con uno de los creditos otorgados compro una pequeña camioneta en la hoy en dí en compañia de su esposo salen a vender de forma ambulante y mantiene en su casa la venta igual que antes, La cliente esta casada y tiene dos hijos los que tambien apoyan el negocio ya que el hijo mayor es quien ve el negocio en la casa mienstras sus padres estan vendiendo fuera.

loans.use: Purchase of bread, eggs, cookies/crackers, sweets etc.

loans.name: Facundo

texts.es:
In the district of Cinco Pinos in the city of Chinandea, Facundo M. has spent much time as a farmer and has thus been able to support his household, his wife and his children. It is important to emphasize that he needs to remodel his house immediately because he has already started the work but does not have the finances to complete it.

For this reason Facundo M. is seeking help through Ceprodel to take out a loan that will enable him to continue the remodeling on his house. He, his wife and his two children will all benefit from the loan from Ceprodel. It is also important to emphasize that the sooner he receives the loan the better because he needs to restart the work soon because winter is approaching quickly and his house needs to be perfectly completed before that time of year.

Translated from Spanish by a Kiva volunteer.

En el municipio de Cinco Pinos en la ciudad de Chinandega, el caballero Facundo M. se ha dedicado por mucho tiempo a la agricultura con el fin de llevar el sustento a su casa de habitación compuesta por su esposa y dos hijos. Es necesario destacar que la necesidad que hoy en día atraviesa es la reconstrucción inmediata de su casa de habitación debido a que esta labor ya la había iniciada pero al no contar con el recurso económico se vio en la labor de suspender dicha obra hasta obtener el ingreso.

Por este motivo es que el caballero Facundo M. se refugia en Ceprodel para ser beneficiado con un crédito que le permita continuar con la obra de reconstrucción de su casa de habitación. Por medio del préstamo que Ceprodel le otorgue será beneficiado tanto el como su esposa y sus dos hijos. Es necesario destacar que mientras mas rápido logre obtener el crédito con mucha rapidez iniciará la labor de reconstrucción por el hecho de que pronto llega el invierno y al llegar esta estación del año, su casa debe de estar en perfectas condiciones.

loans.use: Purchase of materials to build an addition on his house

loans.name: Nilo Marcio

texts.es:
Mr. D. U. has been working with our institution for four years, he's received nine loans so far. He has modified his business since when he got started, he began selling used clothes. He then changed his business and taking advantage of her wife's business, began selling burgers, sandwiches, pastries, sodas and then got in the business of selling phone cards. He is married and has three kids who two are now married.

Translated from Spanish by Maria Peterson, Kiva Volunteer.

El señor D. U. trabja con nuestra institucion desde hace cuatro años donde obtiene nueve creditos, el señor D. ha modificado su negocio ya que cuando lo comenzamos a atender vendia ropa usada, luego cambio este negocio y aprovechando que su esposa ha trabajo en negocios de comida, el puso un negocio de venta de hamburguesas, sandwish, reposteria, gaseosas y ultimamente se ha metido ademas en el negocio de venta de trajetas y llamadas telefonicas. Es casado con tres hijos de los cuales dos ya estan casados.

loans.use: Purchase of soda, ham, bread, lettuce and other

loans.name: Simona De Los Angele

texts.es:
Señora Simona is 38 years-old, is married, and lives in District 380. She has two daughters, a 13 year-old and a 15 year-old. Her husband works in construction in Costa Rica and sends her monthly remittances. For four years, she has worked to support her household by cleaning and ironing clothes because they had little income.

With this loan, she will build her own room in the front of her house so that she can have more space. She wants to have a decent home so that her family is safe and comfortable.

Translated from Spanish by Joanna Silverman, Kiva Volunteer.

La Sra. Simona es casada, con 38 años de edad, habita en el barrio 380 tiene dos hijas de 13 y 15 años de edad. Su esposo trabaja en construcción en Costa Rica y le envía remesas mensuales, ella trabaja lavando y planchando tiene cuatro años de aportar debido ala necesidades del hogar ya que los ingresos eran poco.

Con el préstamo va a construir su casa en la parte de enfrente, lo cual le permitirá tener un cuarto solo y así estar más amplio. En el futuro es tener una vivienda digna que tenga las condiciones que le permitan tener seguridad y comodidad para su familia.

loans.use: Construction of a Home

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for AFODENIC - Oct 26, 2008)

loans.name: Heidi

texts.es:
Heidi M. is from the district of Cinco Pinos in Cinandega and sells various types of products in her own grocery store in her home. With much effort she has been able to get ahead because she is very dedicated to her business and has been able to meet the needs of her household.

Now the problem that she is facing is the lack of financing to purchase merchandise from suppliers and for this reason she is asking for a loan through Ceprodel to invest in her business by purchasing more products. It is very important to emphasize that when she has the merchandise she will have no problem selling it in her neighborhood and will thus be able to improve her business.

Translated from Spanish by a Kiva volunteer.

Heidi M. es una dama originaria del municipio de Cinco Pinos en Chinandega el cual se dedica a la labor de la venta de diferentes tipos de productos teniendo su propia pulpería en su localidad de habitación. Con mucho s esfuerzos ha logrado salir adelante ya que ha brindado gran dedicación a su negocio y por este motivo ha logrado suplir las necesidades de su hogar de habitación.

Hoy en día la problemática que esta dama atraviesa es la ausencia del recurso económico para la compra de la mercadería a los proveedores y es por este motivo que solicita préstamo en Ceprodel para invertir en su negocio por medio de la compra de los productos. Es de suma importancia destacar que al adquirir la mercadería puede comercializarla sin ningún problema en su sector de habitación dando lugar al mejoramiento de su negocio.

loans.use: Purchase of articles to expand her business

loans.name: Gloria Maria

texts.es:
Gloria is 43 years-old, lives in District 380, and has a ten-year old son. She is married and her husband works as a radio technician to support the family. Ten years ago, Gloria started her business selling fruits and vegetables. Her goal is to set up a market in her home. She would like to use the loan to buy clothing, dairy products, and soft drinks. In the future, she plans to remodel her establishment and to make her business as profitable as possible.

Translated from Spanish by Joanna Silverman, Kiva Volunteer.

Doña Gloria vive en el barrio 380, con 43 años de edad, tiene un hijo de diez años de edad. Es casada y su esposo trabaja, y aporta en los gastos del hogar su oficio es radio técnico. La Sra. Gloria comenzó su negocio vendiendo frutas y verduras, lleva diez años de experiencia ella logro instalar una pulpería en su casa y quiere invertir su préstamo para comprar ropa y productos lácteos, gaseosas. Sus planes a futuro es remodelar el establecimiento y lograr un negocio que le genere mayor ganancia.

loans.use: Purchase of Merchandise for her Business

loans.name: Israel

texts.es:
Israel S. is a gentleman resident of the municipally Cinco Pinos of the city of Chinandega and works very hard in the agriculture business. He is the father of a family with two sons for which he has the responsibility to provide food, education and a decent roof over their heads. For this reason he has decided to invest in the reconstruction of his home which has suffered many damages due to natural disasters. Upon having started the reconstruction and not having enough financial resources, he has decided to lean on Ceprodel for the receipt of a loan to be able to continue with the improvements. For this reason he is confidently waiting for the approval of the loan so that he can continue with his arduous efforts to improve his home.

It is very important to note that through this loan he will be able to achieve his dream of having a proper home where he can house and develop his children.

Translated from Spanish by Laura Bobbit, Kiva volunteer.

Israel S. es un caballero originario del municipio de Cinco Pinos en la ciudad de Chinandega y se dedica muy esforzadamente a la labor de la agricultura. Es padre de familia con dos hijos a los que tiene el deber de brindar alimentación, estudios y un techo digno donde vivir. Por esta razón es que ha decidido invertir en la reconstrucción de su casa de habitación ya que actualmente ha sido muy lastimada por los fenómenos naturales y al haber iniciado en parte con la reconstrucción y al faltarle el recurso económico ha decidido apoyarse de Ceprodel por medio de la entrega de los créditos para continuar con la reconstrucción de la vivienda. Es por esto que muy confiadamente espera en esta aprobación para continuar con su ardua labor de la mejora de su vivienda.

Es de suma importancia destacar que gracias a estos créditos logrará alcanzar el sueño de su el cual consiste en tener un techo digno donde poder habitar y desarrollar a sus hijos.

loans.use: Purchase of construction materials

loans.name: Mirna De La Cruz

texts.es:
Mrs. U. C. and her husband are owners of a general goods store. They also own a tortilla-production plant. She's been working with our organization for three years, investing into her business. She receives the support of her husband who oversees the business while she tends to the selling of tortillas at home. Currently there are two people who work with her. Her son also lives with her.

Translated from Spanish by Maria Peterson, Kiva Volunteer.

La señora U. C. es dueña en conjunto con su esposo de un negocio de mercadería en general así como un taller de tortillas, ella trabaja con nuestra institución desde hace tres años invirtiendo en su negocio, ella tiene el apoyo de su esposo quien se encarga de ver el negocio de mercadería en general y ella atiende en la casa la venta de tortillas con ella trabajan dos personas en las toritllas, tiene un hijo el que vive con ella.

loans.use: Capital to purchase shoes, clothing, cosmetics, corn, fire wood.

loans.name: Juana

texts.es:
Juana Gómez owns a store that she opened thanks to some savings and a loan from Fundación Paraguaya. She knows that it’s tough to start a small business because traditional financial institutions generally don’t want to give credit to people with few resources. Because of this she contacted Fundación Paraguaya and presented her business project, winning support to start her business.

Today Juana is happy that her business is doing well. She is the mother of five and lives with her spouse. Her husband helps by minding the store. Juana sacrifices a lot, and her day starts at 4am when she goes to the municipal market to buy necessary supplies.

Juana’s business is in her home, and is open from 6am to 9:30pm. In addition, she runs a bakery, making cakes and other desserts for birthday parties by request. Juana is a very active woman and says that working makes her happy, because she knows that many people from her country don’t have the same good luck.

Juana would like a loan to buy various merchandise for her store, such as: tea, drinks, noodles, and rice. She’ll also purchase ingredients for baking, like: milk, sugar, flour, coloring, flavoring, chocolates, vanilla, eggs, and more.

Translated from Spanish by Sarah Bishop, Kiva Volunteer.

Juana Gómez posee una despensa que logro abrir gracias a un pequeño ahorro que tenía y créditos que consiguió con la Fundación Paraguaya Ella cuenta que es muy difícil iniciar una micro empresa pequeña con ayuda de entidades financieras ya que por lo general, no quieren otorgar créditos a personas de escasos recursos; fue así que contacto con la Fundación Paraguaya y presentando su proyecto de negocio logró conseguir un apoyo para iniciar su emprendimiento.

Hoy día ella cuenta feliz que su negocio marcha bien, ella es madre de cinco e hijos y vive en pareja. Su pareja la ayuda en el negocio con la atención del mismo. Juana lleva una vida muy sacrificada ya que su jornada empieza a las 4 am que es cuando va al mercado municipal de la ciudad para comprar las mercaderías necesarias para su despensa.

El negocio lo tiene en su domicilio y abre desde las 6 am hasta las 9:30 pm. Además de esto ella se dedica a la repostería, haciendo tortas y confites para cumpleaños y acontecimientos bajo pedido. Es una mujer muy activa y cuenta que el trabajo la hace feliz, ya que sabe que muchas personas en nuestro país no cuentan con la misma suerte que ella.

Juana solicita el préstamo para la compra de varios artículos de almacén como yerba, bebidas, fideos, arroz así como también ingredientes para la elaboración de sus tortas como leche, azúcar, harina leudante, colorantes permitidos, esencias varias, chocolates, vainillas, huevos y otros.

loans.use: Purchase tea, sugar, flour, canned goods, drinks, eggs, noodles, coloring, vanilla, etc.

loans.name: Josefina

texts.es:
Mrs. Josefina has been with the Fundación since 2005, when she began a small kiosk that slowly grew, thanks to earnings and investment. Now she has a well-stocked store where she sells basic foodstuffs like flour, noodles, meat, sugar, canned goods, colas, and products for the home.

There are many people who work in the area, so Josefina also financed a small restaurant where she sells fast food, breakfasts and lunches, to local workers.

Josefina lives with her husband and married son. She also has two daughters, both of whom live in Spain and send money each month to help support the family.

The loan will be used to expand the dining area, which is currently limited to the patio of her house, so that Josefina can provide a comfortable space to more people who come to eat at her restaurant.

Translated from Spanish by Sarah Bishop, Kiva Volunteer.

La Señora Josefina trabaja con la Fundación solicitando créditos desde el año 2005, ella comenzó con un pequeño kiosco que fue creciendo poco a poco gracias a las ganancias e inversiones que fue realizando. Hoy día posee una despensa bien surtida en donde vende productos comestibles y de primera necesidad como harina, fideos, carnes, azúcar, productos enlatados, gaseosas, productos para el hogar, entre otras cosas.

Debido a que en la zona hay muchas personas que trabajan ella también habilito un pequeño comedor en donde vende comidas rápidas, desayunos y almuerzos a los obreros de la zona.

Doña Josefina vive con su marido y un hijo que ya esta casado, también tiene dos hijas que viven y trabajan en España quienes la ayudan económicamente desde allí enviándole dinero mensualmente.

El crédito solicitado será destinado para la ampliación de un salón de modo a que pueda brindar mayor comodidad a las personas que van a comer a su local ya que por ahora su comedor lo habilito en el patio de su casa.

loans.use: Expand a dining room.

loans.name: Edgar  Vicente

texts.es:
Has been working with this institution for three years and has received six loans. The last three have been used to improve chicken production since he now owns a farm that produces short quantitiies. He hopes to continue working on this and develop it into something big. He works with his father-in-law since he knows about this kind of business. He's married with a young child, wife is unemployed. He also works as a bill collector for his city.
Translated from Spanish by Maria Peterson, Kiva Volunteer.

Trabaja con nuestra institución desde hace tres  años se le han otorgado seis creditos de los cuales los ultimos tres han sido para mejorar la producción de pollo ya que cuenta con una granja la que produce en pocas cantidades y la que espera poder llegar a desarrollar con el tiempo, el trabaja en conjunto con su suegro ya que este conoce de este tipo de negocio, casado con un hijo pequeño, su esposa esta desempleada, el ademas del negocio trabaja como gestor de cobro en una institución de la ciudad.

loans.use: Reactivate a farm and purchase of chickens, food, and vitamins

loans.name: Marta Lorena

texts.es:
Mrs. Marta Lorena M. M. is a very hard working person who works in her general store and thus provides for her family and the necessities of her home. She is a lady that has been able to maintain her two small children through her investment in her business which she attains with a lot of sacrifice,

In spite of the difficult financial situations that she has been through, she has been able to improve her business thanks to the loans that she received from Ceprodel which she has used to purchase goods for her store. With these loans she has improved the variety of her products and has been able to provide better living conditions for her children who need them so much. For this reason she is once again hoping to benefit from a loan for the purchase products to stock her general store.

Translated from Spanish by Laura Bobbit, Kiva volunteer.

La señora Marta Lorena M. M. es una persona muy esforzada que se dedica a su negocio de pulpería con el que abastece a su familia en las necesidades del hogar. Es una dama que ha logrado mantener a sus dos pequeños hijos gracias a la inversión que ha hecho en su negocio con mucho sacrificio.

A pesar de las difíciles situaciones económicas que ha atravesado, hoy en día ha mejorado su negocio gracias a los créditos otorgados por Ceprodel el que los ha utilizado para la compra de los productos para el negocio. Con estos créditos ha logrado ampliar mas sus productos y además le ha brindado mejores oportunidades de vida a sus hijos que tanto lo necesita. Por este motivo una vez mas espera en ser beneficiada con el crédito para la compra de los productos para surtir su pulpería.

loans.use: Purchase of merchandise for the general store

loans.name: Marlene

texts.es:
Mrs. Marlene R. works very hard in a general store where she attends to her loyal customers with much enthusiasm and joy. Her business is in the municipality of Cinco Pinos in the city of Chinandega in beautiful Nicaragua. She is a lady that stands out as very happy and friendly with other people. She is a single mother with the responsibility of supporting her small, school age son.

As all businesses, her general store is in need of an investment in order to move ahead. For this reason she has come to Ceprodel to obtain a loan that will enable her to acquire her products and basic grains for their respective sale in her general store business.

This loan will benefit Mrs. Marlene and her business and also her small son that need so much from his mother.

Translated from Spanish by Laura Bobbit, Kiva volunteer.

La señora Marlene R. se dedica muy esforzadamente al negocio de pulpería donde atiende con mucho entusiasmo y alegría a sus fieles clientes en el municipio de Cinco Pinos de la ciudad de Chinandega de la bella Nicaragua. Es una dama que se ha destacado por ser muy alegre y amable con las demás personas. Es madre soltera y con la responsabilidad de mantener a su pequeño hijo en edad escolar.

Como todo negocio, la pulpería requiere de inversión para salir adelante y para ello acude a Ceprodel para ser beneficiada con el crédito necesario que le permita adquirir sus productos y los granos básicos para su respectiva venta en su negocio de pulpería.

Por medio de este crédito es beneficiada tanto la señora Marlene por medio de su pulpería como también su pequeño hijo que tanto necesita de su madre.

loans.use: Purchase of merchandise

loans.name: Modesto

texts.es:
Mr. Modesto Montalban has a general store in the municipality of Cinco Pinos in the city of Chinandega. He has been dedicating his time to this for quite a while since he is responsible for the support of his family which consists of his spouse and two school aged daughters who are excellent students.

According to Mr. Montalban, the reason for his efforts is his desire to provide his children the proper conditions for their development. For this reason he is currently seeking the support of Ceprodel to obtain a loan with which he can buy products to be sold in his business. The loan will benefit his business since with a larger quantity of available products he can increase his revenues and better satisfy his customers, this way improving his general store business.

Translated from Spanish by Laura Bobbit, Kiva volunteer.

El señor Modesdto M. se dedica al negocio de pulpería en el municipio de Cinco Pinos de la ciudad de Chinandega. Por mucho tiempo se ha dedicado a esta labor ya que está en su obligación mantener a su familia que se compone de su cónyuge y dos hijas en edad escolar que se han destacado por ser excelentes estudiantes.

Según el señor M. el motivo de sus esfuerzos se debe a que son sus anhelos brindarles a sus hijos las condiciones necesarias para su desarrollo. Por este motivo es que hoy en día busca el apoyo en Ceprodel para obtener el crédito necesario que le permita la adquisición de sus productos para comercializarlos en su negocio. Con este crédito se beneficia su negocio ya que al adquirir mayores cantidades de productos serán mas altas sus ventas percibidas y habrá mayor satisfacción del cliente lo que preemitirá que incremente su mercado de pulpería.

loans.use: Purchase of merchandise to improve his business.

loans.name: Orfina

texts.es:
Mrs. Orfina P., as all Nicaraguan women, is very hard working and has a business selling shoes and clothing from her residence or if necessary as a street vendor. She does need to travel to other places to be able to attain the income from the sales of these products.

She is a resident of the municipality Cinco Pinos of Chinandega where she attends to her customers offering them shoes and clothing in order to provide for the necessities of her home. Mrs. Orfina is currently in need of support due to her lack of financial resources for the purchase of merchandise. She has turned to Ceprodel to acquire a loan that will enable her to buy the products that she can sell. She is confidently waiting for this loan approval so that she can continue to maintain her home.

Translated from Sapnish by Laura Bobbit, Kiva volunteer.

La señora Orfina P. como toda mujer nicaragüense es muy trabajadora dedicándose al negocio de la venta de zapatos y ropas el cual atiende en su casa de habitación y a la vez ambulantemente cuando es necesario y le es de necesidad viajar a otros lugares para percibir sus ingresos por medio de la venta de estos productos.

Es originaria del municipio de Cinco Pinos en Chinandega donde atiende a sus clientes para ofrecerle los zapatos y ropa para suplir las necesidades en el hogar. La necesidad que hoy en día atraviesa la señora Orfina es que a pesar que no posee recursos económicos para la compra de su mercadería ha acudido a Ceprodel para ser beneficiada con el crédito que le permita la compra de sus productos para así comercializarlos. Por esto es que ella espera muy confiadamente sabiendo que recibirá la aprobación para continuar con el mantenimiento de su hogar de habitación.

loans.use: Purchase of merchandise.

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for CEPRODEL - Oct 23, 2008)

loans.name: Tomas

texts.es:
The general store U. located in the municipality of Cinco Pinos in Chinandega is the business owned by the gentleman Tomas U. who offers his customers a variety of edible products such as sodas, beverages, candy, sweets and crackers. He has been running this business for several years with the intent of providing the daily support for his family. His children are very proud in having such a hard working father and help him take care of the business whenever they have the time available and are not in school such as on the weekends.

Mr. Tomas U. currently is in need to quickly acquire products for their sale. Since he does not have the financial resources he is seeking the support of Ceprodel and requesting a loan which will enable him to buy the beverages and candies that he can sell in his store. It is important to note that he is a loyal customer of the institution and has repaid previous loans on time and according to the established agreements.

Translated from Spanish by Laura Bobbit, Kiva volunteer.

La pulpería U. ubicada en el municipio de Cinco Pinos en Chinandega es el negocio propio del caballero Tomas U. que atiende ofreciendo los diferentes tipos de productos comestibles como gaseosas, bebidas, golosinas, caramelos y galletas. Desde hace varios años se dedica a este negocio con el propósito de proporcionar a su familia el sustento de cada día. Sus hijos se sienten muy orgullosos de tener un padre muy trabajador y por este motivo ellos también le ayudan en la atención del negocio cuando tienen el tiempo necesario y que no están en el colegio como son los fines de semana.

Actualmente la necesidad que el señor Tomas U. atraviesa es la pronta adquisición de los productos para su comercialización. Al no contar con el recurso económico busca el apoyo en Ceprodel y ha solicitado el préstamo con el que logrará la compra de las bebidas y golosinas para venderlas en su pulperia. Es necesario destacar que es fiel cliente de la institución habiendo cancelado los anteriores créditos en tiempo y forma de acuerdo a lo establecido.

loans.use: Purschase of beverages and edibles.

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for CEPRODEL - Oct 24, 2008)

loans.name: Hilda Ceferina

texts.es:
Mrs. Uriarte has been working with this institution for four years. Throughout this time she was able to receive seven loans, which have been used for her fruit and vegetable stand. She is married, husband does woodshop. They have two chidren who attend school.

Translated from Spanish by Maria Peterson, Kiva Volunteer.

La señora Uriarte trabaja con nuestra institución desde hace cuatro años obteniendo en este periodo siete creditos los que han sido dirijidos a capital de trabajo ya que ella tiene un tramo de venta de frutas y verduras en el mercado de Sutiava, es casada el marido se desempeña como albañil y trabaja por cuenta propia tiene dos hijos los que estudian.

loans.use: Purchase of fruits and vegetables

loans.name: Erenia Cecilia

texts.es:
Erenia has working with our institution for 4 years and has obtained 6 loans that have been used as working capital. In her house one can see that she has improved her quality of life and that her business has expanded. She is married and her husband works in a security company and contributes to the family expenses.

Translated from Spanish by a Kiva volunteer.

Trabaja con nuestra institución desde hace cuatro años donde ha obtenido seis creditos los que a utilizado par capital de trabajo, en su casa se puede ver que ha mejorado condiciones de vida así como el crecimiento de su negocio ella es casada su esposa trabaja en una empresa de seguridad y colabora con los gastos familiares.

loans.use: Working capital - purchase of basic grains, candy, soft drinks, cosmetics and other products.

loans.name: Victoria Zoraida

texts.es:
Zoraida has belonged to the communal bank "Nobleza" for three years. She is married, is 33 years old, and has one child. She runs a drug store where she also sells various gifts and vanity items. Zoraida is a professional obstetrician, and a few days ago she opened her own medical center in the same location.

Zoraida needs a loan for $1075 which she will invest in purchasing antibiotics. She will use her savings to increase her capital as well as to open another drug store.

Zoraida dreams of having her own clinic and making sure her son studies at a good university.

Translated from Spanish by Shannon Skoglund, Kiva volunteer.

Zoraida pertenece al Banco Comunal Nobleza hace 3 años.

Zoraida es casada, tiene 33 años y 1 hijo, Zoraida tiene una botica donde también vende artículos de regalo, tocador. Zoraida es de profesión Obstetríz y hace algunos días implementó un consultorio médico en el mismo local.

Zoraida necesita un préstamo de 3000 soles, dinero que será invertido en la compra de medicamentos antibióticos.

Sus ahorros lo utilizará para incrementar su capital e implementar otra botica.

Los sueños de Zoraida son tener una clínica y que su hijo se eduque en una universidad buena.

loans.use: Purchasing medicines and antibiotics for her new medical center and drug store.

loans.name: Lidia

texts.es:
Lidia has been a member of the communal bank "Azucenas" for 7 years. She lives with her partner, is 32 years old, and has two children. Along with her spouse, she sells shoes and new and used clothing. She has two stands in the "Las Américas" market. They also sell out of their home, both retail and wholesale. She obtains her merchandise in the city of Lima. Lida plans to begin a new business selling pottery.

Lidia needs a loan for $1075 which she will invest in buying vases, cloths, plates, and assorted pottery.

Lidia dreams of becoming financially stable in the future and of her business prospering.

Translated from Spanish by Shannon Skoglund, Kiva volunteer.

Lidia es socia del Banco Comunal Azucenas hace 7 años.

Lidia es conviviente, tiene 32 años y 2 hijos, Lidia junto a su esposo venden zapatos, ropa nueva y usados, en el mercado Las Américas, donde tiene 2 puestos, sus ventas también lo realiza en su casa al por mayor y menor. Su mercadería es adquirida en la ciudad de Lima. Lidia tiene proyectado iniciar un nuevo negocio de venta de Locería.

Lidia necesita un préstamo de 3000 soles, dinero que será invertido en la compra de vasos, cuadros, platos y locería variada.

Los sueños de Lidia son tener estabilidad económica para el futuro y que su negocio sea prospero.

loans.use: Purchasing vases, plates and other assorted pottery for her new business venture.

loans.name: Karin

texts.es:
Karin has been a member of the communal bank "Azucenas" for 10 years. She lives with her partner, is 32 years old, and has two children. Karin sells sweets and groceries out of her home, which located near a urban transportation business. Karin also works as a secretary for the transportation business.

Karin needs a loan for $725, money that she will invest in buying assorted cookies, soda, rice, sugar, and soap.

Karin dreams of being able to stock her business, of buying a car, and of having a computer for her children.

Translated from Spanish by Shannon Skoglund, Kiva volunteer.

Karin es socia del Banco Comunal Azucenas hace 10 años.

Karin es conviviente, tiene 32 años y 2 hijos, Karin vende golosinas y abarrotes en su casa, que esta ubicado cerca de una empresa de transporte urbano. Además Karin trabaja como secretaria de la empresa de transportes.

Karin necesita un préstamo de 2000 soles, dinero que será invertido en la compra de galletas variadas, gaseosas, arroz, azúcar y jabón.

Los sueños de Karin son surtir su negocio, tener un carro y una computadora para sus hijos.

loans.use: Purchase supplies for her grocery store, such as cookies, soda, sugar, and soap.

loans.name: Flor De Maria

texts.es:
Flor has worked with our institution for several years and started a borrowing group. She used to run her brother's hardware business but now she owns the business. She is a single mother and lives with her mother and her son who helps her in her hardware store.

Translated from Spanish by a Kiva volunteer.

La señora trabaja con nuestra institución desde hace varios años comenzo en grupo solidario y ella era la administradora de la ferretria de su hermano quien posteriormente le vendio la ferreteria y ahora ella es propietaria de la misma, es madre soltera vive con su mama y un hijo quien le ayuda en la ferretería.

loans.use: Working capital to buy products for her hardware store

loans.name: Redina

texts.es:
Redina has been a member of the communal bank "Azucenas" for three years. She lives with her partner, is 32 years old, and has two children. Redina sells footwear in the Chorro market, a job she has worked at for two years. She obtains her goods in the city of Lima. Before this, Redina sold groceries at markets, employment that she left behind because it didn't bring in enough income.

Redina needs a loan for 2000 soles ($725) which she will invest in purchasing men's and women's shoes.

Redina dreams of having a car to transport her goods to fairs and being able to send her children to school.

Translated from Spanish by Shannon Skoglund, Kiva volunteer.

Redina es socia del Banco Comunal Azucenas hace 3 años.

Redina es conviviente, tiene 32 años y 2 hijos, Redina vende calzados en el mercado Chorro, actividad que realiza hace 2 meses, sus productos son adquiridos en la ciudad de Lima. Anteriormente Redina vendía abarrotes en las ferias, actividad que dejo de realizar porque no le generaban ganancias.

Redina necesita un préstamo de 2000 soles, dinero que será invertido en la compra de zapatos importados de varón y mujer.

Los sueños de Redina son comprar un carro para transportar sus productos a las ferias y que sus hijos estudien.

loans.use: Purchase men's and women's shoes for sale in local markets.

loans.name: Maximiliana's Group

texts.es:
Justina, Maximiliana, and Yeny have belonged to the communal bank "Milenio" for six years, six years, and one year respectively.

Justina is married, is 34 years old, and has two children. She travels to fairs in the region where she buys grains to sell in the markets of Ayacucho and Pisco. She also works in a garage.

Maximiliana is married, 44 years old, and has six children. Yeny, on the other hand, lives with her partner, is 27 years old and has two children. Maximiliana and Yeny are street vendors in the market "Nery García."

Justina, Maximiliana and Yeny need loans for 300, 1000, and 750 soles ($750 total) which they will invest in quinoa, wheat, beans, potato, peas, and, in Yeny's case, in paying off her land.

The women dream of building a home, having a car, and having their children study to become professionals.

Translated from Spanish by Shannon Skoglund, Kiva volunteer.

Justina, Maximiliana y Yeny pertenecen al Banco Comunal Milenio hace 6, 6, 1 años respectivamente.

Justina es casada, tiene 34 años y 2 hijos, Justina viaja a las ferias de la región donde compra cereales que vende en los mercados de Ayacucho y Pisco. Además Justina trabaja en un garaje.

Por otro lado Maximiliana es casada, tiene 44 años y 6 hijos, Mientras que Yeny es conviviente, tiene 27 años y 2 hijos, Maximiliana y Yeny venden comida de manera ambulatoria en el mercado Nery García.

Justina, Maximiliana y Yeny necesitan préstamos de 300 soles, 1000 soles, 750 soles, dinero que será invertido en la compra de quinua, trigo, haba, papa, arveja, mientras que Yeny invertirá como parte del pago de su terreno.

Los sueños de Justina, Maximiliana y Yeny son construir su casa, tener un carro, que sus hijos estudien y sean profesionales.

loans.use: Purchase of various grains and foodstuffs for sale at markets, as well as making payments on their land.

payments.comment: Correction due to underpayment for business 46763

loans.name: Felix  Antonio

texts.es:
Mr. R. is an electrician and repairs electronic items, wiring, and sells materials refurnished electronics. He works with his son who is also an electrician. He's been a Kiva client for ten years and has been approved so far for twelve loans. With these past credits he's been able to improve his living conditionos. He is divorced and lives with his son.

Translated from Spanish by Maria Peterson, Kiva Volunteer.

El señor R. es electricista y se dedica a la reparacion de aparatos electricos, instalaciones electricas y venta de aparatos refaccionados, trabaja con su hijo quien tambien es electricista, es cliente nuestro desde hace diez años se le han otorgado doce creditos, en la casa donde vive ha mejorado las condiciones, es divorciado y vive con su hijo.

loans.use: Materials for work

loans.name: Teodosia's Group

texts.es:
Justina, Elizabeth and Teodosia have belonged to the communal bank “Milenio” (Millenium) for three, one, and six years respectively.

Justina lives with her partner, is 39 years old and has four children. She sells vegetables at a stand in the Market “April Twelve.” Additionally, Justina on occasion travels to the city of Lima where she buys vegetables and clothing, depending on the demand. She sells the vegetables in the goods market in the city of Ayacucho while she sells the clothing on credit.

Elizabeth also lives with her partner, is 21 years old and has one son. She sells food and fruit at various festivals in the area. She also works at a business that makes fruit juices.

Teodosia lives with her partner, is 39 years old, and has five children. She travels to the fairs in the region where she buys grains and baby animals to sell in the goods market in Ayacucho.

Justina, Elizabeth and Teodosia need loans for 900, 600, and 1500 soles ($1075 total) money that they will invest in purchasing celery, rice, sugar, apples, oranges, plantains, potatoes, and grains.

The women dream of building a home, studying a profession, and making their business grow.

Translated from Spanish by Shannon Skoglund, Kiva volunteer.

Justina, Elizabeth y Teodosia pertenecen al Banco Comunal Milenio hace 3, 1, 6 años respectivamente.

Justina es conviviente, tiene 39 años y 4 hijos, Justina venD. verduras en un puesto del mercado 12 D. abril. Además Justina en algunas oportunidades viaja a L. ciudad D. Lima D. donD. compra verduras y ropa dependiendo D. L. demanda, las verduras son vendidas en el mercado D. abastos D. L. ciudad D. Ayacucho, mientras que L. ropa lo venD. a crédito.

Por otro lado Elizabeth es conviviente, tiene 21 años y 1 hijo, Elizabeth venD. comida y frutas en las diferentes fiestas D. L. región. Además Elizabeth trabaja en un empresa D. elaboración D. jugos D. fruta.

Mientras que Teodosia es conviviente, tiene 39 años y 5 hijos, Teodosia viaja a las ferias D. L. región donD. compra cereales, animales menores y lo venD. en el mercado D. abastos D. L. ciudad D. Ayacucho.

Justina, Elizabeth y Teodosia necesitan préstamos D. 900 soles, 600 soles, 1500 soles, dinero que será invertido en L. compra D. apio, arroz, azúcar, manzana, naranja, plátano, papa y cereales.

Los sueños D. Justina, Elizabeth y Teodosia son construir su casa, estudiar una profesión y que su negocio crezca.

loans.use: Purchasing foodstuffs that they will sell in markets for their respective businesses

payments.comment: Correction due to underpayment for business 46765

loans.name: Maura

texts.es:
Maura has been a member of the communal bank Milenio for 6 years. She is 36 years old, and married with 2 children, 8 and 6 years old. Together with her husband, Maura makes a kind of bread typical to the region. They use a rented oven and sell their bread around the Santa Clara market.

She is requesting a loan to buy more flour, sugar and butter. She needs her savings to take care of necessities and to grow the business. Her dream is to have her own capital put aside to be able to improve their home and better educate their children.

Maura pertenece al Banco Comunal Milenio, Hace 6 años.

Maura es conviviente, tiene 36 años y 2 hijos de 8 y 6 años, Maura junto a su esposo panifican panes “chaplas” que son típicos de la región, actividad que realizan en un horno alquilado, sus ventas son realizadas en el mercado Santa Clara de manera ambulatoria.

Maura necesita un préstamo de 1500 soles, dinero que será invertido en la compra de harina, azúcar y manteca.

Sus ahorros son para alguna necesidad y para incrementar el capital de su negocio. Los sueños de Maura son tener un capital propio, construir su casa y sus hijos sean profesionales.

loans.use: TO PURCHASE FLOUR, SUGAR AND BUTTER TO MAKE THE BREAD THEY SELL IN THE MARKET.

loans.name: Karina

texts.es:
Karina has been a member of the communal bank MIlenio for 3 years. She is 22 years old, married, and has a 2 year old son. Karina travels to the markets in the region twice each week to buy cereal, cheese and small animals which she sells to shops and markets in the city of Ayachuco .
