In 2004, Ndigwaki established her cosmetics business. She now requires a loan in order to buy more stock of cosmetics in bulk. She thanks you for your support.

SELFINA is engaged in economic empowerment of women in Tanzania through leasing and leaseback facilitation as a practical way to achieve the economic and social emancipation of women.

SELFINA has taken a lead role as a pioneer of micro-credit in Tanzania through Micro-Leasing. Customs and traditions in Tanzania normally make it difficult for women to own land and assets, thus they are termed not-creditworthy by financial institutions as they lack tangible collateral assets. This leads to poor financial support, hence poor access to basic needs and services for women with low incomes.

SELFINA buys and leases equipment to women. Where a client needs working capital SELFINA buys equipment from said client, extending a loan to her, then leasing back the same equipment—a process called a sale and leaseback arrangement.

loans.use: To buy more stock of cosmetics in bulk.

loans.name: Zumra

texts.en: Zumra is a married housewife from Maglaj. Her husband has a job and he earns about 300 KM (around US$ 240) monthly. They have two children who go to school. This is her first loan in the amount of US$ 975 and Zumra will use it to buy seeds for the greenhouse. Her wish is to improve her production of vegetables and fruit in order to sell the produce at the market.

loans.use: To buy seeds

loans.name: Specioza Nambooze's Group

texts.en:
Specioza is the leader of 5 group members. She is 50 and married with 4 children. Their ages are 26, 17, 15, and 13. The last 3 are in school. The community she works and lives in is semi urban and a slum within an area that is prone to flooding in the rainy season.

She buys rolls of material, which she takes for designing to tailors at a fee for onward selling. There are stalls for charcoal, vegetables, and bananas for food, which she collects from the rural areas and sells retail and wholesale.

Her main challenges are the seasonality of the agricultural produce, high taxation and transport costs, and the floods in the rainy season. The stalls become inaccessible during the rains, and at the same time it becomes difficult for her to move around in order to sell the clothes. There is a ready market for the other merchandise.

She is able to pay rent and school dues and contribute towards fending for the family. She was also able to buy a piece of land.

Her plan is to build a house. Specioza has paid back more than 10 loans.

loans.use: Her plan is to build a house.

loans.name: Nusreta

texts.en: Nusreta is a housewife from the town of Derventa. She is married and she has 3 children. Her husband works and he is earning  around  600 KM (about US$ 480) monthly. Nusreta will use this loan in the amount of US$ 975 to renovate the space in which she is growing mushrooms. Her wish is to start up a business selling the mushrooms in order to earn additional money for her family.

loans.use: To renovate a space to grow mushrooms

loans.name: Velinka

texts.en: Velinka is a married woman from the town of Derventa. Her husband earns about 600 KM (US$ 500) monthly. Velinka will use this loan in the amount of US$ 500 to buy seedlings to grow flowering plants.  She wants to purchase bigger quantities of different seedlings and resell the flowers to flower shops. Her wish is to earn additional money  and fill her free time by working with flowers which she adores.

loans.use: To buy seedlings

loans.name: Sam

texts.fr:
Sam is a technician and his work consists of decoding and repairing cell phones. He is single and has no children but is the guardian of his nephews, of whom the eldest is no older than twelve. They all attend school. This loan is enabling him to renew his suppling stock of cell phone handsets.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

Sam est un technicien et son travail consiste à décoder et réparer des portables .Il est célibataire sans enfant mais a en charge ses neveux dont le plus âgé a moins de 12 ans et qui vont à l’école. Ce crédit lui permet de renouveler son stock de fourniture de pièces de portables.

loans.use: To renew his stock of cell phones

loans.name: Ismaila

texts.fr:
Ismaila S. is married and the father of five children, who all go to school. His principal business is poultry farming. He buys chicks that he raises to sell at market. He has 15 years of experience in this domaine.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

Ismaila S. est marié et il est père de 5 enfants qui vont tous à l’école. Son activité principale est l’aviculture .Il achète des poussins qu’il élève pour le revendre sur le marché.Il a une expérience de 15 ans dans ce domaine.

loans.use: To buy and raise chicks

loans.name: Antony

texts.en:
Antony I. is married to Julia Arguello. The couple lives in Luque with his four sons: Edgar (14), Jonhatan (12), Juan (11) and Luz (9). Since Antony has a big family, he needs to work very hard to feed them and to send his four children to school.

Twenty years ago, Antony started working in construction as a director. Today, he maintains the position. Antony has become a client of Fundacion Paraguaya when he contacted his friends and convinced them to form a committee of entrepreneuring men called “San Miguel”. Because of his punctual repayments in previous loans, Antony is considered a very trustworthy costumer by Fundacion Paraguaya.

Antony’s biggest wish is to finish the construction of his house. That is why he is requesting the credit.

loans.use: Purchase of materials and tools for construction.

loans.name: Betty Isabirye's Group

texts.en:
Betty is the leader of a group with 5 members. She is 43 and married with 4 children. All of them are of school-going age. The community she lives and works in is semi-urban.

She currently runs a maize mill after shifting from selling milk and bread a year ago. Her business depends on the clients who take their cereals to her for grinding.

The main challenges she is facing include lack of power, unstable prices of diesel, seasonality of cereals, dependence on clients for cereals, and high rent charges for the room in which she operates. She boasts of a better standard of living and the ability to contribute to the running of the home and to pay school dues as benefits from taking loans.

Her plans are to start buying maize for grinding, packing, and selling flour to the nearby army barracks. She also plans to extend electricity to her place of work so that she stops using diesel for running the mill.

Betty has paid back more than 7 loans.

loans.use: Her plans are to start buying maize for grinding, packing, and selling flour .

loans.name: Forba John

texts.en:
John N. is married with five children. He has been a man who struggled with poverty from childhood. Facing the costs of educating of his kids, he decided to work hard to give his family a higher standard of living.

With this new loan, he plans to invest in motorbike transport and pig farming. He knows his motorbike transport business will succeed because the service is sorely needed in his community. He has been farming pigs since 1998 and knows how to succeed in this business as well.

He plans to repay the loan in 24 months. The first installment is due on the fourth month from the date the loan is disbursed.

loans.use: Purchase of motorbike and piglets

loans.name: Adama

texts.fr:
Adama S. is a carpenter, single but responsible for one child. His workshop is in Camberene in a very well-placed location and he is asking for a loan to purchase wood to build a wardrobe which he plans to sell.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva volunteer

Adama S. est un menuisier, célibataire avec un enfant en charge.Son atelier se trouve à Camberene dans un local très bien placé et il sollicite un prêt pour acheter du bois pour la construction d’une armoire qu’il va vendre.

loans.use:
purchase wood to build a wardrobe to sell

Acheter du bois pour construction d’une armoire qu’il va vendre

loans.name: Arnaldo

texts.en:
Arnaldo Javier B. is a salesperson. The products he offers include: electronic devices, diaries, pencils and pens. Arnaldo goes into public transports such as buses, and there he sells his products to the travelers.

Ten years ago, he got married to Rosana Elizabeth. The couple has one son called Jonhatan. Arnaldo wants to send Jonhatan to primary school.

In 2006, Arnaldo contacted his friends and convinced them to form a committee of entrepreneuring men called “Las Avellanas de Luque”. That is how he became a client of Fundacion Paraguaya, which is very satisfied with clients like him who repay the credits punctually.

The money provided by the credit will be used for the purchase of diaries, pens, pencils, electronic devices, keyrings and others.

loans.use: Purchase of diaries, pens, pencils, electronic devices, keyrings and others.

loans.name: Issa

texts.fr:
Issa is married and is a trained metal-worker who has been in this business for 10 years. He has received an order for some iron doors and this loan will allow him to get them done in time to meet the delivery date stipulated in the contract.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva volunteer

Marié,Issa est un menuisier métallique qualifié qui exerce dans le secteur depuis dix ans .Il a reçu une commande de portes en fer et ce crédit va lui permettre de respecter le délai de livraison stipulé dans le contrat.

loans.use:
purchase iron for doors that are on order

Acheter du fer pour une commande de portes

loans.name: Artemio

texts.en:
Artemio V. (38) is married to Norma (31). The couple lives in Luque with his two school aged daughters.

Artemio worked previously in construction. But one day, his friend offered him a job opportunity as a company’s driver and he accepted the proposal. He took advantage of this experience and later on, with the savings from that job, he bought a car. That is how Artemio became a taxi driver. Nowadays, he owns a space in a taxi stand. Artemio wants to buy many cars in order to have an entire taxi stand in his neighborhood in the future. His desire is to leave a small company to his daughters to given them a secure income.

Artemio plans to sell his old car and, with that money plus the money provided by the credit, he wants to buy a new car.

loans.use: Purchase of a new car

loans.name: Mary Nansamba's Group

texts.en:
Mary is the leader of 4 members of a group. She is 38 and married with 4 children. They are 10, 12, 8, and 3, and 3 of them are in school. The area she lives and works in is a slum, and it is prone to floods in the rainy season. The community is semi urban.

Mary hires a vehicle onto which she loads the charcoal that is bought from the rural areas and distributes it in the neighborhood wholesale. She sells some of it retail.

Her challenges are the high transport costs, high rent charges, and working in the open, where her charcoal gets wet and she experiences the hazards of the weather.

Her achievements include improved standards of living and being able to pay school dues and rent charges.

She plans to construct a semi-permanent stall for her business and eventually move out of the low-lying area that is vulnerable to flooding.

Mary has paid back more than 5 loans.

loans.use: She plans to construct a semi-permanent stall for her business and eventually move out of the low-lying area.

loans.name: Esi

texts.en:
Esi N. sells foodstuffs. She is married and has four children. She wants to increase her income because her husband’s income is insufficient to meet the needs of the family. To do so, she needs more stock.

She is asking for $325 as additional capital to buy more foodstuffs for sale.

loans.use: To buy more goods for her food sales.

loans.name: Blasia's Group

texts.en:
Eight women who belonged previously to a Committee of Entrepreneuring Women decided to form a new one with their new friends and neighbors. They set up a meeting and invited many women from the town. There they shared with these women their previous experiences in the committee and explained to them how the committee changed their lives. Their hopeful words stimulated optimism among these women and they decided to form a Committee.

The Committee of Entrepreneuring Women is a program carried out by Fundación Paraguaya which targets groups of enterprising women who create a village bank through which they receive assistance in terms of loans. The main goal is to give them the opportunity to carry out economic activities which enable them to live in dignity and contribute to a better quality of life in their homes. Lending to poor women creates a cascading effect that brings social and economic benefits to a whole family, and thus to the entire community. What is more, the sense of belonging to a group gives these poor women members of a committee, the energy and motivation to reach success.

The committee is formed by 15 women whose entrepreneurial activities include: sewing workshops, grocery stores, carpentries, stationeries, bookshops, sales of food, drinks, chairs, lingerie, medicines and candies.

The credit provided will be used for the purchase of: fabrics, threads, wood, nails, cloth, shoes, chairs, medicines, candies and others.

loans.use: Purchase of: fabrics, threads, wood, nails, cloth, shoes, chairs, medicines, candies and others.

loans.name: Florence

texts.en:
Florence A. sells items such as clothing. She is married and has four children. Her husband’s income is not sufficient to meet the needs of the family. She wants to increase her income, but needs more stock.

She is asking for $225 as additional capital to buy more clothing and other goods for sale.

loans.use: To buy more clothing and other goods for sale.

loans.name: Fermina

texts.en:
Despite of her age, Fermina T. (60) keeps working as if she were a young girl. She has four sons who live with her.

Since 2001, Fermina has owned a fashion shop in a market known as “Mercado N4 de la ciudad de Asunción”. Each season, Fermina travels to Brazil to buy new trends of clothes to then sell in her fashion shop. The outfits Fermina sells include: t-shirts, jeans, cardigans, jackets, skirts and dresses.

It is worthy to mention that Fermina is an old client of Fundacion Paraguaya.

The money provided by the credit will be used for the purchase of clothes (mentioned above) for this winter-fall season.

loans.use: Purchase of winter clothes.

loans.name: Gladys

texts.en:
Gladys G. (51) is married to Ricardo Jiménez (53). The couple has two daughters. The oldest one is studying medicine in Cuba, and the youngest one goes to high school in Luque. Gladys' biggest dream is to see her oldest daughter with a doctor's degree and the youngest one going to college.

The family lived for a long time in Argentina where they owned a grocery store. Since they missed Paraguay and their relatives, they decided to come back to their home country.

After their arrival, Ricardo started working in a government entity. Meanwhile, Gladys is in the tourism business. She has a license for a bus company called “crucero del norte”. Gladys has a store where she sells bus tickets to different cities in Argentina, Brazil and Paraguay. Taking advantage of the opportunity, Gladys established a grocery store in the same place where she sells the bus tickets. The grocery store offers candies, drinks, bread and chocolates.

The credit provided by KIVA will be used for the purchase of products for the grocery store such as: candies, drinks, bread and chocolates.

loans.use: Purchase of products for the grocery store such as: candies, drinks, bread and chocolates.

loans.name: Sotera's Group

texts.es:
This committee is in its second round of the Committee of Enterprising Women Program. The Committee of Enterprising Women was developed by Fundación Paraguaya as a communal bank that offers credit to enterprising women. This program was formed with consideration for the economic, social, and personal needs of the poorest women in the country.

The group is made up of women who, beyond managing their households, also work to earn extra income. Some of these activities include: selling food, sheets, pots and pans, glasses, plates, drinks, jewelry, and clothes, among others.

In order to continue improving their earnings, these women are asking for a loan to purchase more merchandise to sell. These products will increase their earnings and savings for their children’s’ future, which is the principal motivation of these women.

Translated from Spanish by Sarah Bishop, Kiva Volunteer.

Este comité se encuentra actualmente en su segundo ciclo del Programa Comité de Mujeres Emprendedoras. El Comité de Mujeres Emprendedoras es un programa desarrollado por Fundación Paraguaya orientado a grupos de mujeres emprendedoras, las cuales crean una banca comunal y a través de la misma reciben que asistencia crediticia. Este programa presta atención a las necesidades económicas, sociales y personales de mujeres de menores recursos en el país.

El grupo esta compuesto por mujeres que además de administrar sus hogares, realizan actividades extras para generar mayores ingresos a la casa; entre las actividades podemos nombrar: venta de comidas, venta de mercaderías varias como sábanas, ollas, vasos, platos, venta de bebidas, bijouterie, ropas, entre otros.

Para poder seguir progresando y aumentando sus ingresos, ellas solicitan el crédito con el que podrán adquirir mayor stock de mercaderías para sus ventas; esto les permitirá aumentar sus ingresos y ahorrar para el futuro de sus hijos que son la principal fuente de iniciativa de estas mujeres.

loans.use: Purchase clothes, meat, flour, milk, noodles, jewelry, sheets, bedspreads, plates, candies, colas, yogurt, shoes, and crafts.

loans.name: Gouy Gui Group

texts.fr:
This request for a loan comes from the eco-village Keur goumak, which is located in the Diourbel region, Mbacké county, in the rural community of Dendey. This region suffers from isolation, but also from poor soil and brackish water. The population can only get their food supply at the weekly market (IOUMA) which is held every Wednesday. This loan will improve the quality of life of the population of the area by making varied foodstuffs available to them.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva volunteer

Cette demande de pret vient de l'écovillage de Keur goumak, situé dans la région de diourbel, département de mbacké, communauté rurale de Dendey. cette région souffre de son enclavement mais aussi de la pauvreté des sols et la salinité de l'eau. la population ne peut s'appovisionner en vivres que lors du marché habdomadaire (lOUMA) qui a eu lieu tous lel mercredis. Ce pret leur permettra d'améliorer la qualité de vie des populations en leur offrant une alimentation variée.

loans.use:
furnishing the population daily with reasonably priced basic foodstuffs

Approvisionnement quotitidien de la population en denrées de première necessité à bon marché

loans.name: Maria Cristina

texts.es:
María Cristina started her business to help herself economically because her husband is retired due to illness and doesn’t work, which is why she needed additional income for her children’s education. She began approximately six years ago and, because she has always enjoyed cooking, she started making tamales and selling them to her neighbors. Now she has a more established, small stand outsiD. her home. It’s a new neighborhood and on the weekends she sell tacos and hamburgers and continues to make tamales, but only to order. She is requesting a loan for $500, which she plans to repay in six months, to buy the ingredients she needs to make tacos and hamburgers.

Translated from Spanish by Hugh Yarbrough, Kiva Volunteer.

María Cristina inició el negocio para ayudarse económicamente porque su esposo esta pensionado por enfermedad y no labora, por lo que necesitaba mas ingreso por los estudios D. sus hijos. Inicio hace aproximadamente 6 años como siempre le ha gustado L. cocina comenzó haciendo tamales y vendiendo entre los mismos vecinos ahora ya puso un puestecito mas establecido en las afueras D. su casa como es una colonia nueva venD. los fines D. semana tacos hamburguesas y continua con los tamales pero ahora lo hace por pedidos.

Solicita un crédito por US $500 que pagara en 6 meses para L. compra D. ingredientes para L. venta D. los tacos y hamburguesas

loans.use: Purchase ingredients

loans.name: Maria Elena

texts.es:
Elena is the mother of three children and her husband works as a bricklayer. She learned her business because her husband had little work due to the fact that it was the rainy season and on rainy days he’s unable to work. Elena started about four years ago with a general store with very little merchandise to sell but has been growing little by little with the loans she receives. She also uses the money her husband contributes to invest in the store and only takes out what is necessary.

She is requesting a loan for $575, which she plans to repay in six months, to be able to offer cleaning products and add cold meats to her store. With your help Elena will get ahead.

Translated from Spanish by Hugh Yarbrough, Kiva Volunteer.

Elena es madre de tres hijos, su esposo trabajo como albañil, emprendió su negocio porque su esposo tenia poco trabajo ya que era tiempo de lluvia y como es albañil en esos días no se labora. Inicio hace aproximadamente 4 años con una tienda de abarrotes, con poca mercancía pero ha ido incrementando poco a poco con los créditos y además lo que le da su esposo también lo invierte en la tienda y de hay saca lo indispensable.

Solicita un crédito por US $575 que pagara en 6 meses para surtir artículos de limpieza y adicionar carnes frías a su tienda. Con tu ayuda Elena saldrá adelante.

loans.use: Purchase merchandise for general store

loans.name: Martina Isabel

texts.es:
Isabel started the business because she was pregnant and did not have insurance. She needed to pay the medical expenses and purchase the items that the baby will be needing. She started by helping a lady in the preparation of various food dishes. Later on she would sell the meals ( different stews, roasted cortadillo, stuffed chiles, tostadas, etc.) to offices and businesses and noticed that she was selling a lot. At that point she decided to go on her own, with the help of her children, providing the meals.

She is requesting a loan of USD $575 which she will repay in six months, to purchase the ingredients necessary to prepare a banquet for a wedding.

Translated from Spanish by Laura Bobbit, Kiva volunteer.

Isabel inició el negocio por que no contaba con seguro y estaba embarazada por lo cual necesitaba pagar los gastos médicos y las cosas que el bebe necesitara por lo que inicio ayudándole a una Sra. a la elaboración de los platillos. Después ella ofrecía los platillos en las oficinas y los negocios de diferentes guisos como asado cortadillo chiles rellenos tostadas etc.) y veía que vendían mucho por lo que decidió independizarse con la ayuda de sus hijos en la entrega de los platillos.

Solicita un crédito por US $575 que pagara en 6 meses para la compra de los ingredientes para la realización de un banquete para una boda.

loans.use: Purchase raw materials

loans.name: Luis Eduardo

texts.es:
Luis Eduardo started his business to help his parents with household expenses. He began approximately three years ago with the help of his older brother who works in the United States. His brother sends bundles of clothing and shoes for him to sell in order to have money to take care of their mother and to buy additional items for his store.

He is requesting a loan of $675, which he plans to repay in three months, to purchase undergarments for women and men.

Translated from Spanish by Hugh Yarbrough, Kiva Volunteer.

Luis Eduardo inicio el negocio para ayudar un poco a sus papas con los gastos de la familia. Comenzó hace aproximadamente 3 años con la ayuda de su hermano mayor que trabaja en estados unidos y el le facilita las pacas de ropa y calzado para que las venda y pueda tener ingresos para cuidar a su mama, además con esos ingresos complementa su tienda con artículos de mercería.

Solicita un crédito por US $675 que pagara en 3 meses para comprar mercancía, Ropa interior para dama y caballero.

loans.use: Purchase additional merchandise for used clothing store

loans.name: Djawagne Group

texts.fr:
Guédé is a village of 6000 inhabitants, of whom 3120 are educated, including those from surrounding villages. There are a middle school and two primary schools, but the inhabitants' crucial problem is the inaccessibility of a library. In other words, they have to go 30 kilometers to use a library. This makes it necessary to create a bookstore so that the people from these villages will be able to develop their intellectual capacities. This will also allow access to school supplies, improve the level of both students and teachers, and create jobs.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva volunteer

Guédé est un village de 6000 habitants dont 3120 intellectuels y compris ceux des villages environnants. Il y a un collége et 02 écoles primaires mais les populations font face au crucial probléme de l'inaccessibilité d'une bibliothéque. En d'autres termes, elles parcourent 30 Km pour accéder à une bibliothéque d'où la necessité de créer une librairie afin que les villageois et ceux environnements puissent accroitre leurs capacités intellectuelles, faciliter l'accès des fournitures à l'école, relever le niveau des éléves et des enseignants, créer des emplois

loans.use:
creation of a library (traveling bookstore)

Création d'une bibliothéque ( librairie ambulante)

loans.name: Jeunes Femmes 2 Group

texts.fr:
We are a group of women inspired by one ideal and one will. We want to work for the power of women to make decisions in their milieu. Our principal activity is commerce. We plan to buy fruits and vegetables and process them into a finished product that we can then sell to the local population at a reasonable price. This will allow us to lighten the load of the housewife, provide autonomy for women, try to stop the exodus of women, and improve living conditions for group members.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva volunteer

Nous sommes un groupement de femmes animées d'un même idéal et d'une volonté qui œuvrent pour le pouvoir de décision des femmes dans leur milieu. Notre principale activité est le commerce. Il s'agit d'acheter des fruits ét légumes et de les transformer pour avoir un produit fini que nous allons revendre à bon prix aux populations locales. Ceci nous permettra d'alléger le panier de la ménagère, donner une autonomie aux femmes, lutter contre l'exode des femmes, améliorer les conditions de vie de ses membres

loans.use:
purchase of fruits and vegetables for processing

achat de de fruits et légumes pour transformation

loans.name: Mankagno

texts.fr:
Mankagno D., 51 years old and married with 10 children in her care, is the president at the heart of the steering committee of the village bank of Kandé Banéto in Ziguinchor. She buys bananas in Balantacounda, an area renowned for the cultivation and sale of bananas, and then sells them in Ziguinchor. Mankagno has been running this business for five years and has always respected her financial arrangements. Her income allows her to participate in supporting her family. She is asking for a loan which will be reimbursed at the end of six months in one single payment.

Translated from French by Vilas Menon, Kiva Volunteer

Mankagno D., 51 ans, mariée, 10 enfants en charge est présidente au sein du comité de gestion du banc villageois de Kandé Banéto à Ziguinchor. Elle veut acheter de la banane dans le Balantacounda, zone réputée dans la culture et la commercialisation de la banane et vendre à Ziguinchor. Mankagno mène cette activité depuis cinq ans et à toujours respecté ses engagements.Ses revenus lui permettent de participer à l'entretien de sa famille. Elle sollicite un prêt qui sera remboursé au bout de six mois en une seule échéance.

loans.use: To buy bananas

loans.name: Natangué Group

texts.fr:
In order to combat the real effects of the phenomenon of illegal immigration, the women of Thiaroye mobilized themselves to form a group, which will allow them to acquire more finances. This will be used to transform seafood products and local cereals and to manufacture dolls. This will give the female victims of illegal immigration the opportunity to work and to meet the needs of their families, since many among them find themselves in a state of total disarray after having lost their sons or their husbands.

Translated from French by Vilas Menon, Kiva Volunteer

Afin de lutter contre la réalité du phénoméne de l'émigration clandestine, les femmes de Thiaroye se sont mobilisées à former un groupement. Ce qui va leur permettre d'acquérir des financements. Ceci leur permettra de transformer des produits halieutiques, des céréales locales, de confectionner des poupées pour donner aux femmes vicitimes du phénoméne de l'émigration clandestine, l'opportunité de travailler et de subvenir aux besoins de leur famille parce que beaucoup d'entres elles se sont sont trouvées dans le désarroi total aprés avoir perdu pour les unes leurs fils et les autres leurs maris.

loans.use: To buy material for the transformation of seafood products

loans.name: Idolina Margarita

texts.es:
I bought my home about a year ago but it is quite run down and I have been lacking some materials remodeling it. At the moment I don't have enough to cover the costs of repairs, and I'm requesting a loan of $1,200 to finish the job and be able to live in it.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer

Hace aproximado mente un año que compre mi casa. Pero esta algo deteriorada y le esta haciendo falta algunas detalles de remodelación a la casa. Por el momento no tengo la cantidad que se necesita para cubrir los gastos de la reparación. Solicito un préstamo de $1,200.00 dlls. Para terminar las reparaciones y poderla abitar.

loans.use: Repair and remodel home / Remodelación de la casa

loans.name: Juan Miguel

texts.es:
I'm very close to finish building my home. All I'm lacking is finish for the exterior and electrical panels. I'm requesting a loan of $1,200 to complete construction and thus be able to better protect my family.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer

Ya me esta faltando poco para terminar la construcción de la casa. Solo me esta haciendo falto los acabados del exterior y las protecciones. Solicito un préstamo de $1,200.00 dlls. Para la terminación de los acabados del exterior de la casa y así estará mas protegida mi familia, cuando yo no este en la casa.

loans.use: Complete finishing home's exterior / Terminación de los acabados del exterior de la casa

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for Fundación para la Vivienda Progresiva (FVP), a partner of CHF International - Oct 22, 2008)

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Complete finishing home's exterior / Terminación de los acabados en el exterior

loans.name: Jorge Alberto

texts.es:
I want to enlarge my home's ground more a little more, adding two rooms because space is quite constrained at the moment. I'm requesting a loan of $1,200 to begin construction of the two rooms so my home is larger and my family is better off.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer

Quiero ampliar un poco mas la casa en la planta de abajo construir dos cuartos ya que esta algo reducida y esta haciendo falta lago mas de espació. Solicito un préstamo de $1,200.00 dlls Para empezar la construcción de dos cuartos en la planta de abajo de la casa y así estar mas amplio y mejor para la familia.

loans.use: Enlarging home's ground floor / Ampliación en planta baja de la casa

loans.name: Teodora

texts.es:
I have already started building my home but I lack the materials needed to finish it. I need finishing liquids and bricks for some rooms. I'm requesting a loan of $1,2000 so I can complete construction.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer

Tengo ya tiempo que empecé a construir mi casa pero me esta faltando material para terminarla, me esta haciendo falto los acabados y la losa de algunos cuartos. Es por eso que solicito un préstamo de $1,200.00 dlls. Para terminar la construcción de la vivienda.

loans.use: Finish construction on her home / Terminación de la construcción de la vivienda

loans.name: Patricio

texts.es:
I need to build a room in my house for my children because my home is very small but I don't have the resources to build the room or hire help. I am asking for a loan of $1,000 to build a room and to pay for the labor. This way I will have more room in my house.
Translated from Spanish by a Kiva volunteer.
Me esta haciendo falta un cuarto para los niños ya que la casa esta algo reducida. Pero ya no tengo material y para pagar la mano de obra. Solicito $ 1,000.00 dlls para la construcción de un cuarto y pago de la mano obra. Y así tener mas espacio en mi casa.

loans.use: To build a room

loans.name: Maria Guadalupe

texts.es:
It has already been 2 years since we started building our has but we have not been able to finish it because we still need to put in the exterior finishings and flagstone. I am asking for a loan of $1,2000 to lay flagstone which is the most important because the rainy season is coming soon and my family will thus be protected.

Translated from Spanish by a Kiva volunteer.
Tengo ya casi 2 años que empezamos a construir la casa pero no hemos podido terminarla nos esta haciendo falta los acabados del exterior y losa para ya tener mi casa terminada. Solicito un préstamo de $1,200.00 dlls. Para la colocación de la losa que es lo más importante ya que se viene la temporada de lluvias y así  estará protegida en la familia.

loans.use: To lay flagstone in her house

loans.name: Maria De Lourdes

texts.es:
Thus far, alone, we have almost finished . But, there are a few details left. In order to finish the list of details, we need to finish making our ceramic floors. But, at this moment, we don't have the capital required to buy the ceramic floors. We are requesting a loan of $900 in order to buy and make the ceramic floors.

This story has been translated from Spanish to English by Nikita Ramchandani, KIVA Volunteer.

Ya casi tenemos la casa terminada solo nos esta haciendo falto algunos detalles. Para verla total mente lista uno de esos detalles es el vitropiso es el que nos esta haciendo mas falta, pero por el momento no contamos con el capital requerido para la compra y colocación del vitropiso. Es por eso que solicitamos un préstamo de $900.00 dlls. Para la comprar y colocación del vitropiso.

loans.use: To buy ceramic floors for the interior of the house.

loans.name: Sandra Erika

texts.es:
My house is not secure and it does not have barrier equipment. At this point in time, I would like to place protections on the windows and doors. I request a loan of $600 in order to put in place protections in my house to gain a little more security for my family.

This story was translated from Spanish to English by Nikita Ramchandani, KIVA Volunteer. Mi casa no esta nada segura le esta haciendo falta barias cosa pero por el momento solo me gustaría ponerle las protecciones de las ventanas y puertas. Solicito un préstamo de $600.00 dlls para la colocación de las protecciones en mi casa a así estar un poco más segura mi familia.

loans.use: To make protection barriers to her house.

loans.name: Nueva Iluminacion Group

texts.en: Maria D. P. is a businesswoman and mother of two young children, ages two and four, living in Samana, Dominican Republic. To support her family, she sells clothes. She started by selling them from her home and on the street, but with the help of previous loans, she now has a small stand where she sells blouses, jeans, dresses, and other garments. She has applied for another to loan to purchase new merchandise to expand her business. Ultimately, Maria hopes to finish her education and become a teacher. She would like to thank all Kiva lenders for their continued support and encouragement, and tell them God bless.

loans.use: To buy blouses, jeans, and dresses for a small clothing stand

loans.name: Jorge

texts.en:
Eight years ago, Jorge (32) got married to Nilda Pena. The couple has two sons; the oldest one is eight years old, and the youngest is 4.

Luque is famous for its artisans who make beautiful jewelry. There is a street in the center of the city full of jewelry stores. A typical Paraguayan jewelry is called “filigrana” and is made in Luque.

Jorge used to work in a supermarket selling meat, and in his free time he used to help his uncle designing and making jewelry. Fourteen years ago, he decided to open a jewelry workshop where he employed four poor people from his neighborhood. He sells his products to different jewelry stores. Jorge’s main goal is to open his own jewelry store.

The credit provided will be used for the purchase of silver and gold for the production of jewelry.

loans.use: Purchase of silver and gold.

loans.name: Ladislao

texts.en:
Ladislao R. B. is married to Ruth. The couple has two sons who are 16 and 19 years old.

Fifteen years ago, he started working in construction as a Director.

In 2006, Ladislao became a client of Fundacion Paraguaya when he formed a committee of entrepreneurial men. Because of his punctual repayments of previous loans, Ladislao is considered a very trustworthy customer by Fundacion Paraguaya.

He needs the money to invest in the purchase of raw materials and tools for construction.

loans.use: Purchase raw materials and tools for construction

loans.name: Maria Luisa

texts.es:
Senora Maria Luisa requests a loan in order to finish the exterior of her house. Thanks to God, she already has almost finished her home alone. She only has to finish the outside left. in order to protect her kids from the cold and rain. She asks for a loan of $1,200 dil to finish the outside of her house.

This story has been translated from Spanish to English by Nikita Ramchandani, KIVA Volunteer.

La Sra. Maria Luisa. Solicito un préstamo para los acabados de exterior de la casa. Gracias a dios ya casi tengo terminada mi casa solo me esta haciendo falta los acabados del exterior y así mi hijos ya van a estar protegidos del frió y las lluvias. Solicito un préstamo de $1,200.00 dll. Para los acabados de exterior de la casa.

loans.use: To finish the exterior of the house

payments.comment: correction due to overpayment for business 46940

loans.name: Aracelys' Group

texts.en:
Aracelys is a thirty-year old mother of two children who is fighting tooth and nail to make a living and improve her family’s living conditions. Her husband lives outsiD. the country and sends her money occasionally. Aracelys is an experienced businesswoman. She used to run a cafeteria in the past, but she had to leave that activity for a while as it was hard to have access to capital in order to keep operating the cafeteria. She says it was like fighting a losing battle.

Now, the entrepreneur wants to start over, but seriously. Together with four other women, she’ll take a loan which she’ll invest in the purchase of a variety of materials in order to operate the cafeteria. Aracelys had already rented a small locale where the café will be operated. She hopes that this new beginning will help her support her children's educations and to change her family’s life.

The others members of the group are: Gloria L. S., a women’s clothing retailer; Juliana A., to buy clothing in bulk to retail; Santa D. L. C., for a small café; Regina T. F., to sell materials for a beauty parlor.

Photo: from left to right: Aracelys, Gloria, Juliana, Santa y Regina.

loans.use: To start over a small cafeteria.

location.town: La Gallera, community of Santo Domingo

loans.name: Mujeres Unidas De Luque Group

texts.en:
The Committee of Entrepreuneuring Women called “La Esperanza” (hope) decided to amplify the number of members. They set up a meeting and invited many friends from the town. There they shared with these women their previous experiences in the committee and explained to them how the committee changed their lives. Their hopeful words stimulated optimism among these women and a new committee emerged - “Mujeres Unidas” (United Women).

The Committee of Entrepreneuring Women is a program carried out by Fundación Paraguaya which targets groups of enterprising women who create a village bank through which they receive assistance in terms of loans. The main goal is to give them the opportunity to carry out economic activities which enable them to live in dignity and contribute to a better quality of life in their homes. Lending to poor women creates a cascading effect that brings social and economic benefits to a whole family, and thus to the entire community. What is more, the sense of belonging to a group gives these poor women members of a committee the energy and motivation to reach success.

The committee is formed by 17 women whose entrepreneurial activities include: sewing workshops, grocery stores, hair salons, sales of cloths, perfumes, chipas, food, drinks, lingerie, medicines and candies.

The credit provided will be used for the purchase of: outfits, drinks, fabrics, threads, lingerie, meat, vegetables, oil, bread, napkins, natural medicines, bijouterie, flour, eggs, cheese, shampoo and others.

loans.use: Purchase of: outfits, drinks, fabrics, threads, lingerie, meat, vegetables, oil, bread, napkins, natural medicines, bijouterie, flour, eggs, cheese, shampoo.

loans.name: Janetakahealani

texts.en:
Janet is married and involved in making Elei prints (traditional Samoan fabric printing). She learned the skill from her mother and she decided to convert her skill into a business in order to earn some money. She joined our program and is applying for her first loan that will be used to buy all the materials needed to start up her business.

Janet sells her Elei clothing at the flea market in town or the small shops in her village. People who know her business come and place their orders with her. She expects this to be the first of several loans in order to improve her business and later to make improvements to her home.

loans.use: Purchase materials, paints, thread, etc.

loans.name: Katia

texts.es:
Katia has belonged to the Anabella Bank Communal for the past eight years.

Katia is a 41 year old single mother and has two children. She sells fish in the city of Andahuaylas at the Sunday fair. Her products are purchased at the fishing terminal in Lima. She also makes natural fruit juices at a stall in the F. Vivanco market.

She needs a loan of $1100 to purchase fish, seafood, soft drinks and fruit.

Katia dreams of her children becoming professionals, improving her business, and building a home.

Translated from Spanish by Amani R., Kiva volunteer.

Katia pertenece al Banco Comunal Anabella hace 8 años.

Katia es madre soltera, tiene 41 años y 2 hijos, Katia vende pescados en la ciudad de Andahuaylas en la feria dominical de la ciudad, sus productos son adquiridos en el terminal pesquero de la ciudad de Lima. Además Katia prepara jugos naturales de frutas en un puesto del mercado F. Vivanco.

Katia necesita un préstamo de 2000 soles, dinero que será invertido en la compra de pescados, mariscos, gaseosa y frutas.

Los sueños de Katia son que sus hijos sean profesionales, mejorar sus negocios y la construcción de su casa.

loans.use: To purchase fish, seafood, soft drinks and fruit.

loans.name: Constantina

texts.es:
Constantina has been a member of the AnabelL. Bank Communal for 3 years.

She is a single mother, 38 years old, and has two children. She sells potatoes, vegetables, grains and groceries in the Ayacucho jungle , distributing them wholesale and retail to several villages in the area. She plans to get loan to buy a motor taxi.

Constantina needs a loan of $1,100.00 to purchase a motor taxi and various vegetables.

Constantina dreams of having a stable business, raising her children, and improving her business.

Translated from Spanish by Amani R., Kiva volunteer.

Constantina es socia del Banco Comunal AnabelL. hace 3 años.

Constantina es madre soltera, tiene 38 años y 2 hijos, Constantina venD. papa, verduras, cereales y abarrotes en L. selva ayacuchana, reparte por mayor y menor en los diferentes pueblos D. L. zona. Constantina con el préstamo que obtendrá tiene proyectado comprar una mototaxi.

Constantina necesita un préstamo D. 3000 soles, dinero que será invertido en L. compra D. un mototaxi y diversas verduras.

Los sueños D. Constantina son tener una tienda estable, sacar adelante a sus hijos y mejorar su negocio.

loans.use: To purchase a motor taxi and various vegetables.

loans.name: Lucia Soledad's Group

texts.es:
Rita and Lucia have belonged to the Anabella Communal Bank for one year.

Rita is married, is 55 years old and has five children. She sells coats, handbags and shoes that she buys in the cities of Juliaca and Arequipa and sells them to company workers, friends and acquaintances.

Lucia is married, 43 years old and has four children. She has a gift, clothing and CD shop in the city of Cangallo which is located 4 hours from Ayacucho. Her products are purchased in Lima and Tacna. In addition, Lucia weaves sweaters on a machine.

Rita and Lucia need a loan of $500 to purchase leather bags, shoes, dishes, blouses, and clothing.

Rita dreams of her children becoming professionals, having a stable business, and being with her family; while Lucia dreams of expanding her business and building her home.

Translated by Amani R., Kiva volunteer.

Rita y Lucia pertenecen al Banco Comunal Anabella hace 1 año.

Rita es casada, tiene 55 años y 5 hijos, Rita venD. abrigos, carteras y zapatos que compra en las ciudades D. Juliaca y Arequipa, sus ventas lo realiza a trabajadores D. instituciones, amigos y conocidos.

Mientras que Lucia es casada, tiene 43 años y 4 hijos, Lucia tiene una tienda D. regalos y Cds, ropa en la ciudad D. Cangallo que se ubica a 4 horas D. la ciudad D. Ayacucho, sus productos son adquiridos en la ciudad D. Lima y Tacna. Además Lucia teje chompas a maquina.

Rita y Lucia necesitan préstamos D. 450 soles, 900 soles, dinero que será invertido en la compra D. sacos D. cuero, zapatos, platos, blusas y ropa.

Los sueños D. Rita son que sus hijos sean profesionales, tener un negocio estable y estar junto a sus hijos, mientras que los sueños D. Lucia son ampliar su negocio y construir su casa.

loans.use: To purchase leather bags, shoes, dishes, blouses, and clothing.

loans.name: Mario Jose

texts.es:
Mario lives in the Santa Rosa neighborhood. He is 42 years-old, married, and has four children who are 6, 8, 10, and 13 years old. His wife works as a domestic employee to help support the family. Mario sells school supplies and also does repairs and painting. He opened his business two years ago with his own money. He would like to own his repair shop rather than rent the space as he does now. In the future, he would like to buy tools for his repair shop. He would like to increase his income to have a better life.

Translated from Spanish by Joanna Silverman, Kiva Volunteer.

El Sr. Mario habita en el barrio Santa Rosa, tiene 42 años de edad, es casado le tienen cuatro hijos entre 6, 8,10 y 13 años de edad, su esposa trabaja como domestica para ayudar al hogar. El Sr. Mario vende artículos escolares y también trabaja en enderezado y pintura el comenzó su negocio con dinero propio y tiene dos años de experiencia. El préstamo lo quiere para instalar su taller en un local propio ya que el que tiene es alquilado. Sus planes a futuro es comprar herramientas de trabajo para el taller. Incrementar sus ingresos para tener un nivel de vida mejor.

loans.use: Opening of his Own Shop

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for AFODENIC - Oct 25, 2008)

loans.name: Betzabet's Group

texts.es:
Lourdes, and Denisse Betzabet have belonged to the Llamkasun ("We work" in Quecha) Communal Bank for 8 years, 8 years, and 1 year respectively.

Lourdes is married, 61 years old and has eight children. She has a small grocery store in her home.

Betzabet is married, is 40 years old and has four children. Betzabet and her family have a stable of dairy cattle in the district Chiara. Betzabet sells milk at night on a busy avenue in the city of Ayacucho and also distributes it to stores and homes. With this loan and her savings, Betzabé will begin selling groceries.

Denisse is married, is 27 years old and has three children. Denisse sells clothes maD.-to-order, which she offers to friends and acquaintances.

Lourdes, Betzabet, and Denisse need this loan of $850 to purchase milk, cooking oil, sugar, rice, noodles, and men's shoes.

Lourdes Denisse, and Betzabet dream of increasing their business, building their homes, seeing their children become professionals and having a laptop computer store. Lourdes, Betzabet y Denisse pertenecen al Banco Comunal Llamkasum que significa “Trabajemos” en quechua hace 8, 8, 1 años respectivamente.

Translated from Spanish by Amani R., Kiva volunteer

Lourdes es casada, tiene 61 años y 8 hijos, Lourdes tiene una pequeña tienda D. abarrotes en su casa.

Por otro lado Betzabet es casada, tiene 40 años y 4 hijos, Betzabet junto a su familia tienen un establo D. ganado vacuno que produce leche, en el distrito D. Chiara, Betzabet venD. la leche por las noches D. manera ambulatoria en una avenida concurrida D. la ciudad D. Ayacucho y además reparte a tiendas, a domicilio, Betzabe con el préstamo que obtendrá y sus ahorros iniciará con la venta D. abarrotes.

Mientras que Denisse es casada, tiene 27 años y 3 hijos, Denisse venD. ropa a pedido, que ofrece a amigos y conocidos.

Lourdes, Betzabet y Denisse necesitan préstamos D. 1000 soles, 450 soles, 900 soles, dinero que será invertido en la compra D. leche, aceite, azúcar, arroz, fideo, zapatillas D. caballeros.

Los sueños D. Lourdes, Betzabet y Denisse son incrementar su negocio, construir su casa, sus hijos sean profesionales y tener una tienda D. computadoras portátiles.

loans.use: To purchase milk, cooking oil, sugar, rice, noodles, and men's shoes.

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for FINCA Peru - Oct 22, 2008)

loans.name: Crecelia's Group

texts.es:
Crecelia, Catalina and Sonia have belonged to the Llamkasun ("work" in Quecha) Communal Bank for 6 months, 4 years, and 2 years respectively.

Crecelia lives with her partner, she is 28 years old and has three children. She sells meat wholesale to butchers and markets in the city of Ayacucho and travels to different markets where she buys animals and later profits from them. Crecelia also makes dried potatoes which she sells in the Grau Market.

Catalina is divorced, 44 years old and has three children. She has a well-stocked general store where she sells groceries, licorice, vegetables, and gifts. Catalina also sells cosmetics through a catalog and makes cakes for different events.

Sonia is married, 32 years old, and has two children. She has a well-stocked general store in her house. Sonia also sells cosmetics through a catalog and typical regional dishes on Sundays.

Crecelia, Catalina and Sonia need a loan of $900 to purchase goats, pigs, sugar, rice, cooking oil, and milk. Crecelia, Catalina and Sonia dream of having a restaurant, a beauty salon, children who are professionals, and a stable position.

Translated from Spanish by Amani R., Kiva volunteer.

Crecelia, Catalina y Sonia pertenecen al Banco Comunal Llamkasun que significa “Trabajemos” en quechua, hace 6 meses, 4 años, 2 años respectivamente.

Crecelia es conviviente, tiene 28 años y 3 hijos, Crecelia vende carne por mayor a las carnicerías y mercados de la ciudad de Ayacucho, Crecelia viaja a las diferentes ferias donde compra los animales y posteriormente lo beneficia. Además Crecelia hace papa seca que vende en el Mercado Grau.

Por otro lado Catalina es divorciada, tiene 44 años y 3 hijos, Catalina tiene una bodega muy surtida donde vende abarrotes, licores, verduras, regalos. Además Catalina vende cosméticos por catálogo y también prepara tortas para diferentes compromisos.

Mientras que Sonia es casada, tiene 32 años y 2 hijas, Sonia tiene una bodega muy surtida en su casa. Además Sonia vende cosméticos por catálogos y vende comida típica los días domingos.

Crecelia, Catalina y Sonia necesitan préstamos de 1000 soles, 450 soles, 1000 soles, dinero que será invertido en la compra de ganado caprino, porcino, azúcar, arroz, aceite, leche.

Los sueños de Crecelia, Catalina y Sonia son tener un restaurante, un salón de belleza, que sus hijos sean profesionales y tener un puesto estable.

loans.use: To purchase goats, pigs, sugar, rice, cooking oil, and milk.

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for FINCA Peru - Oct 23, 2008)
Correction due to overpayment for business 46949

loans.name: Hilda Maurina

texts.es:
Hilda has been a member of the Pure Life Communal Bank for three years. What she likes most about her communal bank is the training she receives.

Hilda is 45-years-old, married, and has four children. On Sundays, Hilda sells typical regional dishes in her home and sells beverages during the rest of the week. Hilda and her husband also travel to different regional fairs where they buy dairy cattle and later sell them in the city of Lima.

Hilda needs a $900 loan to purchase of cattle, beer, sugar, and rice.

Hilda's dreams are to have a big general store, to build a house, and for her children to become professionals.

Translated from Spanish by Amani R., Kiva volunteer.

Hilda es socia del Banco Comunal Pura Vida, hace 3 años. Lo que más le gusta de su Banco Comunal son las capacitaciones que recibe.

Hilda es casada, tiene 45 años y 4 hijos, Hilda vende comida típica en su casa solo los días domingos y los demás días venden bebidas. Además Hilda junto a su esposo viajan a las diferentes ferias de la región donde compran ganado vacuno y luego lo comercializan en la ciudad de Lima.

Hilda necesita un préstamo de 2500 soles, dinero que será invertido en la compra de ganado vacuno, cerveza, azúcar y arroz.

Los sueños de Hilda son tener una bodega grande, construir su casa y que sus hijos sean profesionales.

loans.use: Hilda needs a $900 loan to purchase cattle, beer, sugar, and rice.

loans.name: Gioconda Del Socorro

texts.es:
Mrs. Gioconda R. is 41 years old and lives in the neighborhood Reparto Shick. She is married and has two children, one that is 14 years old and the other 19. Both of the children are in school. Gioconda sells fried foods. She began working in the “La Union” supermarket, but now works in the “Pali” supermarket.

With the requested loan Gioconda plans to repair the roof of her home which is in serious need of repair before winter arrives. In the future Gioconda hopes to increase her living standards.

Translated from Spanish by Casey Unrein, Kiva volunteer.

La Sra. Gioconda tiene 41 años de edad, habita en el barrio Reparto Shick, es casada y tiene dos hijos uno de 14 y 19 años de edad que están estudiando. La Sra. vende fritanga y inicio en el supermercado La Unión, y ahora esta en el supermercado Pali.

Con el préstamo desea construir y componer el techado de su casa ya que lo tiene en mal estado y desea estar preparada para este invierno. A futuro espera tener un mejor nivel de vida.

loans.use: Repair the roof of her home.

loans.name: Vinarvin

texts.es:
Mr. Vinarvin is 35 years old and lives in the Ameritas neighborhood. He is married and has two children. His wife assists in covering the expenses by doing domestic work in other homes. Vinarvin has been working in an institution that handles government expenditures for four years.

With the requested loan Vinarvin and his wife would like to repair the roof of the porch of their home and prepare for the winter rains.

Vinarvin began his working life selling milk products, but when one of the owners offered him a different job he jumped on it. His living standards have been raised significantly, and in the future he hopes to provide even more for his family.

Translated from Spanish by Casey Unrein, Kiva volunteer.

El Sr. Vinarvin tiene 35 años de edad, y habita en el barrio las Ameritas no -2, es casado y tiene dos hijos, su esposa trabaja como domestica y así ayuda en los gastos. El Sr. M. es trabajador de una institución donde desempeña el cargo de Gastos Fiscales en donde tiene ya cuatro años de estar laborando. Con el préstamo quiere reparar el techo del porche de su casa y estar preparado para el invierno. El comenzó vendiendo productos lácteos y uno de los dueños le ofreció un trabajo diferente. Su nivel de vida ha mejorado a futuro espera a un lograr mas beneficios para su familia.

loans.use: Repairs to his home.

loans.name: Faustino

texts.es:
I have a house that does not have protection for the windows. I would like to put bars on all the windows, that way making my house more secure and protect my family in case of a burglary or against the insecurity that exists in my colony. For this reason I request USD $250, to be able to protect my belongings.

Translated from Spanish by Laura Bobbit, Kiva volunteer.

Cuento con una casa la cual no tiene protecciones en sus ventanas, quiero colocarle rejas en todas sus ventanas para así de esta forma darle mayor seguridad a mi vivienda y a mí y a mi familia en caso de algún robo o la inseguridad que hay en mi colonia, es por ello que solicito la cantidad de $250.00 dll. Para así proteger mi patrimonio.

loans.use: Installation of protection

loans.name: Sandra Yessenia

texts.es:
Sandra is 42 year old woman who works as a caretaker in the Rents Administration Building in Juigalpa. She begins work at 6:00 AM and finished as 3:00 PM. In order to earn additional wages, she spends her remaining hours selling clothing in a store owned by her brother.

Sandra is a humble woman. She is down to earth and loved by all of her friends. She is requesting this loan in order to build a room for her daughter.

Translated from Spanish by Casey Unrein, Kiva volunteer.

La sra Sandra de 42 años trabaja como conserje en la Administracion de Rentas de Juigalpa inicia sus labores a las 6 de la mañana finnalizando a las 3 de la tarde , el resto del tiempo lo utiliza para vender ropa de un negocio de su hermana obteniendo extra de ingreso para poder hacerle frente a la dificil situacion, es una persona humilde , sencilla y muy querida por sus compañeros , solicita el credito para comprar materiales para construir un cuarto para su hija

loans.use: Construct a separate room for her daughter.

loans.name: Reyna Isabel

texts.es:
Reyna is lives in the neighborhood of Laureles Sur. She is a 40 year old single mother. Her three beautiful children are twelve, ten and two years old. Reyna has owned a small convenience store for more than 8 years. She began this business with loans from communal banks. On the side, Reyna also washes and irons clothing for a few homes in the area.

She has had difficulties, but she has been able to overcome them. Unfortunately she was recently robbed. She is requesting a loan in order to invest in basic goods and restock her store.

Reyna is a woman with a great desire to better herself. She plan to make repairs to her home, grow her business and watch over the education of her children.

Translated from Spanish by Casey Unrein, Kiva volunteer.

La Sra. Reyna, vive en los Laureles Sur, es soltera, tiene 40 años de edad y tres hermosos hijos de 2, 10, 12 años de edad, soltera. Su negocio es una pulpería ya tiene ocho años de tenerla, comenzó con préstamos de Bancos comunales. Con dificultes ha sobresalido debido que le robaron, con esfuerzo logro instalarse de nuevo, el préstamo lo quiere para invertir en materia prima y reponer inventario. A demás doña Reyna lava y plancha en casa particulares es una mujer con deseo de superación en el futuro es hacer mejoras a su vivienda incrementar su negocio y velar por la educación de sus hijos.

loans.use: Purchase of products to restock her convenience store.

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for AFODENIC - Oct 25, 2008)

loans.name: Eveling Del Carmen

texts.es:
Eveling is a 33 year old single mother who lives in the “Laureles Sur” neighborhood. Her three children are fourteen, ten and two. Eveling works as a cashier in the large store La Curacao.

Eveling is requesting this loan in order to complete repairs on her home. She needs to replace a door, complete a wall and replace her roof (which is in serious need of repair).

Eveling's current dreams are to complete the construction of her home, educate her children and have a beautiful future.

Translated from Spanish by Casey Unrein, Kiva volunteer.

La Sra. Dávila es soltera con 33 años de edad, habita en el barrios los Laureles Sur, tiene tres hijos de 2, 10 , 14 años de edad. Ella trabaja de Cajera en la empresa La Curacao, y esta solicitando su crédito para cambiar una puerta, terminar una pared y cambiar el techo que esta en mal estado. En el futuro doña Eveling es terminar su casa donde vive educar a sus hijos y tener un buen porvenir.

loans.use: Home repairs

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for AFODENIC - Oct 25, 2008)

loans.name: Hilda Maria

texts.es:
Hilda is a 46 year old married woman. She lives with her husband in the “Spring” neighborhood. Her husband is a refrigerator technician how works in La Curacao. Hilda has three children. Her children are 10, 6 and 2.

Hilda is a domestic worker. She earns the majority of her wages in one specific home, and these wages are a major factor in covering the needs of her family.

Hilda requests a loan so that she can redo the roof of her home. The roof is currently in serious need of repair. She hopes that in the future her children will have good educations so that they can better their living standards and so that life will not be as hard on them.

Translated from Spanish by Casey Unrein, Kiva volunteer.

La Sra. Hilda tiene 46 años de edad, casada y habita en el barrio primavera, su esposo es técnico de refrigeración y trabaja en la expresa La Curacao. Ella tiene tres hijos de 2, 6 y 10 años de edad. Doña Hilda es domestica que se gana la vida trabajando en casa particular para salir adelante con las necesidades del hogar el préstamo lo quiere para cambiar el techo de su casa ya que esta en mal estado. En el futuro anhela que sus hijos tengan una buena educación para que mejoren el nivel de vida y no les toque tan difícil.

loans.use: Repair the roof of her home.

loans.name: Juan Carlos

texts.es:
Mr. Juan Carlos is married, has three children of 2, 14, and 18 years of age, lives in South Laureles and is 41 years old.

His wife is a housewife and he works as an insurance agent for a S. S. consulting company in Diriamba.

With the loan he will replace the roof of his house since it is in bad shape and he does not want to expose his family to getting wet. In the future he would like to build a house for his children and educate them to be good people in the community,

Translated from Spanish by Laura Bobbit, Kiva volunteer.

El Sr. Juan Carlos, es casado le tiene tres hijos de 2, 14 y 18 años de edad, el habita en los Laureles Sur y tiene 41años de edad.

Su esposa es ama de casa, el se desempeña como agente de seguridad en una institución del consejo S.S. de Diriamba.

Con el préstamo va a cambiar el techo de la vivienda ya que esta en mal estado y no quiere exponer a su familia a mojarse. a futuro es hacerles una casa a sus hijos y educarlos como personas de bien ala comunidad.

loans.use: Home improvement

loans.name: Elena's Group

texts.en:
Elena, a very responsible and budding entrepreneur, is the coordinator of a group of five women who live in the L. Gallera community of Santo Domingo. Elena is just twenty years old and a proud mother of two sons. She sells pants and blouses to women in her community. Biweekly, this entrepreneur travels outsiD. L. Gallera to other regions where she can get garments at very low prices.

Elena is asking for a loan to get clothing in bulk to add to her stock in order to augment her sales volume and, consequently, her revenue. That way, the entrepreneur will be able to ensure a better future for her family.

The other four member of Elena's group are: Yohana F. C., to buy clothing in bulk for a small business; Altagracia A. H., a tennis and shoes retailer; Romelia S. V., to buy clothing in bulk; EnmanueL. P., for a small cafeteria.

Photo: from left to right: EnmanueL., Romelia, Altagracia, Elena, Yohana

loans.use: Funds will be invested to buy clothing in bulk for a small business.

location.town: La Gallera, community of Santo Domingo

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for Fundación San Miguel Arcángel, Inc. (FSMA) - Oct 22, 2008)

loans.name: Gladys Felicita's Group
loans.use: To buy materials for a small beauty parlor.

loans.name: Eang

texts.en: Eang L. sells fish in Kampong Cham province. She is 39 years old and has been developing her business since 1996. Depending on business, she can make up to 5 US$ per day. Klei Chan, her husband, is 40 years old and working as a construction worker. He earns 4 US$ per day. They have five children still living in the famiL. home and one child who is married. Construction becomes a more and more difficult job as Klei Chan grows older and the famiL. wants to branch into a business the kids can help sustain in the parent's old age. They want to rent farmland to grow yams on and eventualL. hope to afford their own field. Klei Chan is pictured here as his wife was unavailable to photographed when CREDIT loan officers came to visit.

loans.use: To rent farmland.

loans.name: Sek

texts.en: Sek K. is 30 years old. Her family has been in Kampong Cham since 1980. She stays home to care for her two children while her husband works for a provincial logging firm. He earns 3.60 US$ per day. Rice prices are soaring in Cambodia mostly as a result of less and less of it being grown as farm land that is increasingly developed for other uses. Sek K.'s family wants to enter the rice farming industry by buying a small plot of land by their home. As she is currently unemployed and her children are getting older, she will have plenty of time to turn this into an additional source of income for her family.

loans.use: To buy farmland.

loans.name: Bun

texts.en: Bun C. is 32 years old. She has been running her small village grocery store since the year 2000. She earns about 1$ per day through this business. Her husband, Long Kolab, is 32 years old as well. He has a unique business as a potter, making jars, which has been handed down through the generations in his family. Since the end of the Khmer Rouge occupation of Cambodia in 1979 when he was only 2 years old he has been exposed to his family trade. He earns $3 per day. They have one child who is too small to attend school so he stays with his mother while she runs the store. With her loan, she hopes to purchase more groceries to increase her inventory. Right now she using her home to sell the goods from but would also like to apply her loan towards constructing a wooden stand by the roadside. Long Kolab is pictured here as his wife was unavailable to be photographed.

loans.use: To build a grocery store.

loans.name: Eam

texts.en: Eam T. is 44 years old. She is a truck driver who organizes shipping lanes between Kampong Cham province and the capital city of Phnom Penh. While her job is very important, she only earns 1 US$ per day doing this. Her husband also works the shipping lanes between the province and the capital but as a taxi driver. He earns significantly more to support the family. Of their three children only one is out of school. He works as a mechanic making 2 US$ per day. Eam T. would like to invest in a new taxi for her husband to use. His current car uses obscene amounts of gas and is economically inefficient for someone in the driving business. Cutting down on spending in this area would maximize his profits so that he may support his family easier.

loans.use: To buy a new car.

loans.name: Hun

texts.en: Hun S. is 32 years old and living in Kampong Cham. She sells groceries for a living earning meager wages at less than 1 US$ per day. Her husband's name is Sou Vanary. He is a professional carpenter. They have one child. She wants to take out a loan to put towards upgrading her grocery store business. She will expand her inventory to include products and produce desired by people in her village.

loans.use: To buy produce and grocery products

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for CREDIT, a partner of World Relief - Oct 23, 2008)

loans.name: Kheng

texts.en: Kheng D. is 23 years old, and lives with his wife and parents. He has one child. Kheng works at a garment factory while his wife provides for the family. At the end of last year, his wife, Oun Man got a bleeding cough which placed an extra strain upon him and the family. Kheng D. would like to start an extra business to earn more money to support his household and help provide the necessary care for his wife. Kheng owns a rice field as well, but unfortunately does not have enough money to purchase cows to sustain his land. The loan would be used to plow his land, and support his wife and family.

loans.use: To buy cows to use as a draft animal.

loans.name: Run

texts.en: Run S. is 37 years old, married, and has two children. Her youngest son is shown here with her. Run works at a stall in the largest city market, and earns around $3 in profits. The competition against other stalls in her area is extremely fierce. Her husband works in a garment factory and earns a total of $5 a day. Run runs her business by purchasing fresh produce from farmers and then distributing it to others in the city market. Run would like to purchase a motorbike to allow her to transport and purchase larger amounts of produce to sell, in order to increase her income and support her children’s futures.

loans.use: To buy a motorbike to transport vegetables.

loans.name: Seng

texts.en: Seng S. N. is 26 years old living in Kampong Cham province. She and her husband have complimentary businesses revolving around sugar palms. Sugar palms are a unique breed of palm tree specific to Cambodia. Her husband, Yon Nal, is a professional palm tree climber of sorts. He collects the raw palm juice from the top of each tree and gives it to his wife who sells the juice and also distills it into palm wine. Their combined revenue amounts to 5 US$ per day. As they already live out in the rural country side, and currently do not have any children, Seng S. N. would like to invest in a second business as a yam farmer. She would use this loan to start up this business and buy land.

loans.use: To rent farmland.

loans.name: Sok

texts.en: Sok S. is a 36 year old living as a housewife in Kampong Cham. Her husband runs a dry wall business operating within their own village and in the surrounding districts. Business is good and he earns $10 per day. They have one child as well. He wants to expand his business to also provide a well-digging service. He needs the start up capital for this venture to be able to afford expensive tools for deep-ground digging. Sok S.'s husband Tuk Thun is pictured here because his wife was unavailable to be photographed.

loans.use: To buy tools for digging wells.

loans.name: Savy

texts.en: Mrs. Savy H. lives in Kork Sandek Village in Kampong Spue province. She owns a plantation which she cultivates twice a year. She is 48 and is a widow with two children, all of whom are employed in a garment factory. The household relies on both her children salaries to support the family expenses such as food, wedding and funerals ceremonies.  Mrs. Savy H. has never obtained a loan before.  She now lacks money to work the plantation, so she has decided to request a loan to buy cows to plow the field.

loans.use: To buy cows to plow the field.

loans.name: Khem

texts.en: Mrs. Khem K., 54, is married with four children, one of whom is working in a garment factory while two others are working as construction workers. The youngest child is attending school. Mrs. Khem K. is a subsistence farmer in the Trapaing Taloung Village in the Kampong Speu Province. She already obtained a loan from AMK to buy a cow for breeding. In her plantation business, she had dough which made her crop not very productive during that period. In March 2008, her husband died of a liver disease. This, aside being a source of great sorrow, made the household economics decline. For all of these reasons, Mrs. Khem K. asked for a loan again to buy one more cow to use as a draft animal in order to plow her rice field.

loans.use: To buy a cow to work on the rice field as a draft animal.

loans.name: Try

texts.en: Try S. M. is 30 years old. She runs a traditional Khmer noodle shop. These are basically restaurants only open in the mornings that serve traditional Khmer breakfast noodle soups. These shops are a key facet of colloquial culture in Cambodia. Town and city folk often begin their days at the break of dawn socializing at these. She can earn 5 US$ profit daily. She has a niece who shares her business as well. Her husband is a taxi driver between Kampong Cham city and Phnom Penh. He earns about 6 US$ per day. They support two young children who have just recently entered school. Try S. M. has many investment plans she hopes to carry out. She wants to invest further in her own business; buying tables, chairs, and other needed items. She also wants to pay for her husband to get much needed maintenance done on his car so it will continue to run and be a good source of income. With the left over cash she wants to purchase a small plot of land which will be used by her relatives to plant yams.

loans.use: To invest in a restaurant and fix a car.

loans.name: Khy

texts.en: Khy N. is 34 years old. She and her husband live with her elderly father and their two young children in Kampong Cham province. She is a farmer in their village, while her husband works as a motor-taxi driver in the surrounding villages. Together they earn 4 US$ per day. Plowing fields by herself without anyone to help is a burdensome task for Khy N. and she wants to invest in a small tractor which will help her do her job. She will also make money off of this investment by loaning it out to other locals. If she can save enough money over time, she wants to buy a second plot of farmland to grow yams.

loans.use: To buy a tractor.

loans.name: Mok

texts.en: Mok S. is 68 years old. She lives with her husband, pictured here, and has six children. Most of her children have married and moved out of the house. Mok farms together with her husband, and earns a total of around $1 a day. Mok would like to invest in a water pump system to irrigate their crops, and cut down of the expense of using their neighbor’s pump, which is extremely far from Mok’s farm. Mok would use this money to further her farm and support her family.

loans.use: To buy a water pump.

loans.name: Yan

texts.en: Yan Y. is 28 years old living in Kampong Cham province. She runs a small restaurant selling Khmer style noodle soups. She earns 2.50 US$ per day profit through this businesser.  Her husband Tar Da is a vegetable farmer specializing in cucumbers. He can earn up to 2 US$ per day. They have five young children. Three are young and are not yet enrolled in school, but the oldest two are in primary school. Yan Y. wants to take out a loan to invest in water pipes for irrigation, commercial fertilizers, vegetable seed, and petroleum. All of these inputs will go into making her husband’s farm a more effective and well managed business. Tar Da is pictured here as Yan Y. was unavailable to be photographed.

loans.use: To buy farming inputs.

loans.name: Khin

texts.en: Khin P. is 34 years old. She earns 1 US$ per day as a mostly subsistence farmer in Kampong Cham province. Her husband works a few hours away in the capital city of Phnom Penh as a hotel security officer. Pheng Vy earns 2 US$ per day. They only have one child together who is still very young and will not enter school for another couple years. Khin P. has been able to manage her farm well and wants to buy more land to grow more rice and thereby expand her income.

loans.use: To buy farmland.

loans.name: Yeit

texts.en: Mrs. Yeit K. lives in Sambuor Village in Kampong Speu Province. She is 41 and married with two children, one of whom works as a construction worker while the other is studying in state school. Her husband, Vean Phat, is also a construction worker. Mrs. Yeit K. is a farmer who cultivates rice during the monsoon season and grows vegetables during the dry season.  She lacks animals for plowing, and because of the monsoon season coming, it is an immense problem. Since she does not have enough money to buy cows to plow, she asked for a loan. Her husband is on the left of the picture.

loans.use: To buy cows to use for plowing.

loans.name: Thuok

texts.en: Thuok S. is 45 years old. She is a vegetable salesman specializing in a Chinese vegetable called morning glory. She and her husband both work selling this unique product in markets earning 6 US$ per day combined. They have a large family of seven children. Three of their kids are already married. The four children still living inside the family home work to support their family. One is a garment factory worker and another is a hair dresser. The other two work part time jobs and attend school as well. Thuok S. is planning to open up a grocery store as soon as she can afford the investment. With any remaining money she hopes to support her daughter’s hair dressing business.

loans.use: To open a grocery store.

loans.name: Sreng

texts.en: Sreng C. R. is 27 year old widow. She has a business selling rice dishes and coffee on the street at a small café. She earns 6.50 US$ per day. She lives with her mother and her younger sister who run a small grocery store outside the home. She wants to manage some farmland in the more rural areas by purchasing it and then hiring local people to do the farming for her. She will grow yams and eventually hopes to expand the business to include future farming ventures. The loan would go towards purchasing yam seed, fertilizer, water pumps, and hiring the local people as well as buying the land.

loans.use: to buy farmland.

loans.name: Meng

texts.en: Meng R. is 49 years old and is living in Kampong Cham province.  She has been farming the land there since she was a child 1979 directly after the brutal Khmer Rouge regime ended in Cambodia.  Her husband, Va Chea, is also a farmer.  The two of them barely earn 2 US$ per day together. They have five children, four of who still live with their parents. One helps with the farm and another is a construction worker.  Together the family earns about 136 US$ per month for the seven of them. Meng R. would like to start a small grocery business fR. her home to sell basic groceries to others in the village.  She thanks you in advance for the loan.

loans.use: To buy groceries.

loans.name: Joshpen

texts.en:
Joshpen B. has been married for the last 17 years and has one daughter and one son. Her daughter attends school in standard ten and her son in standard seven. Joshphen runs a boutique and her husband has been a motor mechanic for 28 years.
